*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ninoska Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ninoska  Cecilia  tiene la actividad como es venta de ropa usada. Ella es casada y su esposo trabaja para ayudar a pagar los gastos del hogar. Aduce la señora que el crédito ha influido positivamente en su vida, ya que ha ido invirtiendo y ha logrado aumentar el nivel de su negocio, brindándole mayores ganancias. Algo que ha influido en el buen manejo de su crédito, es la buena administración de su negocio y a la reinversión que siempre ha realizado en el mismo. Afirma la señora, que pese a que su negocio ha crecido, ahora ha mejorado el ingreso de su familia, lo que le permite brindar mejores atenciones a sus hijos. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ninoska Cecilia has a business selling used clothing. She is married and her husband works to help pay the household expenses. She says that having access to credit has positively influenced her life, since she has been investing and has managed to increase the level of her business, providing increased earnings. With good business management and the reinvestment that she has always done, she has been able to manage her credit well. She states that even though her business has grown, she is able to provide better attention to her children because of the increased income that it brings to the family. The loan she currently requests will be used to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry C. U., tiene la edad de 29 años, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de frijoles. La idea es  preparar  el terreno para la siembra de frijoles y darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de frijol, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Henry  tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, el está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Henry C. U. is 29, single, and does not have children. He lives with his parents. He wants the loan for his bean crops. The idea is to prepare the land for planting the beans and to give the crop adequate maintenance. This is so that they will be ready to harvest. Then he will be able to sell them and get better earnings. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Henry has several years of agricultural experience, especially with basic grains. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant basic grains (beans)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of  Talon Gingoog City. She is 40 and married with five adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from selling both food and daily use products. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn G. is from the village of Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

 In 2008, Cherrylyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase goods for production and sales. 

Cherrylyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

       *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase goods for production.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Nignia

texts.en:
Nignia A. is 49 years old.  She is married, and her husband is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.

Nignia is currently in the business of selling bread and fried fish at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, tomatoes and onions to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S., from the village of Liwayway, Banisilan, Cotabato, is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a service-based business providing wedding services and the renting of wedding dresses to local community members. Engaged in her enterprise for over five years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that used to purchase materials needed to provide service, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in renovating the business. This will be Jocelyn's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco es un joven muy trabajador responsable que trabaja duro para mantener a su familia, el  se acerco a nuestras oficinas para poder solicitar un nuevo crédito, teniendo como destino la compra de mercadería en general (Azúcar, Harina, Aceite, Arroz, Conservas, etc.) esto para poder llenar y surtir su tienda de abarrotes, el cual recientemente  adquirió Debido a la nueva actividad económica y a venido trabajando de forma satisfactoria con la institución desde hace un tiempo atrás, su deseo del Sr. Marco es el de terminar sus estudios y poder asi mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco is a very hard-working, responsible young man who works hard to support his family. He came to our office to apply for a new loan, which will be used to buy general merchandise (sugar, flour, oil, rice, canned food, etc.) to fill and stock his grocery store, which he recently acquired thanks to the new economic activity. He has been working with our institution in a satisfactory way since some time ago. Sr. Marco's wish is to finish his studies and thus be able to improve the quality of life of his whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Josephine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Viviana Esther

texts.es:
La señora Viviana Elena vive en  el municipio  de Malambo, con su cónyuge y dos hijos en las edades de15 y 17 años. Desde hace 20 años inició un negocio de comercio, actividad que aprendió de su mama desde muy niña cuando vivía en Soledad, otro municipio muy cercano a Barranquilla. Una vez se mudo a malambo , inicio este mismo negocio allí, vendiendo inicialmente calzado , ropa y artículos que le suministraba su mama, pero muy pronto aprendió a elaborar sus propias artesanías en foamy, madera, porcelanicron y arte country y decidió comercializarlas, como prueba piloto y le fue muy bien , pero aun no tenía suficiente capital para responder a sus pedidos,  fue así como se acerco  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y accedió a  su primer crédito por valor  de$ 1.200.000 COP con este financiamiento adquirió mercancía variada, como ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos y también le alcanzo para comprar materias primas y fabricar sus hermosas artesanías;  asi fue como logro aumentar un poco su capital de trabajo e  independizarse de su madre. 
Gracias al negocio puede responder a los gastos del hogar como a la educación de sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo al sostenimiento de esta familia; su credikiva es el segundo y con el comprara laminas de foamy, lencería calzado, pintura y ropa, porque aprovechara la temporada de mayor repunte de sus ventas como el fin de ano donde las familias adornan sus viviendas,  anunciando que ya viene  las navidades, el ano nuevo y se visten elegantemente para esperarlo.
texts.en:
Viviana Elena lives in the municipality of Malambo and she lives together with her two children, aged 15 and 17. Since she was 20 years old she started her business. She learned the business from her mother since she was a young girl when she lived in the city of Soledad, another municipality near Barranquilla. When she moved of Malambo she started her business there. She started out by selling shoes, clothing and other merchandise and the business was overseen by her mother. Later she learned to make crafts out of crafters foam, wood, porcelain and using other media and she decided to start selling. The pilot project was successful but she didn't have enough capital to fill the orders she received so she sought out Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) for their support. She accessed her first loan in the amount of 1.200.000 COP and with it she purchased a variety of products, including clothing, shoes and ladies' accessories. She had enough money to purchase materials to make her beautiful crafts. This is how she managed to supplement her working capital and to make herself independent from her mother. Thanks to her business she has been able to cover the house hold expenses and her children's education costs; she was able to contribute with her husband to the family's support. This loan is the second she requests and with it she will purchase sheets of crafters' foam, sewing materials, shoes, paints, and clothing. She will endeavor to take advantage of the holiday season at the end of the year when the sales are the highest. Every family enjoys decorating their homes, in preparation for Christmas. Equally they prepare themselves for New Year's Day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheets of crafters' foam, sewing supplies, shoes, paints, and clothing.

loans.name: Solie Dominguez Group

texts.en:
Solie D., from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is the 31-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Solie, who is married and has two school-aged children, owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Solie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her fifth loan for 9000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Solie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
ViolaT. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Viola has had a hotel and bar business for three years. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase food and more drinks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Viola hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Viola hopes to expand her hotel business.    Viola is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by exercise classes during club activities.

loans.use: food and more drinks

loans.name: Gladys Janneth

texts.es:
Gladys Janneth M. M. tiene 21 años. Es casada vive el esposo y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.  Tiene 1 hijos.

Gladys pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Gladys  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Gladys Janneth M. M. is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband and child in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She has one child.

Gladys is a member of the Guantucoto Communal Bank, which is located a half hour from Guaranda. This group engages in farming and ranching, especially corn and potato production in the mountainous areas as well as in the coastal region where rice is grown. The Communal Bank has 25 members.

Gladys has been farming for several years, growing potatoes and corn. She also raises and sells livestock animals. Gladys buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and potatoes. With the help of this loan, she will have the financial resources to acquire necessities for her family. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that can impact her crops. Her dream is to purchase both a vehicle and a house.

Gladys enjoys going for walks.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing potatoes & corn

loans.name: Irma Elena

texts.es:
Irma tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a su familia en el sector Garcés del distrito de José Leonardo O., una zona urbana caracterizada por ser una de las más pobladas de la región, también es una de las más pobres, la mayor parte de su pobladores se encuentran concentrados en zonas urbano marginales.

Se dedica desde hace treinta años a la venta de verduras en el Mercado Moshoqueque, el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ella adquiere su mercadería de los comerciantes que vienen a dejar sus productos en el mercado, luego los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los comerciantes minoristas. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre se ha esforzado por mantenerlo.

Irma desea adquirir mas verduras para ampliar su negocio y responder de mejor modo a la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y responsable. Sus conocidos la consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Irma is 57 years old and lives with her family in the Garcés sector of José Leonardo O. district, an urban area which is noted for being one of the most densely populated in the region.  It is also one of the poorest.  Most of its residents are concentrated in marginal urban areas.

Irma has been selling vegetables in Moshoqueque market, the city's wholesale market, for thirty years.  She acquires her merchandise from traders who come to leave their products in the market, then she sells them on to the general public and to retail salespeople.  Her business is an important source of income for her family which is why she has always worked hard to maintain it.

Irma would like to acquire more vegetables to expand her business and better respond to the demand which she has.  For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the sum of 1,000 nuevos soles which will help her to achieve her goal.

Irma is quite an active and responsible woman.  Her acquaintances consider her to be a trustworthy woman who is always in search of ways to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to expand her sales business in the market

loans.name: Koffi Nicola

texts.fr: Nicolas a 32 ans  et a en charge 3 ans. IL est marié à une coiffeuse de profession.  Il est né à Lomé et habite Nukafu où il a son atelier.  Pour s'occuper de ma famille, il exerce le mécanique et a associé la vente de pièces détachées. Il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite dans son atelier.Il cumule dans cette activité 5 ans déjà. IL sollicite un nouveau crédit pour augmenter son commerce
texts.en: Nicolas is 32 years and has a 3 year-old in his care. He is married to a hairdresser. He was born in Lomé and lives in Nukafu where he has his workshop. He works as a mechanic and also sells spare parts to support his family. He gets his supplies at the Lomé Grand Market and then sells them in his workshop.  He has operated this business for 5 years. He is requesting a new loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ndeeba Tukorerehamwe Group

texts.en: T. Charity, with hand raised, is the leader of Ndeeba tukorerehamwe group in Kihihi. She is 28 years old and married with two children aged 7 and 5, and has been in the business of selling rice in Mizimera trading centre for two years. She started the business with capital from agriculture and because she is hard-working and cooperative, she has been able to specialize and she is benefitting from that. She is able to make KSH50,000 in weekly profits and she hopes it will continue increasing. She needs a loan to stock more sacks of rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica Domínguez Ramírez vive en la comunidad de Moyotepec, municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 52 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es Topógrafo y tiene 5 hijos Leonardo tiene 32 años de edad trabaja es ingeniero, Juan Carlos tiene 31 años de edad trabaja es Técnico en informática, Dulce María tiene 30 años trabaja es Licenciado en relaciones públicas, Israel tiene 26 años trabaja es licenciado en economía, Rodolfo  tiene 15 años está estudiando en el CBTIS de Cd. Ayala, La señora Verónica concluyó la educación básica y estudió una carrera comercial de secretaria ejecutiva. Su crédito lo va a utilizar principalmente para surtir su negocio, va a comprar medicamento de patente. Se entero de los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad por una amiga que la invitó. Ella tiene una farmacia en su localidad, en ella además de vender medicamentos, también vende productos de perfumería, ropa de bebe y regalos. Su negocio se llama Farmacia “Mega”, tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años. Anteriormente trabajaba en una farmacia en Cuautla, la gente que la conocía le recomendaba abrir una farmacia en su localidad, hasta que finalmente con la ayuda de su hermana establecieron la primera farmacia de la localidad, y entre las dos cuidaron el negocio y ya después le ayudo a su hermana a poner la suya. También tuvo un restaurante en su localidad pero lo quito porque no pudo contratar gente que supiera del negocio.
Ella renta un local que está a 200 metros de su casa, todos los días se traslada caminando hasta su negocio. Ella Considera importante su establecimiento porque tiene mucha comunicación con la gente, además de que le sirve de distracción y gana dinero. La parte que más le gusta de su negocio son las ventas, ella desde chiquita ya vendía en la casa de su mamá, era un terreno grande y había muchos árboles frutales, ella juntaba la fruta de los árboles en una canasta y salía a vender y el dinero se lo daba a su mamá para que comprara algo sabroso para comer. A los 14 años ya comparaba refrescos y los vendía a fuera de la casa de su mamá [después] me fui para Jalisco y comenzó a comprar manteles, sabanas, almohadones, servilletas que allá conseguía muy baratos y aquí les sacaba buena ganancias salía a Cuautla en el parque Zapata a vender su mercancía, Siempre le han gustado el negocio de las ventas
Su trabajo le da gran satisfacción porque puede comprar lo que ella quiere y le enorgullece decir que su trabajo saco adelante a sus hijos y los ayudo a tener una carrera universitaria. Sus clientes habituales son sus propios vecinos, en promedio atiende entre 20 y 30 personas de todas las edades al día. Sus clientes le compran porque saben que los trata bien y es por eso que su negocio es reconocido en la localidad. En la actualidad se han establecido otras dos farmacias en su localidad pero menciona que no le afecta mucho. Las ganancias de su negocio las invierte principalmente en mantener las existencias de medicamento de su negocio, además de pagar la renta del local y pagar un empleado, El préstamo de KIVA lo va a utilizar principalmente para comprar medicamento de patente y comprar una vitrina para exhibir peluches para regalos. Ella tiene sus planes y esperanzar de hacer unos locales para pasar su Farmacia y ya no pagar renta, las mejoras que desea lograr para el fututo de su hijo el pequeño son que siga estudiando y tenga una carrera, ella se siente feliz con el préstamo por qué va a surtir su negocio. Algunas de sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA son “les agradezco que puedan ayudarnos con este préstamo, para mejorar los negocio. El pueblo de Moyotepec le gusta porque aquí nació y aquí creció es de clima cálido, siembran caña, frijol, cebolla, milpa.
texts.en:
Verónica Domínguez Ramírez lives in the community of Moyotepec, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 52, married to a surveyor, and they have 5 sons and daughters: Leonardo, 32 who is an engineer, Juan Carlos, 31 who is in information technology, Dulce María, 30, who is in public relations, Israel, 26, who is an economist, and Rodolfo, 15, who is studying in the CBTIS of Ciudad Ayala.  Verónica finished basic education and studied to be an executive secretary.  She will use her loan to supply her business. She is going to buy patented pharmaceuticals.  She began with KIVA loans and Fundación Realidad through the invitation of a friend. She has a pharmacy in her neighborhood, and she also sells patented pharmaceuticals, perfumes, baby clothes and gifts.  Her business is called Farmacia (Pharmacy) Mega and she has had  it for 15 years.  Previously she worked in a pharmacy in Cuautla.  People who knew her suggested that she open a pharmacy in her area until finally, with the help of her sister, they established the first one.  Between the two of them they handled the business and then she helped her sister open one for herself.
They also had a restaurant in the area but they closed it because they couldn’t find people who knew about the business.
She rents a store that is 200 meters from her house and every day she walks over to her business.  She considers her business very important because she gets to meet and talk with many people, it serves as a distraction, and she earns money.  What she most likes about it are the sales.  From the time she was little she sold from her mother’s house.  It was a big lot and there were many fruit trees.  She would gather the fruit  from the trees in a basket and go out to sell, and then she would give the money that she made to her mother so that she would buy something delicious to eat.  When she was 14 she was buying soft drinks and selling them outside of her mother’s house.  Later “I went to Jalsico and began to buy blankets, sheets, cushions, and napkins that I could purchase very cheaply and I would make good money when I went to Zapata park in Cuautla  to sell the merchandise“.  
She has always liked sales. She gets a lot of pleasure from her work because she can buy what she likes and she is proud to say that it has moved her sons and daughters ahead and helped them study for careers in the university.  Her regular customers are her own neighbors.  On the average she sees about 20 to 30 people  of all ages every day.  Her customers buy from her because they know she treats them well and that is why her business is known throughout the area.  Now there are two other pharmacies that have opened there  but they don’t really affect her business.  She uses the money that she makes mostly in keeping up her medicine supply, to pay the rent, and to pay an employee. She will use the KIVA loan to buy patented pharmaceuticals and to purchase a showcase for the stuffed animals that she sells for gifts.  She has her plans and hopes to builf her own pharmacy so that she won’t have to pay rent any more. The best will be that her youngest son continues studying and have a career.  She feels happy with the loan because it will supply her business.  Some of her words for the KIVA team are “I appreciate that you help us with the loan to improve the business.  The town of Moyotepec likes it because the business started here and grew here. Moyotepec has a hot climate, they grow sugar cane, beans, onions, and corn.

loans.use: To buy patented pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es: Rebeca tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante con su familia. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad. Ella sabe que tiene que ofrecer sus productos a una gran variedad de clientes, pues es de manera ambulante que realiza la venta. Es por eso que realiza este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca has a great desire to get ahead in life together with her family.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 17 years and, through a lot of hard work, she has managed to make progress.

Rebeca is a very enterprising person and she enjoys her work.  She knows that she has to offer her products to a wide range of customers as she makes her sales door to door.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies she needs for her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Hualtaco II  de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

José se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde muy joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 
br>
El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and lives with his family in the Hualtaco II sector in the town of Tambogrande.  This is a farming district that is in the Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

José has worked in farm-related jobs since he was very young.  He raises livestock, especially sheep, in stables near where he lives.  He feeds them grain and natural fodder.  When they are fully grown he sells them to merchants who visit the area frequently.

He wants to buy more animals and balanced diet feed to expand his business and increase earnings.  He decided to apply for a loan for 2000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative to help him reach his goal.

José is a hard worker and his dream is to continue growing as a businessman so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Aydelina

texts.es: La señora Aydalina M. Silva de 53 años se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, churros, tortillas, ropa desde hace 4 años. Ella desde muy jóvenes ha trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores y han crecido.
texts.en: Mrs. Aydalina M. Silva, 53, has been selling nacatamales, churros, tortillas and clothes for four years.  She has worked hard since a very young age to support her two children who are now grown up adults.

loans.use: For food.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Esperanza C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, jovial y emprendedora originaria de Managua. Esta señora de 66 años desde muy joven se ha salido a ganarse el pan de cada día y hace dos años que tiene una pequeña venta.
Ella con el crédito comprara arroz, azúcar, café, aceite…etc.
texts.en: Gloria Esperanza C. is a hard-working, pleasant, and enterprising woman from Managua.  She is 66 years old and from a very young age has gone out each day to earn her daily bread.  For the past two years she has had a small store.  She will use the loan money to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab S. is 51 years old and lives with his big family in the villageof Shalauri, Kakheti Region. Zurab’s family consists of six persons: Himself, his wife, his 19-year-old daughter, his 22-year-old son and his pensioner parents. 

Zurab’s family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they own a vineyard and sell grapes to winemakers in season.  They also sell dairy products from their three milch cows in a nearby town. Zurab works as a taxi driver as well; he uses his car for this. In addition to the above-listed activities, Zurab brings logs from the forest to sell. He uses his horse for transportation of the logs. 

With the requested amount, Zurab plans to purchase calves and raise them. He plans to sell the raised calves after 6-7 months, in the fall, for a higher price. He hopes that his profit will positively influence the family’s income, as Zurab plans to use the profit for expansion of the mini-farm through purchasing additional milch cows.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando nació en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Fernando vive en misma ciudad donde nació, él es una padre trabajador que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos, el es guía de turismo y trabaja en la agencia “Chaska Travel”. La agencia ofrece servicio de turismo por el Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Ciudadela de Machupicchu y Valle Sur. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Fernando en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar la oficina de la agencia de viaje y desea comprar equipos de camping, carpas, utensilios y otras cosas más.
 
Fernando es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Fernando was born in the charming city of Cusco and he is 41 years old.  He currently lives in the same city in which he was born.  He is a hard-working father who gets his four children ahead in life.

Fernando is a tourist guide.  He works in the "Chaska Travel" agency.  The agency offers tourist services for the Sacred Valley of the Incas, the Citadel of Machu Picchu and the Southern Valley.  Fernando has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, he requires a loan to equip the travel agency office.  He would like to buy camping equipment, tents, utensils and other items.

Fernando is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa's 'Sumac Purisisun' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy camping equipment, tents, utensils and other items

loans.name: Mariana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

La señora Mariana es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera y está muy contenta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras del grupo.
 
Tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos adoptivos que los quiere como propios, el uno ya mayor de edad y una chica de 17 años que estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella es maestra jubilada y ahora se dedica a al comercio, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la que también vende electrodomésticos y productos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y su hija le ayuda en las ventas. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio 12 años.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y ciertos artículos de bazar.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for its delicious sweet treats which are prepared by the locals and which are well known throughout the country.  The people are very warm, kind and hard working.

Mariana is a founding member of her community bank.  She is the treasurer and is very happy to have been given this responsibility by her fellow group members.

Mariana is 62 years old, married, and has two adopted children who she loves as if they were her own.  Her son is already grown up and her daughter is 17 and studying in high school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Mariana is a retired school teacher who now works as a saleswoman.  She has a grocery store in her home where she also sells small household appliances and other household items.  She works every day from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  Her daughter helps her to serve her customers.  She tells us that she has been in this business for 12 years.

Mariana will use this loan to buy essential food products to stock her store.  She will also buy certain household items to sell.

Mariana's dreams are to continue working and to grow more in her business.

loans.use: to buy essential food products and other household items

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y crianza de cerdos, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, es soltera y cuenta con el apoyo de su padre y hermanos para realizar las labores de campo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos pequeños, esta inversión le permitirá ampliar la granja y en un futuro sus ventas mejoraran.
Ella aspira ser una comerciante en grande, potencializar su negocio de cerdos, tener más clientela y que su familia este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Ángela lives in Santa Elena, Usulután Department.  She raises livestock, farm and raises pigs.  She lives with her parents and two siblings.  She’s single and her father and brothers help her with the field chores.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets.  This investment will help her enlarge her farm so that future sales will improve.  She aims at being a large merchant, enhancing her pig selling business, having more customers and seeing that her family is in good condition.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rincón De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Rincon de la Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias señoras de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, con el objetivo de sentirse utiles a si mismas y a su familia, cada una cuenta con sus pequeños emprendimientos, son personas muy optimistas y tratan por todos los medios de cumplir con sus compromisos con ellas mismas ya que de eso depende el progreso. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas de ropa interior, ropas, también son modistas.
La señora Esmilda, por ejemplo, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en materiales para su negocio, pues ella es modista y confecciona ropas de acuerdo al pedido de sus numerosos clientes, y utilizará el dinero para mejorar sus servicios, de esta forma Esmilda pretende seguir adelante y ayudar a su familia, siempre cooperando activamente con el comité.
texts.en:
The “Rincón de la Esperanza” (Corner of Hope) was formed thanks to the coming together of several women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso with the goal of feeling useful to themselves and their families.  Each of them has her own small enterprise.  They are very optimistic people who try by all means possible to keep their commitments to themselves since this is what progress depends on.  All the group members carry out independent activities like: underwear sales, clothing sales and they are also dressmakers.

Esmilda, for example, is asking for the loan to buy supplies for her business.  She’s a Dressmaker and makes clothes to order for her numerous customers.  She will use the loan to improve her service.  Esmilda intends to continue forward helping her family while always actively cooperating with the committee.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Susan has a business selling fruits, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. In the future, she hopes to build a house of her own.
Susan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 17 février 2001. Ledit groupe est  constitué de dix huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diarra qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce d'huile de palme. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  son activité de vente de palme afin de prétendre à des bénéfices plus importants.

Les profits générés  lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group has been created on February 17, 2001. The group is composed of 18 women from the same neighborhood. Their main business activity is retail.

Mrs. Diarra, on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the group’s leader. She is 57 years old. She is married without children. She sells palm oil. This loan will allow her to bolster her capital and to grow her business in order to achieve a higher income. The generated profits will allow her to improve the life conditions of her family (healthcare, food, clothing etc...) as well as increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 49 years old and is married.  He runs a dressmaking business in Mikindani, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last 25 years and has been a success. 

Festus has been a KADET LTD client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase fabric materials and thread.    The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. Festus' dream is to open a fabric materials and thread college.

loans.use: buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has seven children. In 2006, K. opened a greengrocery shop, where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. K.'s store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
K. is requesting a $1,200 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Davila Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Dávila está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Meyling Francisca quien se dedica al comercio de frutas al inicio hace ocho años aproximadamente empezó comprando los productos por libras en la actualidad compra las cosechas de tamarindo, mango, jocote y mamón...etc.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 10 y 5 años y una bebe de ocho meses por los cuales labora arduamente junto a su esposo y suegro. Ella ahora comprará limón y aguacate. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Modesta Francisca de 19 años, Milagro de Jesús  de 37 años y Alba de 30 años quien se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras de acuerdo a la temporada.
texts.en:
The “Dávila” group is composed of four hard working, enterprising people.  The coordinator is Meyling Francisca who is a fruit merchant.  When she started out about eight years ago she started buying fruit by the pound.  Now, she buys entire crops of tamarind, mangoes, jocote (common names include Red Mombin, Purple Mombin, Hog Plum, Sineguela, and Siriguela), mamón (Spanish lime), etc.

She has three children, a ten-year-old, a five-year-old and an 8-month-old baby, that she works very hard for together with her husband and father-in-law.  On this occasion she’ll buy lemons and avocadoes.

The other group members are Modesta Francisca, 19, Milagro de Jesús, 37, and Alba, 30, who are merchants selling seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy lemon and avocado crops.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David  nació en la comunidad de el Torno es soltero, el se dedica a la agricultura tiene su terreno en los Limos a  10 km de Santa Rita el siembra arroz, yuca, y un poco de verduras para el consumo familiar. Pero todo lo que el siembra saca a vender mercado de la localidad,  es primera ves que saca crédito de Emprender el vive de la agricultura, a través de la siembra de sus productos el logro conseguir su parcela desde hace 3 años y desde entonces se  que se dedican a la agricultura, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado d ela tierra y la compra de semillas para la siembra de arroz y yuca,  el Sr. David es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. David was born in the community of El Torno. He is single and devotes himself to farming. He has his land in Los Limos, ten kilometers from Santa Rita. He grows rice, yucca, and a few vegetables for family consumption. But everything he grows he takes to sell at the area market. This is his first time taking out a loan with Emprender and he earns a living by farming. 

By growing his products he was able to obtain his own plot of land three years ago, and since then has devoted himself to farming. He will use the money from the loan for preparing the land and purchasing seeds for planting rice and yucca. Mr. David is a very hardworking person, and appreciates the institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: for planting rice and yucca.

loans.name: 3.12.70 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phương operates a food stall selling processed food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Phương is 34 years old and she is married with two children. Phương is the group leader of the 3.12.70 Thieu Hoa solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

This is Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demand for services.

In future, Phương hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena, vive en una localidad, en la que es muy bonita ya que ay una laguna muy grande que muchas personas visitan, ella es casada con el señor  Bulmaro y con quien  procreo  un hijo que aun esta a su responsabilidad.
Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como, aceite, carne, maíz, hojas de guineo, para la  elaboración de tamales, en donde lleva practicando   un año y ocho meses, en la que comenta que le va bien ay que con ello ha visto un buen resultado  en su  ganancias.

    Su  motivo a esta actividad fue su familia para así y  tener lo más necesario y para apoyar a su esposo en los ingresos de su hogar, así también  cubrir algunos gastos que se generan en su pequeña familia.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda  aumentar sus ingresos para  apoyar a su hijo en su crecimiento y educación  ya que  tiene muchos deseos  de estudiar para ser un gran profesionista.

   Las personas que  integran en el  grupo son las siguientes: la señora Brigada quien  invierte el préstamo en la compra  y venta de pollo, así también está la señora  Candelaria invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de maíz, la señora  Inés  invierte el préstamo en la compra de café para venderlo molido, la señora Zoraida invierte el préstamo en medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magdalena lives in a beautiful town that boasts a large lagoon that many people come to visit.  She is married to Mr. Bulmaro and they have a son still in their care.

She is a homemaker requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as oil, meat, corn, and banana leaves to make tamales.  She has been in this activity for a year and eight months and says business is going well and producing a good profit.

The reason she got involved in the business was to provide for her family and help her husband cover the household expenses.

What she wants most through her work is to increase income so she can help her son develop and get a good education and become a professional.

The members of the group are:  Mrs. Brigada who will use the loan to buy and sell chicken, Mrs. Candelaria who will use the loan to buy and sell corn, Mrs. Inés who will buy coffee to grind and sell, and Mrs. Zoraida who will buy natural medicines.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in active farming for 8 years and currently employs two farmhands. Peter is age 36 and married with two children who are ages 3 and 8. His farm produces milk, pineapple and tea for the local market. He laments of poor markets for the farm produce.

Peter has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. He says the transport business will improve his family's living standards since his income will be better as he makes deliveries to the market more cheaply.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 44-year-old woman. She is married and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sabah wants to make repairs to her house including painting and changing doors and windows. However, because of her husband's decent salary, she hasn't enough money to pay and needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Sabah takes the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for making repairs to her house and live in better conditions with her family. Sabah is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for repairing her house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a 37-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. She has been selling beauty products in the Philippines for the past 13 years and also earns income from operating a sari sari store and providing electronic re-loading services.

Having previously borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF, Florence is requesting a new one for PHP 25000 to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, para la remodelación del negocio, solicita nuevamente un préstamo, y lo invertirá en láminas, tubos, alambres, estos materiales serán usados en la ampliación del local.
Estos préstamos le han dado a María, un mejor negocio, con aumentos en las ventas, y en este caso ampliara el local para atender un número mayor de clientes y mejorar así sus ingresos.
El progreso de Maria y de su familia se debe a la buena administracion de los prestamos.
texts.en: María is once again requesting a loan to do some remodeling in her business.  She will buy metal sheeting, tubing and wire that will be used to enlarge the locale.  These loans have improved María’s business; sales have increased.  On this occasion she will enlarge the locale so that she can tend to a larger number of customers and improve her income.  The progress of María and her family is due to the good management of the loans.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, tubing and wire.

loans.name: Lamech

texts.en:
Lamech is a 28 year old man. He is married and they have two children who are aged 1 year and 3 years old. They hope to give a good education to their children up to the university level. He runs a pharmacy which is located at the busy Maasai lodge area in Rongai. 

He has been running this business for three years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He hopes to grow his business and make income to sustain his family. 

He describes himself as honest and responsible.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings, snacks and coconut wines. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy spices, food seasonings and snacks.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and snacks

loans.name: Indrid Cenelia

texts.es: Originaria de la Trinidad municipio de Estelí, con tan solo 27 años de edad, encontramos Ingrid  una humilde pero sencilla joven que se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas, lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual inicio cuando repartía tortillas para las diferentes comideria en el pueblo, ella es casada y madre de dos pequeños de 5 y 1 año de edad, este negocio le permita estar cerca de sus hijos y cuidar de su hogar además de generar ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar maíz que su principal materia prima elaborar  tortilla y leña para vender tener otros ingresos para su hogar. Le gusta trabajar y emprender en su negocio es por ello que uno de sus planes es poner una comideria y tener en lo futuro ayudantes para brindar trabajo a las mujeres de su pueblo.
texts.en: Originally from Trinidad, a municipality of Estelí, Indrid, 27, is a humble, simple young woman who makes and sells tortillas.  She has been in business for three years and started out by delivering tortillas for different eateries in the town.  She is married and the mother of two youngsters, ages 5 and 1.  Her business allows her to be close to her children and take care of the home while generating an income for the family's well-being.  She is requesting the loan to buy corn, the main ingredient for the tortillas, and firewood to sell for extra income.  She enjoys working and plans to open an eatery in the future  and provide work to local women by hiring them to help her.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SIRENACHAYOC”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana;  La socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos, La socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de especias; la socia tiene en el mercado su stand y le va muy bien, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de mas especias para implementar su negocio; la socia implementara su negocio para mejorar sus ventas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Juana, 44, belongs to the “Sirenachayoc” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She’s a spice merchant.  She has a stand in the market and she does very well.  She wants to use the loan to buy more spice to stock her business; she will stock her business in order to improve sales.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more spices.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane 48, is a single mother of three children, two of whom have finished school while one still attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a butcher shop, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cow meat for sale at the butcher shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cow meat for sale at the butcher shop.

loans.name: Muchachas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Es el primer ciclo del banco de emprendimiento Muchachas Emprendedoras,  la presidenta es la Sra. Nelly  trabaja con   una tienda que esta instalada en su casa donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad,   el crédito solicita para comprar mercadería de temporada  ya que necesita productos como refrescos, galletas panetones y roscas navideñas, ya que esta época incrementa su mercadería,  tiene dos hijos que están en colegio, ella esta separada del esposo  la casa donde vive esta en construcción y trabaja bastante para poderla terminar y brindar mayor comodidad a su hijos, La Sra. Nelly es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora ya que se esfuerza por sus hijos que dice la Sra. son su mejor tesoro, La Sra. Nelly se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: This is the first loan cycle for the community bank "Muchachas Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women).  The president is Mrs Nelly.  She works at a store located in her home, where she sell basic needs products.  She is requesting the loan to purchase seasonal items, as she needs products such as beverages, crackers, cakes, Christmas rolls.  This season her merchandise needs increase.  She has two children that are in school.  She is separated from her husband.  The house in which she lives is under construction and she is working very hard to be able to finish it and provide more comfort to her children.  Mrs. Nelly is a hard working and go-getting woman that strives very hard for her children who are,as she says, her best treasure.  Mrs. Nelly is happy and grateful for the opportunity that this loan will bring to her.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, crackers and cakes to supply her store.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela, es socia de Finca hace 2 años.
En todo el tiempo que ha estado en Finca Perú pudo aprender mucho, ella se esfuerza cada dia para ser mejor y salir adelante con sus hijas, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder comprender que siempre tiene que esforzarse para poder cumplir sus metas, Finca le ayudó y pudo comprarse un carro. El préstamo que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la cancelación de su carro y se irá a la ciudad de Lima para comprar ropa y llevarla a la selva.
texts.en: Celia’s a member of the “Marcela” communal bank and has been a member of Finca for two years.  In all the time she’s been in Finca she’s been able to learn much.   The training helped her to understand that she must always strive to reach her goals.  Finca helped her to buy a car.  The loan she’s requesting now is to pay off her car and to go to the city of Lima to buy clothes to then take to the jungle to sell.

loans.use: to pay off her car loan and to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Benkadi Viii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du BENKADI VIII sont es femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles traditionnelles à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt DJABA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est un jeune de 24 ans qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il a acquis une expérience de cinq ans dans ce domaine et possède une cantine dans le marché qu’il ouvre de 8h à 21h 30m. Avec le crédit octroyé, il compte acheter des téléphones portables et des radios pour revendre. Il possède une clientèle régulière qui fait la commande avant qu’il ne s’approvisionne.
Il participe de temps en temps à la dépense de la famille mais pas tout le temps car les revenus de l’activité ne sont pas réguliers.
S’il a les moyens, il désire augmenter le nombre de ses cantines et fructifier l’activité.

loans.use: acheter des radios et des téléphones portables pour revendre

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en: Hanady is now in her third year at the university majoring in International Relations and Strategic Studies. Her husband is ‎retired form his work with his low pension, therefore she is applying to another loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees. ‎Hanady is eager to work in her study field after getting her Bachelors.‎

loans.use: To pay for upcoming semester

loans.name: David

texts.en: DAVID L. lives in Yombo-Vituka in the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children. Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. David owns a small pharmacy near his residence selling human medications. He has six years' experience in this business. His business is licenced by the authorities. He frequently faces shortages of medications for malaria and water contamination diseases like cholera, typhoid, and amoebiasis. The situation is intense, especially during the rainy periods. Dar es Salaam is now in the rainy season. He is in need of $750 to replenish his stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock of medications

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kakuu would like to buy six steers.

loans.name: Sunbulla

texts.en: Sunbulla S. is 46, married and has four children. She is a very successful business owner and her store is always full of customers. In her small store she sells perfume and wedding accessories. She borrowed a $1200 USD loan to rent a larger place for her store, and she plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make her store even bigger and better.

loans.use: Mrs. Sadiqova would like to rent a larger place for her store where she sells perfume and wedding accessories.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan M. is a 32-year-old married man who is the owner of a flock of sheep. He is from Khoshchobanli village near Imishli town, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Sultan has 2 children. He has seven years' experience in his business.

With money he had saved up, he purchased 6 sheep and 3 goats to raise and sell in 2006. Mutton is in high demand in Azerbaijan, and so his business brought him good income. Autumn and winter are the high season for purchasing mutton, but summer and autumn are also time for wedding parties where much meat is needed. Sultan has decided to borrow US$ 1200 to buy seventeen additional sheep. The estimated cost of one sheep is about $70.

loans.use: purchase 17 sheep to expand his flock

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel considers himself a fighter and a very responsible person that is not afraid of working. He is single and he started his own business because he did not have a stable job and he needed something to live on. A close friend advised him to sell clothes, and that is how in 2005 he started selling clothes among his acquaintances and later on he started selling door to door and that way he got a client base and improved his business. He now wants to expand his business.

Miguel is asking for a $475 loan in order to buy clothes for the next season which will be colder and that way be able to offer better products to his clients and increase his sales, offering to pay back the loan in 4 months. He is very thankful for the support that he is given so that he can get ahead and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel se considera una persona muy luchadora, responsable y que no le tiene miedo al trabajo, él es un hombre soltero, el empezó su negocio por que no tenía un trabajo fijo y necesitaba hacer algo para poder vivir, por lo que escucho el consejo de un amigo cercano que le sugirió que se dedique a la venta de ropa y fue así como en el año 2005 el comenzó vendiendo ropa entre sus amistades y poco a poco fue vendiendo de casa en casa y así se fue haciendo de una cartera de clientes y a la vez fue mejorando su negocio, ahora el desea continuar con su negocio y llegar a hacerlo crecer.

Miguel esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para poder comprar ropa para la temporada que viene que ya comenzará a hacer más frío y así poder ofrecer buenos productos a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Él esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante con su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand business

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia is 38 years old. Her level of education is some high school. She has 4 children, of whom 3 are dependent on her. She is a very dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in Manuel Arévalo in the district of La Esperanza, the province of Trujillo and the department of La Libertad.

Many years ago, Julia worked selling clothing that she bought wholesale in Lima. Later she had the opportunity to win during several consecutive years the bidding for the concession to sell sweets and juices in a primary school.

Currently Julia has a store in which she sells gifts, toys, writing supplies, etc. She is a member of the community bank "Santa Elena II" , through which she received her first loan of 100 Peruvian sols ($33) with which she bought office supplies to add more variety to her inventory.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for 800 Peruvian sols ($266), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy decorative items and toys to replace the merchandise that was stolen a short time ago and additional products that sell well during the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Julia tiene 38 años de edad, con grado de instrucción superior incompleta y con 4 hijos (actualmente 3 dependen de ella) es una señora muy dinámica y trabajadora, vive en Manuel Arévalo en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Ella hace muchos años se dedicaba a la venta de ropa que compraba en Lima al por mayor para a vender por unidad, posteriormente tuvo la oportunidad de ganar varios años consecutivos la licitación para vender golosinas y jugos en el kiosko de un colegio.

Actualmente la señora Julia tiene una tienda en la que vende regalos, juguetes, adornos, útiles de escritorio, etc. La señora julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Elena II” en él obtuvo su primer crédito de S/. 100.00 ($33) con los que compró útiles de oficina para surtir su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.800.00 ($266), el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, está comprando algunas cosas como: adornos y juguetes para reponer la mercadería que le fue robada hace poco y porque son productos que tienen mucha salida en las fiestas de fin de año que se aproximan.

loans.use: Buy decorative items and toys.

loans.name: Abun

texts.en: Abun is a 37-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, vegetables etc., and she usually earns $17 per week. Her husband, U., has no regular income. Abun requests a loan to buy some goods to fill the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Abdul Aziz

texts.en: Abdul Aziz lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son. He is a doctor and has a drug store. He works with his son who is in university and works part-time. He wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import more medicines from other countries to attract more clients and make a good income for his family. He is happy with this loan process.

loans.use: To import more medicines from other countries

loans.name: Adeshoye

texts.en: Adeshoye T. is a mother of two, married and is 37 years old. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She has been in business since 2003. She needs a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and fashion materials.

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Peace B.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase her purchases. Peace is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant for work. She has a daughter aged 2. Each week, Peace makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and re-invest the rest in her business. Peace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Peace is joined in her small group by Harriet N., Mirabu K., and Jane W.. Harriet N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to boost business. Mirabu K. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to rent permanent business premises. Jane W. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice N. is forty years old and a mother of four children. Two of her children are in school. She prepares pastries which she sells to school children.  Through this business, she has been able to send two out of the four children to school. She wants to use the new loan to buy more flour and oil to expand her operation so she can sell to more school children. She is a member of the group called Eagle. Eagle members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of pastry flour and gallons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou Baldé, age 46, is married and has three nephews in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Samba, in Vélingara, for five and a half years. She buys "thioub" cloth to sell retail. She wishes to maintain this business that allows her to improve her standard of living and to provide the right care for the children. Bintou is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Bintou Baldé ,46 ans, mariée avec 03 neveux à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1 à Vélingara depuis 5ans et demi.Elle achète des tissus thioubs pour revendre. Elle souhaite maintenir cette activité qui lui permet d'améliorer son cadre de vie.et une bonne prise en charge des enfants Bintou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy "thioub" cloth

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi H. is 31 years old. She joined joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2001. Before joining TYM, her life was very difficult because her children are very small. She uses her loan to invest in her tailor shop, making clothes and selling them to other villagers. With her cleverness and reasonable prices, her shop attracts more and more customers. Besides farming, she earns about 156 USD per month from her tailor shop. She would like to borrow 625 USD to buy more materials to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by PH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Hương năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2001. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn do anh chị phải hoàn toàn tự lập khi lấy nhau và các con còn nhỏ. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị Hương đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào công việc mua bán vảy may quần áo phục vụ nhân dân trong xã. Với tay nghề khéo léo, mức tiền công phù hợp cửa hàng của chị đã ngày càng thu hút được nhiều khách hàng. Hiện nay ngoài việc chăn nuôi trồng trọt, thu nhập từ công việc may mặc của chị cho thu nhập khoảng 2.500.000/ tháng. Chị mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua thêm vải may quần áo phục vụ nhân dân

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bibi baji, the wife of S. M., a daily wage laborer, has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 50 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons are daily wage laborers, while the next eldest works in a factory. Bibi baji has a livestock business and successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her livestock business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Khursheed baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Shamim baji wants to buy a buffalo for her milk business; Saira baji wishes to buy more material for her garment business, while Naseem baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum C. (50) and her husband, Mr. Phoeuk Chhum (52), live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and now live outside the family home. Another child studies in Art College in Phnom Penh, and the other one is employed full time.

Mrs. Sarum has been selling grocery items for many years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of her house. Her husband is a farmer. He grows bananas, bitter gourd, and ridye gourds in his farm near the house.

Sarum is requesting a loan of US$800 to expand her grocery business and to pay for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and pay fee for repairing her house.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: M.Boubacar B. est un vendeur  de fruits ayant une experience de plus de cinq ans dans cette activite. Il parvient a encaisser des benefices journaliers de 3 000 F par jour . Ce qui lui permet d'entretenir difficilement une famille de deux enfants et une femme. Il sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille pour renforcer son stock et accroitre ses recettes
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar B. is a fruit merchant with more than 5 years' experience in this business. He manages to make a daily profit of 3,000 F per day. This meager income permits him to support his family of two children and a wife only with difficulty. He is asking for a loan of 150,000 F to bolster his stock and increase his earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster his working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es una mujer que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron  a trabajar en el campo, hoy es madre de 8 hijos, quienes le ponen en apuros económicos por las diversas necesidades que atender, sobre todo de educación, para que logren superarse y crecer  profesionalmente.   Por ello Victoria  desea incrementar sus ingresos y solventar los gastos de sus hijos, para ello necesita aumentar su producción, y de esta manera  obtener mayores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.   Frente a ello, solicita un  préstamo para la compra de semillas, contar con usted es motivador para ella, así puede seguir esperanzada en continuar su trabajo para la mejora de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman whose parents taught her to work in the field since childhood.
