Today she is a mother of 8 children, who put her in an economic predicament because of all the necessities they require, above all their education so that they are able to better themselves and grow professionally. Because of this, Victoria wants to increase her income and cover her children's expenses. To do this, she needs to increase her production, and in that way obtain higher income and satisfy the necessities of her household. Facing this, she requests a loan to buy seeds. To count on you is motivating for her, and with this she can stay hopeful in continuing her work to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for her next planting

loans.name: Sy – Sikasso – 00095 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Jiguisèmè (composé de 4 femmes toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et de 4 enfants vivent dans le village Kafela  situé à  20km de la ville de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans des foyers polygames avec leur maris, des coépouses, les enfants et autres parents.
Uni par des liens de parenté, ce groupe fait généralement l’achat et la vente du charbon de bois et la préparation et vente de la bouillie de mil. Après avoir correctement remboursé tous les prêts précédents, elles sont à leur douzième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  75 sacs de charbon de bois, 30 sacs de mil et 10 sacs de sucre. Les graines de mil sont pilés, vannés et mis dans de l’eau chaude pour obtenir de la bouillie. Cette opération dure en moyenne une vingtaine de minutes.
Les graines de céréales sont achtés auprès des producteurs de céréales des villages aux alentours de la ville. Pour ce qui est du charbon les achats se font auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation de coupe de bois. Les articles ainsi achétés sont achéminés à Sikasso les jours de foire pour les revendre au comptant, en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de revendeurs de Sikasso ou de Bamako.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 15.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Jiguiseme group (composed of four married women) are, on average 42 years old, with four (4) children. They live in the village of Kafela, located 20 km from the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Repiblic of Mali) in polygamous households with their husbands, co-wives, children and other relatives.

United through family lines, the group mainly buys and sells charcoal and prepares and sells millet porridge. After having successfully repaid all their former loans, they are now making this twelfth loan to purchase 75 sacks of charcoal, 30 sacks of millet and 10 sacks of sugar. The millet grain is crushed, washed and heated in hot water to make porridge. This process takes about twenty minutes.

The cereal grain is purchased from cereal producers located in the villages that surround the city. As for the charcoal, it is purchased from farmers who are authorized to cut wood.The purchased items are brought to Sikasso on market days to be resold for cash, wholesale or retail, to a clientele made up of retailers from Sikasso or Bamako.

With this loan, they each hope to earn a monthly profit of about 15,000 francs CFA, which would be used to meet the needs of their families and invest the remainder in their business activities.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, millet and sugar

loans.name: Shahnaz Akhtar Waqar Masood Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Akhtar baji is a 42-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 17 years. She is the mother of one son who is 9 years old and reads in 3rd standard. Her husband's name is W. M., and he manufactures clothes and sells in cloth markets. He has been in this business for the past 17 years. Shahnaz baji makes embroidered dresses on order, which she takes from her neighbors. She charges $3 per embroidered dress. She is applying for a loan to buy another power loom machine to manufacture more clothes, because her husband is out of stock now and he needs to fulfill the orders of his customers. 

She is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Asma baji wants a loan to buy furniture (chairs and tables) for her tuition center. Lubna Shahzadi baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sobia Ashraf baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business. Zahooran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a power loom machine for manufacture clothes

loans.name: Hat

texts.en:
Hat S. is 35 years old and works raising pigs that she then sells, while her husband makes alcohol to sell. She has been raising pigs since 2002, and normally she can sell them for slaughter in about three or four months. Her husband, Mr. Khim Mab, 44, makes alcohol at their house and sells it to regular customers.

She has three children, all of whom are teenagers and attending school. To increase her income, Hat S. would like to request a loan to purchase more piglets to raise, and rice to resell for a profit. The loan will help to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Iqbal Begum Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Iqbal Begum baji is a 36-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is an uneducated lady; she couldn’t get an education due to her family’s meager financial resources. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a delivery man and has been doing this work for the past 5 years. He used his own vehicle called “Shahzore” for delivering various items (wheat, fruit, & vegetables) from one place to another. Iqbal baji has no children. She spends her time making of embroidered clothes. She earns an income doing this work. She used her income to renovate her house. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle so that he will be able to continue his work.

She is joined in her loan by several more women from her locality. Rehana baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khursheed baji wants a loan to pay the installments on her auto-rickshaw. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used for transport

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 32 years old and married with five children. She produces and sells cellophane bags. Now she needs a loan for N70,000 in order to purchase more materials to use in making these bags. Tina is a LAPO client. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making cellophane bags

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба продолжает работать, а также одновременно к своей основной работе занимается бизнесом. Как и планировала Хабиба, она приобрела в аренду один из торговых мест в большом универмаге г. Исфары. Благодаря КИВА бизнес Хабибы приобрел устойчивость и подавая заявку на новый займ Хабиба собирается приобрести весенний ассортимент детской обуви.
texts.en:
Habiba continues working at her job and does her business at the same time. As Habiba has planned, she rented out a vendor stall in a large mall in the town of Isfara. Thanks to Kiva Habiba's business has stabilized and now Habiba is applying for a new loan and plans to purchase a spring assortment of children's shoes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a spring assortment of children's shoes

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette BABOU a  une boutique au marché de Bambey dans la région de Diourbel. Elle est mariée et est à son premier prêt pour renforcer son activité. Avec ses revenues elle compte épargner pour agrandir sa boutique  et aussi aider son mari sur les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Maguette BABOU has a shop at the Bambey marketplace in the Diourbel region. She is married and is on her first loan for bolstering her business. With her revenues, she intends to save money for expanding her shop and also for helping her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba S.  is a 44-year-old married mother of three children living in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past 10 years, Nasiba has helped her husband earn money by processing dried apricots and selling them at the market. Nasiba is now applying for a loan of $800 to expand her operation by buying more dried apricots to earn more and improve her standard of living. Nasiba says that this is the perfect time for her to take out a loan. By offering a better selection, she knows she will be able to capitalize on this opportunity. 

Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, and more importantly, ensure that her four children will always be able to attend a good school. Nasiba is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha P. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has three sons who are still in school. Her husband is a commercial driver. Martha lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 
Martha is a trader. She trades in footwear. She sells all sorts of footwear for both males and females. She hawks to sell her goods in her community. Martha procures the footwear from Accra. She has been in business for three years and wants to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy foot wear to sell.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is thirty-three years old and is married with two children. Kwame has been a carpenter and a mason for the past twelve years. He lives with his children and his wife who is a seamstress.

Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He produces dining tables, sitting room chairs, etc. 

He says for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he necessarily has to wait for funds from his customers before any work could begin. Most often this delays the work. He requests the loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and finishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc. to improve his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income to ensure good living for his family.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and finishing materials

loans.name: Askarboy

texts.en:
Askarboy K. is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift his family’s economic life and to send his dearest children to university.

Farming has been his major source of income. Askarboy produces wheat, onion and watermelon. He requests a loan of $1250 to support his business and to avoid asking credits from traders with higher interest rates. He is grateful that is able to borrow from lenders that offer low interest to become free from poverty.

Askarboy says that through prayers and hard work, his dreams can be achieved someday. Providing his children with an education is one of the important things that Askarboy prioritizes.

-------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar K. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Hagar sells provisions and hair products at Zion in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a sprayer. 

Hagar uses her income to pay for school fees for her children, clothing, utility bills and other family expenses. Hagar will use the loan to purchase hair products and provisions in bulk for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Hagar plans to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Moriliat

texts.en: Moriliat sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan of N100000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is thirty-six years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a 32-year-old trader. She is married with three children: two boys and a girl. All her children are currently in school.

Georgina sells used clothes in a community market of Accra where she lives. She also sells on credit to students in the universities. She sometimes sells through hawking (going door-to-door) when business is slow in the market center.

With low capital, Georgina is not able to buy larger bales of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase her stock with more variety.

Georgina hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Quadri

texts.en: Quadri sells spiritual items that are used in praying, like incense, oils, crucifixes and so on.  She sells to churches and also to individuals. She has been in this business for close to five years. Quadri is forty years old and married with four children, two of whom are in vocational training while the other two are in school. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase spiritual items in bulk at a reduced price. She says this will enable her to meet her customers' demands instead of losing them to competitors.

loans.use: To purchase spiritual items in bulk

loans.name: Tala

texts.en:
Tala S. is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Faga.  She is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Tala owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Tala has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tala is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Tala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Kokou-Tolidji

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur est revendeur de friperie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé ; il est marié et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Cette activité lui permet donc de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il a débuté ce commerce depuis 2000 ; il maîtrise donc parfaitement son secteur. Il vend ses vêtements dans le marché d’Adidogomé où il est très connu de beaucoup de clients. Il revend même ses vêtements à d’autres femmes qui sont des revendeuses ambulantes. Actuellement il a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 bals de friperie dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il compte sur sa maîtrise du marché pour vite rembourser ce prêt.
texts.en:
This gentleman sells second-hand clothing in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. He is married and financially responsible for three children. This business allows him to provide for his family's needs.

He began this trade in 2000, so he is well versed in his line of business. He sells clothing at the market of Adidogomé where he is well known from a lot of people. He even resells his clothing to other women who are walking saleswomen. Currently, he needs to renew his stock. For this reason he is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 3 bales of second-hand clothing at the market of Hédzranawoé in Lomé. He is relying upon his mastery of the market to reimburse this loan quickly.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Nenencia

texts.en: Nenencia D. C. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Nenencia operates a business selling ice cream in the market. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nenencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza P. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 6 adult-age children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community like grilled chicken parts, grilled hotdogs and pork barbecue. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Lila Iraida

texts.es:
La señora Lila Iraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos pequeños, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lila Iraida, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a pesar de las dificultades, que paso en el trascurso de su vida, siguió adelante, la cual esto le dieron muy buenos resultados. Lleva 02 años, dedicandose a este tipo de actividad y hoy en día vende productos de catálogos de línea: Natura y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos, jabones líquidos y en barras, tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Lila Iraida, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lila Iraida belongs to "Sargento Lores" community bank in the Morales district of San Martín province in the deparment of San Martín. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 3 young children who depend on her and are currently attending school. Lily Iraida is a persistent, hardworking woman who sells beauty products. Despite the challenges she has faced in the course of her life, she has continued fighting, and things have turned out well for her. She has been selling beauty products for 2 years and currently sells Natura products by catalog order. She is very happy about what she has achieved. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will stock beauty products such as perfume (for women and for men), lotion, compact powder, talcum, liquid and bar soap (for adults and for infants), lipstick, and nailpolish, as well as another display case to show her products. Lily Iraida is one example of many women who have started a business and, with perseverance, achieved their dreams. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and for helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Molly's Group

texts.en:
K. Molly is a friendly and a hard-working businesswoman operating from Kifunjo Cell. She is involved in agriculture as well as having a retail shop for the past 6 years, and she is able to make some good profits that help her to take care of her family and children since she is a widow. She has business challenges of lacking of enough working capital plus the lack of manageable transport for her produce to the market; however, she is much favored by the strategic location of her business in the city centre.

Molly has a dream of expanding her business further, educating her children, plus being rich. She needs a loan to help expand her businesses so that she will be able to get school fees for her children since 2 are at the university, 1 in senior Two, while the last born is in Primary Seven vacation. Molly is the leader of her lending group in Kihihi.

loans.use: Buying more agricultural produce for resale and restocking her retail shop

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor Gutierrez, Sr. is from the village of Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 54 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Amor owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Amor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Amor is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José V. R., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Los hijos tienen 2,6 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de terneros para la cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. Esta inversión le va ayudar a aumentar la cantidad y calidad del ganado y al mismo tiempo tener mayor ganancia. Es la primera vez que don José  se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, además de crecer como productor y como persona.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living
texts.en:
José V. R. is 40 years old, married and has three children, ages 2, 6 and 10. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to purchase calves to raise and then sell for a profit when they are fully grown. This investment will help him increase the quantity and quality of his cattle and at the same time improve his income. This is the first time José has been financed by Kiva partner FUDECOSUR, and he says that the credit committee has greatly helped him and that he is very pleased with the facilities they provide. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more economic stability as well as grow as a producer and a person. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: N. Christine est née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christine est mariée à ADJAGBE Michel, un pêcheur, et est mère de trois enfants, dont un reste à sa charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a environs 20 ans que Christine s'est installée au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, où elle y vit avec son enfant à charge et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis près de 30 ans, pour assurer ses différentes charges, Christine mène comme activité la vente de crevettes et de poissons fumés à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est au bord de la lagune que Christine s'approvisionne. Christine a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Christine souhaite renforcer son activité et satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, ce qui lui permettra d'avoir plus de revenu. C'est ce qui amène Christine à solliciter un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Christine N. was born in 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Michel ADJAGBE, a fisherman, and is mother to three children, one of whom is still under her care. Some of the children still attend school. About 20 years ago Christine settled in the Zogbo neighbourhood of Cotonou, where she now lives with her husband and the remaining child. She has not attended school herself. Both she and her husband share family expenses. For the past 30 years, Christine has met her various financial responsibilities by selling shrimp and smoked fish in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She gets her supplies from the lakeshore. Christine has been granted two previous loans from ALIDé, both of which were duly repaid. She wants to strengthen her business and respond to the needs of an increasing number of customers, which will naturally increase her earnings. This is why she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shrimp and fish

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda T. is engaged in a retailing business. Her product is coconut wine. She sells the wine for PHP 200 per container. The income she earns from her business helps her pay for the daily expenses of their home. She has four children. She is dong very hard work so that she will be able to provide their needs. 

She would like a loan to buy more coconut wine to resell.

loans.use: To buy more coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is married with two children: a 10-year-old daughter and a newborn son. Vasyl and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk. Vasyl runs a transportation business offering passenger transportation services in the territory of Ukraine. He started this business 11 years ago. Currently, he has about 6,000 Grivnyas in monthly income.  

Vasyl is seeking a 12,000-Grivnya loan to do major repairs on his vehicle engine. The car he owns isn’t brand new and has high mileage. Vasyl is hoping to do some maintenance work on his vehicle and fix his engine to ensure a smoother run for his car. This business is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: To do major engine repairs

loans.name: Enock Kimutai

texts.en:
Enock K. is 30 years old and married to Irene Chemuge, who is a farmer. They have been blessed with one child, Kemboi K., who is one year old.

Enock owns a mobile phone accessories shop in Kabarnet Town, where the residents are his main customers. Enock gets a profit of Kshs 21,000 from this business and others sources of monthly income.
  
Enock was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by a friend who had already joint Kadet. He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 53,000, which is his third loan from Kadet. He plans to use Kshs 45000 to purchase charcoal for his business. The remaining amount will be used to pay rent and other overhead costs of the business.

If this loan boosts his business, Enock will use the extra profit to expand the business. His dreams of having a good business future and, thereby, being able to purchase a car. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Loan will be used to buy charcoal, restock the business, and pay rent

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye N. est un homme de 46 ans qui habite dans la localité de  Ouakam depuis très longtemps. C’est un parent bénéficiaire marie qui évolue dans le secteur de transport. Il gère un taxi depuis 1988. Monsieur N. a choisi cette activité par le biais de son père qui était taximan. Il est marie et père de 5 enfants.  Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000frs destine a l’achat de matériel pour réfectionner son véhicule. Ce sont les revenus générés par son taxi qui lui permettent de supporter les charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mbaye Ndado is a 46-year old man who has been living in the town of Ouakam for many years. He is married and is providing for his children. He works in the transportation business. He has had a taxi since 1988. Mr. N. has chosen this activity motivated by his father, who was a taxi driver. He is married and the father of five children. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 West African francs in order to purchase materials for repairing his vehicle. The income that his taxi business brings allows him to support his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Leonora's Group

texts.en:
Leonora B. is from Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 45 years old and the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Leonora is married and has three school-aged children. She sells kitchen supplies and products to tourists and local community members. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and makes approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Leonora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Leonora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a sus hijos en casa de su familia ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito que pertenece al circuito de playas de la región y cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca, queda ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace nueve años a la venta de pescado procesado (seco – salado) en el terminal pesquero ECOPHINSA, el único terminal pesquero de la región, ella adquiere el pescado fresco en el mismo teminal y lo procesa en un local especial para luego regresar a venderlo a los comerciantes que llegan al lugar para adquirir mercadería que luego venderán en mercados de toda la región.

El negocio tiene bastante acogida en la zona, el pescado que suele procesar es la raya y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado de modo que así pueda percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre da todo de si para sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyar a su familia, su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación, ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 25, lives with her children in her family’s home located in Santa Rosa district, a district that is part of the country’s coastal region whose economy depends primarily on fishing; it’s 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 9 years she has sold processed (dried and salted) fish at the ECOPHINSA fishing terminal, the region’s only fishing terminal. She buys fresh fish there and then has it processed at a local firm in order to sell it afterwards to merchants that come by to acquire merchandise for subsequent sale in markets throughout the region. The business is quite well received in the area. The type of fish that she usually processes is ray and, due to the long time she’s been in business, she has a good client base of regular customers. Rosa wants to expand her business buying more fish so that her profits will increase. For this reason, she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan. Rosa is a hard-working woman who has always given all of herself to have her children succeed and to support her family. Her dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide her children with a good education. She has worked with us previously and has been punctual and responsible with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Desde 1988 María montó una tienda, justamente  8 meses después de casada, cuando vendió su finquita donde cultivaba tomate, cebolla y frijoles y parte de esto lo invirtió en este negocio , pero no le fue bien , por eso  al separarse de su esposo ya con tres hijos se vino a Barranquilla en el 2006 y en el 2008 había guardado un capital de $1.300.000 COP y con la ayuda de Acción Social que le dio un capital semilla de $ 1.400.000 COP, montó  nuevamente  su tiendita en el barrio  Concord del Municipio de  Malambo y en el 2009 se trasladó a las Moras, barrio  donde le ha ido muy bien en su hoy:  “Tienda la Luna”;  María quiere para su tienda agregar una nueva vitrina, para empezar con una miscelánea    y  también comprar cajas de bebidas, que le dan mucha utilidad sobre todos los fines de semana y feriados, ella acude con esta expectativa a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para que le hagan un préstamo, pues con esta organización lleva ya dos créditos muy bien reembolsados, que le ha servido para comprar enseres ,porque antes contaba con lo estrictamente necesario.
María tiene 3 hijos de 12, 18 y 21 años y vive arrendada, pero tiene el sueño de tener su casita propia en el barrio donde está su negocio, pues ahí tiene su mercado y quiere combinar su tienda con miscelánea. Últimamente tiene un gran desafío y es no vender a crédito a todo el que se lo solicite, sino seleccionar muy bien los clientes que va a financiar, observando su capacidad de pago, asì está disminuyendo su riesgo de perder el dinerito que ha conseguido con mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Since 1988, Maria has run a store, beginning just 8 months after marrying, when she sold a little farm where she had cultivated tomatoes, onions, and beans. Using a part of this money, she invested in her business. But things didn't go well for her, and separating from her husband after having 3 children, she came to Barranquilla in 2006. By 2008, having saved $1,300,000 Colombian pesos as capital, and with the help of Social Action, who provided seed capital of $1,400,00 pesos, she launched anew her little store in Barrio Concord, Municipality of Malambo. In 2009, she moved it to Barrio Las Moras, where things have gone very well for her store, the “Tienda la Luna”. Maria wants to add a new show-case to her store, in order to begin selling miscellany. Also, she wishes to purchase cases of drinks, which are very profitable, especially on weekends and market days. She has approached the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation requesting a loan, since she already had repaid this organization in a timely manner for 2 loans which were used for kitchen utensils (previously, she had made do with only the strictly necessary). Maria has 3 children, ages 12, 18, and 21, and lives in a rented house. But she dreams of having her own little house in the barrio where she has her market. She wishes to combine it with her miscellany store. Lately she faces a great challenge which is not to sell at credit to everyone who requests it, but, rather, to select the customers she will finance very carefully, taking into account their capacity to pay. This will diminish the risk of losing what little money she has acquired through so much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ADDING A NEW DISPLAY CASE TO SELL MISCELLANY, AND BUYING CASES OF DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Elsa Beronguez Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa B. is 44 years old, married, and a resident of P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group members receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member if one becomes delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Elsa B. Group.

Elsa is married to Andres B., who is a driver at Naomi's Botanical Garden. They are blessed with 2 children who are now in their mid-teens. To help her husband, she decided to engage in micro business particularly selling RTW (GTY Products).  She has been selling products for 6 months and, at this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,000.00 a month.  The extra money is so helpful to their family's income. Upon hearing the good news that PAGLAUM MPC was recognized as "Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines" in the COOP-LGU Partnership Awards in 2006, she joined the cooperative in the year 2009.

As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P6,000.00 as her 2nd cycle loan to add to her capital for her existing RTW dealing business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments to PMPC, and for possible business expansion.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand existing RTW dealing business

location.town: Ozamis-P2-A Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Josephina's Group

texts.en:
Josephina D. is from the village of Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is 57 years old. Josephina is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Josephina owns & operates a vegetable vending. The main source of income for the business comes from selling assorted vegetables  in the local community. Josephina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephina is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support their daily needs. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nyamuhanami Twimukye, Mubende Group

texts.en:
K. Joseph's main source of livelihood for the past 20 years has been running an agricultural farm in Nyamuhanami, Mubende. It is with earnings from this business that hardworking Joseph has managed to sustain his family of eight children. The 46-year-old dynamic businessman has reached a point where his business profits now amount to 200,000 UGX per month. With steady progress in building his small enterprise, Joseph reckons his future prospects are improving with every passing day.
With a loan coming his way, Joseph has the conviction that he will be able to improve his farming system with fertilizers to produce more cash crops such as maize, cassava, peanuts and beans, so that he does not run short of supplies for his customers. This will improve his sales revenues and enable him to live a self-sustaining life. He hopes to be able to educate his children and see them become important people who can support themselves in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren O. has a family of six. He has been managing a flower shop since 2000. Apart from flowers, the shop also trades in plants.  Anticipating a very busy September month when the school season opens, Suren has applied for a loan to purchase plants.

loans.use: purchasing plants

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Simeona; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 Hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista; Ella se dedica a vender verduras  desde hace 20 años, ella estudio la primaria completa y ahora trabaja vendiendo verduras en el mercado de Santa Rosa en la sección verduras, La socia necesita capital para comprar por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mi Perú” comnumal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Simeona; she is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with sales. She has been selling vegetable for 20 years. She finished primary school and she now works selling vegetables in the market of Santa Rosa, in the vegetable section. She needs capital to buy wholesale. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables at wholesale price. She is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this program. She promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale price

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a resident of Lahore,  the 2nd largest city in Pakistan, well-known for its history and culture. She is a 46-year-old housewife, and the mother of six daughters and a son. Her three younger daughters are currently in school and her three elder daughters work. The first two sew clothes and the third teaches in a nearby school. Her son has earned a bachelor degree and is currently looking for a job.  Her husband is a fruit seller in the market.  They all are very gentle people and live in a three-room brick house in the area of Shalimar Town.

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling. Kalsoom is hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business, her husband will be able to increase his income and sales. She also hopes that her son will find a suitable job soon which will help her family to live a better standard of living. Kalsoom is a regular client of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She has a good credit record.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for selling.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Edid, ella tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera; y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a trabajar de empleada en un restaurante turístico de nombre Keros desde hace 5 años; La socia solicita el préstamo para apertura de un nuevo negocio propio,  La socia tiene como cábala no hacer público su proyecto del negocio propio hasta que salga el proyecto. La socia a ahorrado un capital para realizar este sueño y a esto le servirá de mucha ayuda  para aumentar a su capital final el crédito que ahora solicita. La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar un proyecto propio.

Los otros socios se dedican a la atención de una botica, artesanía, moto taxi,  docentes, venta de comidas, venta de desayunos, a la venta de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Santo Domingo communal bank, located in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Edid. She is 41 years old, a single mother, with 2 children, 14 and 16 years of age. She has been employed by the tourist restaurant Keros for the last 5 years. She is requesting a loan to open her own business. She believes it is good luck not to make her project public until it starts. She has saved some capital to realize this dream, and the funds she is requesting now will be very helpful to her in increasing this capital. This loan is for her own personal project.

The other members work in pharmacy, handicrafts, taxi service, teaching, food sales, breakfast food sales, and grocery sales. 

The member appreciates and values the loan received through this process, and also agrees to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: The member seeks a loan to start her own business

loans.name: Aminatu

texts.en: Aminatu M. sells boiled yams and serves them with "kontommire" stew (normally called "palava sauce"). She has attained junior high level of education. She is married to a driver and has two children. She will use the loan to purchase more yams and other ingredients for sale. She will use the new income from her business to buy other foods to cook in addition to the yams to sell.

loans.use: purchase more yams and other ingredients for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27 year old single man who lives with his parents. Despite his young age, he has gained good experience working in floor coverings for the past 8 years. In 2006, he started working independently and taking on home projects. He has a good number of clients asking for his services. This young man helps with his father with the family expenses with his income.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a paving cutter and new tools in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a paving cutter and new tools.

loans.name: José Abraham

texts.es: Don José, tiene 50 aqñosn de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, y han salido adelante con la ayuda de su esposa que le apoya en su trabajo, solicita un credito con el objetivo de mejorar su negocio, y solamente lo puede hacer ampliando el capital de trabajo que tiene, entonces decide acercarse a la institución solicitando un préstamo que servirá para ampliar el capital de trabajo especificamente para comprar tela, lo cual en esta epoca tiene demanda su negocio, se constató de elabora chumpas y sudaderos, espera que con dicho prestamo, pueda suplir las demanda de los clientes.
texts.en: Don José is 50 yeas old, is married and has 4 children, 1 of whom is in school.  His family has been able to get ahead with the help of his wife, who supports him in his work.  He is requesting the loan with the purpose of improving his business, which can only be accomplished by increasing the working capital that he has available.  So he decided to approach the institution and request a loan that would allow him to increase his working capital, specifically to buy fabric.  In this time period, his business is in great demand; his business consists of making jackets and sweatshirts.  He hopes that with this loan, he can meet his customers' requests.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi”  ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y tiene 02 hijos, estudió educación superior completa.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales caseros.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar animales menores especialmente ovejas.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y ser mayorista.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the community bank "Punta Sahuacasi", located in the Azángaro district in the province of Azángaro and the department of Puno.  She is 29 years old, single, and has two children.  She completed high school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her business selling animals.

Now she is asking for a new loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase small animals, especially sheep.

Her dream for the future is to have more income and sell products wholesale.  The things she likes best about her community bank are punctuality and saving what she earns.

loans.use: Purchase small animals, especially sheep

loans.name: Maria Bety

texts.es:
Maria Bety P. R. tiene 32 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con el hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es terminar de construir la casa para el futuro de mi hijo.

Le gusta leer con el hijo.
texts.en:
María Bety P. R., 32, is married and lives with her husband and son in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has one son.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light and Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional activities.  It has 17 members.

 María is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her own settlement.

She is asking for the loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs. They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and variability in the weather.  Her dream is to finish building her house for her son’s future.

She enjoys reading with her son.

loans.use: For seed and manure.

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop B. was born in 1963.  He lives in Koti village, in the Ijevan area. Mesrop is married and has 3 daughters. 

From 1980 until 1992, he worked as a driver.  In 1993, he participated in the Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict. After that, from 1994 until now, he has returned to his work as a driver.  At the same time, Mesrop and his wife are engaging in animal breeding and land cultivation.  On their farm they produce butter and cheese, which they sell to their neighbors and distribute at Ijevan city's market.
 
Mesrop wants to develop his swine breeding business and has requested a 500,000 AMD loan to buy pigs and fodder for his farm animals. Mesrop says his farm development will permit him to increase his family’s incomes and improve his family’s living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal fodder

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es:
Gioconda es una madre muy dedicada al trabajo para lograr apoyar a su familia. Hoy en día su negocio es la venta de tortilla y ropa.
Iniciando con poco dinero con una pequeña pulpería, en donde no logro equilibrar su negocio, lo que cambio. A la  venta de tortilla así como la venta de ropa.
Pues no  ha sido fácil ya que su objetivo ha sido obtener ingreso ya que  su familia es mucha.
Lleva dos créditos con la institución, los cual ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago, en donde con este nuevo crédito  será para la compra variada de ropa nueva, a si como uniforme de colegios ya que se aproxima la fecha de los estudiantes lo que aprovechara a vender.a si como la producccion mas de tortillas.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a mother who is very committed to her work so that she can support her family.  Her current business is selling tortillas and clothes.  She started out with a little money and a small grocery store.  However, she couldn't manage to balance her business and therefore changed it.  Now she sells tortillas and clothes.

It has not been easy for Gioconda since her goal has been to make money as she has a large family.

Gioconda has had two loans with the institution and she has been responsible in making her repayments.  She will use this new loan to buy a variety of new clothes as well as school uniforms since the back-to-school season is approaching and she will take advantage of this to make sales.  She will also produce more tortillas.

loans.use: To invest in buying clothes and uniforms so that she can improve her sales.  To increase her tortilla production

loans.name: María Doralba

texts.es:
Al separarse de su esposo y quedando como madre cabeza de hogar, María Doralba G. O. se vio en la necesidad de crear su propio negocio con el fin obtener los recursos necesarios para su sustento y el de su familia. Aprovechando los conocimientos que por hobbie había adquierido en las técnicas de beleza, inició con su peluquería que según esta emprendedora ha sido su tabla de salvación. 

Con el propósito de mejorar la imagen de su negocio y lograr una mejor exhibición de los productos de belleza que también vende, María Doralba, necesita de un préstamo para adquirir una vitrina y comprar aún más productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. 

En el futuro esta luchadora, espera tener su local independiente de su casa, pues actualmente se vio obligada a realizar la adaptación en su casa para operar su negocio.
texts.en:
After separating from her husband, María Doralba G. O. became the head of her household and found it necessary to create her own business in order to obtain the necessary income to sustain herself and her family.  Taking advantage of knowledge of beauty techniques she had gained from a hobby, she started the hairstyling business which she says has been her lifesaver.

With the goal of improving her business' image and better displaying the beauty products that she sells, Maria Doralba needs this loan to buy a display case and more products to offer her clients.

In the future, this fighter hopes to have a location independent of her home, since she currently has to use her home in order to operate her business.

loans.use: the purchase of a display case and beauty products

loans.name: Mario Heriberto

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Heriberto M. él es trabajador activo de la empresa “CEMEX” de San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como obrero tiene  Veinte y cinco  años  de trabajar para esta institución , tiene un  hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Mario Heriberto M. is an active employee of the Cemex company in San Rafael del Sur. He has been a laborer for twenty-five years for this company. He has one school-aged son. He has  had six past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has been invested in the  purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks,  etc., which were used to expand and improve his house. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and through them he has improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
Riyad is a gardener. He offers services to families and companies of Tulkarem town, taking care of their gardens, trees and plants. Riyad took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a garden roller to flatten the ground in some gardens especially of companies.

Riyad is the father of three sons who are young school students. Riyad is photographed in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase a garden roller to do gardening work

loans.name: Las Damas 96 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Damas 96, porque se consideran unas damas de esta ciudad hermosa que está Ubicado en el estado de Quintana Roo, Cancún en México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. La señora Lidia Aurora C. E., es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria, es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos varones de 23, 20 y 10 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de piñatas que inicio desde hace 20 años. En el cual requiere el crédito para comprar  material para la elaboración de piñatas  y  así poder seguir con sus ventas diarias. La señora va de negocio a negocio  promoviendo las piñatas y así poder captar clientes y poder venderles las piñatas por cantidades que le soliciten de igual manera poderles dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Doña Lidia se siente muy motivada y contenta con el crédito que se le otorgo porque con este ella podrá apoyar en los gastos de su familia y poderles dar a su familia una vida de calidad. Observaciones, las señoras que no se ve bien se llama Minerva C. y Guadalupe C..
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Damas 96' (Ladies 96) because they are women from the beautiful town of Cancún, in the State of Quintana Roo, in Mexico.  The group has 12 members.

Lidia Aurora C. E. is the group's president.  She is 46 years old and studied up to the second grade of elementary school.  She has three sons aged 23, 20 and 10.  Lidia's business is making and selling piñatas.  She started this business 20 years ago.  Lidia needs this loan to buy materials for making her piñatas so that she can continue making her daily sales.  She goes from business to business promoting her piñatas in order to attract customers and sell them piñatas in the quantity they require.  She also strives to provide her customers with a better service.

Lidia feels very motivated by the loan that she has been awarded and very happy because it will enable her to support her family's expenses and allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

nb: the ladies who cannot be seen very well are Minerva C. and Guadalupe C..

loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. sells pastries, ice cream and drinks in Abura near Frami, which she has done for two years. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Nana uses her income to help her husband educate, feed and clothe the children. A loan will help her purchase stock in large quantity to be able to sell more. Nana plans to save the new profits from her expanded business towards establishing a snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase stock in large quantity.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Hilado de vicuña y venta, confección de polleras, confección de prendas, venta de pescado, venta de CD’s, venta de blusas, tienda de barrio.

La señora María, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es su el segundo ciclo con  Pro Mujer. En la actualidad la señora María tiene un negocio de confección de prendas y con el crédito que sacará ahora será para la compra de tela. Estos productos los vende en la calle Larecaja de lunes a sábado.

En la foto podemos ver que falta una de las socias, ella es la señora Flora, que conto que estaba apresurada para abrir su negocio
texts.en:
The "Emprendedoras" ("Entrepreneurs") communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It has eight members and is presided by Maria. The members of the association run a variety of business, including: making and selling vicuna yarn, making skirts, making clothes, selling fish, selling CDs, selling shirts and a convenience store.

Maria, president of the association, explains that this is her second cycle with Pro Mujer. Maria currently owns a clothes making business and with the loan she will buy fabric. She sells her products from Monday to Saturday in Larecaja street.  

In the picture we can see that Flora, one of the members, is missing. She had to leave in a rush to open her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel se dedica a brindar servicios D. comida buffet para acontecimientos especiales, es D. profesión gastrónomo, se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, viven en casa D. sus padres y es soltero,   el crédito que solicita es para la compra D. utensilios para la atención D. servicios D. buffet indica que es muy importante este crédito por que así consolidará su negocio que esta teniendo bastante demanda en el mercado y D. esta forma quiere sustentar su manutención D. el y D. su familia, es un joven emprendedor y con ganas D. superación, su deseo es ser muy conocido por el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, así poder tener mayores ingreso y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Daniel works offering a buffet catering service for special occasions. He is a gourmet by profession and has worked in this field for 2 years. He lives in his parents' home and he is single. The loan he is asking for is to buy serving utensils for the buffet service. He indicates that this loan is very important because in this way he can consolidate his business, which is much in demand in the market. He would like to stablilize his own support and that of his family. He is an enterprising young man who wants to get ahead. He wants to become very well known for the good service he gives his customers as well as to have more income and a better quality of life for his family. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered in making this loan.

loans.use: to buy utensils for his business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos H.  es vecino de la comunidad de Pilas en Pérez Zeledón, es conocido por ser un agricultor muy trabajador.
En este momento el desea  obtener un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para sembrar 20 hectáreas  de ñampi. Para ello necesita los insumos necesarios y la mano de obra. Esta es la mejor época del año para hacerlo y es por eso quiere aprovechar para mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. 
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carlos H. comes from the Pilas community in Pérez Zeledón, and he is known for being a very hardworking farmer.

At this time, he would like to obtain a 500,000 CRC loan so that he can plant 20 hectares of ñampi, a tropical vegetable used for its thickened stems. For this, he needs both the necessary supplies and labor. This is the best time of the year to cultivate, which is why he would like to take advantage so that he can improve both his income and his children's quality of life. He is a member of Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A., one of the 110 organizations that have a partnership with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to grow ñampi, a tropical vegetable used for its thickened stems.

loans.name: Georgette Dédé

texts.fr: Mère au foyer de trois enfants, Madame vend des produits de premières nécessités (sardines, sucre, huile végétale, lait…) et des liqueurs depuis 4 ans à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle à 48 ans  et partage les charges familiales  avec son conjoint depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité.
texts.en: Georgette is a mother of three, and has been selling everyday staple items (sardines, sugar, vegetable oil and milk etc) and alcoholic drinks from Lomé for the past four years. She sources her goods from the Lomé market. She is 48 years old and works so that she can help her partner to see to the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase everyday items

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Eva has a small retail shop, which she has run for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land.
Eva is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario tiene 41 años de edad ella reside en casa de su madre, vive allí con su  esposo e hijos, dicha está ubicada en la misma ciudad de Chepen, en el departamento de La Libertad. 

Maria del rosario cuenta con pequeña puesto de ventas instalado en una avenida comercial de la ciudad de Chepen, este negocio es atendido por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes de la zona diversos productos comestibles como golosinas y gaseosas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María del Rosario ha venido experimentando una fuerte demanda en su negocio, debido a esto María Rosario piensa ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles, para lograr sus objetivos.

María Rosario es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is 41 years old. She lives in her mother’s house with her husband and her children. They live in Chepén, a town of the La Libertad department.

María del Rosario owns a small stall located along a business street in the town of Chepén, and she works there alone. She sells various edible products to her customers, such as fizzy drinks and sweets, as well as basic necessities and groceries. The shop is very well-received, and thanks to this activity she can help her husband to financially support their family.

As a result of the growing demand that María del Rosario's shop has been experiencing, she is considering expanding it by buying more products. This is why she has seen it fit to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1800 PEN that she will use to reach her goals.

María del Rosario is a fairly known and respected woman in the communities of the area where she lives. People who know her consider her to be calm and fairly responsible.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her activity.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 35-year-old  married man. He has owned a water filtering shop since 2003. He worked hard to open his business and has improved it over the years.

Atef's shop is unique in his area because water pollution is a major problem in the region. Service timing and cleanliness are important these days and require a lot of work. He works hard to add new improved quality products and services.

Atef is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy a new car necessary to transport water to his clients' homes and businesses. He hopes to expand his business and become well-known in order to provide a better life for his children in the future.

loans.use: buy a car to deliver water to his clients

loans.name: Juana Epifania

texts.es: Juana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 38 años en su negocio. Su negocio dio inicio porque no tenía la oportunidad de proporcionarle a su familia ingresos diariamente, fue con muy poco capital que logro empezar este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, calzado, perfumes, lápiz labial y más productos. En un futuro quiere mejorar su actividad y ampliar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en:
Juana sells general merchandise and has been in this business for more than 38 years. She started her business because she was never given the opportunity to provide for her family’s daily income. With very little capital, Juana was able to start earning a livelihood.

The reason for this loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, lipsticks, and other products. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business each day.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, perfumes, lipsticks, and other products.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is married and lives in Cambodia. She lives a simple, honorable, working life and, with her husband's support, she runs a laundry to provide for her family. Her business is successful and she has good relationships with her community neighbors and is able to earn an increasing daily profit.

So is requesting a loan of 500 USD to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Homer Edgardo

texts.es:
Homer, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado, es agricultor y vendedor de semilla de marañón, dicho negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa y con la ayuda de su esposa, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
