Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono), esta compra le ayudara a tener todos los insumos necesarios para la siembra y sacar una mejor cosecha para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su más grande sueño es mejorar su negocio, aumentar la compra de semilla y ser un buen cliente con buena moral de pago y un espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Homer lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and sells cashew apple seeds. He started this business on his own with his wife's help. He has no set schedule to serve his customers.

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural materials (fertilizer). This purchase will help him have all the materials he needs to plant and have a better harvest to offer his customers.

His biggest dream is to improve his business, increase his seed purchases and to be a good client with a good payment history and an enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting corn.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Uganda, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in a rented home with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Allen has been a retail shopkeeper for less than a year and works seven days a week. She also makes additional money by plaiting hair.

Allen has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and small jerry cans of cooking oil. Transportation and seasonality are her main challenges.

Allen’s goals and aspirations include building rooms to rent and owning a wholesale rather than retail shop.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and small jerry cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Neris Jacinta

texts.es:
Neris Jacinta tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión libre, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 3 años de edad en el  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Neris se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno y hacer una casa para poder vivir tranquilamente con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Neris Jacinta is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 year old daughter in Canton Ventanas, province of Los Rios. Her fellow members of the Caminando Hacia el Futuro ("Walking to the Future") communal bank are based in Recinto Jesus de Gran Poder, in Canton Ventanas, and work in short-cycle agriculture growing corn and rice. 

Neris works in farming and grows corn and rice. She buys her products at Comercial Marlin and sells them in her same town and in Ventanas. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilisers for her crops. The loan will provide financial support to meet her needs. She has to face challenges such as pests and diseases. Her dream is to buy land and build a house to live with her family in piece. In her free time she enjoys going for walks and spending more time at work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilisers for her crops.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana sells soft drinks at Abura. She has a junior-high-school level of education. She is married with three children, and her husband is a farmer. 

Nana has been selling soft drinks for ten years. She supports her companion to feed the home. Her credit will be used to buy soft drinks. She hopes to reinvest back into her business. She is standing close to some crates of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (her mother). She operates a pub  and sells both on a wholesale and retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years. 

Norah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, jerry cans of local gin and boxes of water. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to educate her children to university level and also to build rental houses. She lives in her house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, jerry cans of local gin and boxes of water

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old. married, and has six children.  She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has done for eight years, and works hard to provide for her family. 

Lolita is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.  Lolita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She also earns an income from buying and selling rice.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari stores

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Jerry is buying and peddling educational & spiritual magazines & books. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stock of magazines & books to sell.

Jerry has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jerry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of magazines & books to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 42-year-old married woman. Her husband Rimbe works as a farmer and together they have eight children. All of her children are currently enrolled in school. She plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to open her own vegetable kiosk at the market. 

Joyce describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Kiva field partner Yehu because they offer loan products that fit her needs.

loans.use: to open a egetable kiosk at the local market

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu, 34, is married with one son. She lives with her child and husband in Ho Chi M. City. 

Hieu has been operating a small general store for nine years. She would like to take a loan and plans to use this loan to increase the quantity and range of products she sells, such as beverages, milk, sugar and confectioneries. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the cost of her son's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, sugar, and confectioneries to stock her general store.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul, es un hombre soltero de  21 años de edad,  el  se dedica al servicio de transportes, eligio este trabajo porque le gusta tratar con la gente y porque le sale muy rentable este negocio.
Saul vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
Saul es un hombre responsable, empeñoso y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Saul empezó en el negocio desde el año 2010, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 250 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo invertirá para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ( construcción de cuartos). El  sueño del joven Saul es tener su propia empresa de transportes a nivel nacional y que llegue  a ser muy reconocida, el señor Saul esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Saul is a young, single man of 21 years and offers a transport service.  He chose this job because he likes to work with people and because it is a profitable business for him.  

Saul lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the South-western part of the country.  Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance.  Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

Saul is a responsible, hard working man with a strong desire to get ahead.  Saul started out in 2010 and earns an average of S/ 250 new soles.  With the S/. 2000 soles loan that he will receive thanks to KIVA, he will invest in improvements to his home (building an extension).  Sauls' dream is to have his own national transport company that will one day become well renowned.  Saul is very grateful for the opportunity give to him.  His advisor believes him to be a good client who will make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home (to build an extension)

loans.name: Raquel Virginia

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene  45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos, dos independientes.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de seis años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la  compra de  diez paquetes de prendas de vestir (chompas), la mercadería la compra en la Paz y la vende en la ciudad de Cusco, trabaja junto con su hijo y esposo.

Su sueño de la señora es tener su propio capital.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros, el compañerismo la solidaridad con las socias y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso” communal bank located in Puno District, Province and Department.  She’s 45 years old, has a spouse and four children two of which are independent. 

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than six years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to increase her clothing sales business.  She will ask for a new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy ten bundles of clothes (sweaters).  She will buy the merchandise in La Paz and sell it in Cusco.  She works alongside her son and husband.  

Her dream is to have her own capital.  What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the savings, the companionship and mutual support among her fellow members and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy ten bundles of clothes (sweaters).

loans.name: Nira

texts.en:
Nira is 31 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 13.  In 2001, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business.  

In the future, Nira plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, a tea shop makes a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Milton Jacinto

texts.es:
Milton Jacinto   tiene 31 años vive en Unión Libre, y vive con su cónyuge  y sus hijos de 4, 20, 18, 17,9 años. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Milton  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, a criar ganado. Desde hace cinco años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea para la siembra del maíz, así también para la compra de la comida apropiada para criar sus ganados. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder comprar una finca y así poder  gozar de  buena salud y  estar unidos con la familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta jugar indor, pasar  con su familia.
texts.en:
Milton Jacinto, 31, lives with his partner and their children in San Vicente Las Lomas, a small town in the Ecuadorean canton of Ventanas.
 
The members of the El Recreo community bank in San Vicente Las Lomas make their livings from farming. They grow maize, rice, beans and soy.

Milton, too, is a farmer. He grows maize and beans and raises cattle. He started the business five years ago. She buys and sells what she needs in Ventanas.
 
Milton will use part of this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and other supplies for growing maize. He will use the rest to buy feed for his cattle business. Borrowing helps him increase his family's income. Milton's goals are to buy a farm, stay healthy and keep his family together.
 
In his spare time, Milton likes to play "indor"--don't know--and spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Shorook

texts.en:
Shorook is a 25 year old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter. Shorook has a store for selling clothes. She established this profitable project three years ago and she wants to purchase winter clothes, in bulk, to resell and to increase her income, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Shorook has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for supplies for her store. She needs to take a loan amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Shorrok gets the loan, she will be able to purchase winter clothes in bulk. This will enable her to have a better collection of winter clothes and enable her to compete with other stores well. She will satisfy her customers' needs and increase her sales and her income. This will all lead to providing the family with better living conditions. Shorook is photographed in her store.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes, in bulk, for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Lydia has been selling clothes for the last two years, a business she began from her personal savings. She learned of Milango (a Kiva partner) from her friends.

Lydia is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more clothes for sale. Her main challenges are finding customers and price fluctuations. She looks forward to owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du BENKADI III sont  des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Beleniko, un des villages de la  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TATA, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  170.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakai is a 40-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be honest, cheerful, and determined. She operates a food service where she sells food to customers. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local people in the town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unstable high market prices.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy food ingredients to prepare meals to sell. She plans to expand her business in the next five years. Her business goal is to employ new staff and open a new similar food stall within five years. She is a determined woman, focused and very optimistic.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susana is 42 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Susana has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nargul

texts.ru: Наргул 43 года, вдова, есть сын. Образование у Наргул среднее, она 12 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. По характеру она очень жизнерадостная женщина. В хозяйстве Наргул есть 4 коровы. Также Наргул выращивает на 1,4 ГА собственной земли ячмень. Также работает в школе уборщицей и получает пенсию по потере кормильца. Совокупный доход семьи составляет до 15,000 (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств ей с сыном не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому Наргул решила развить свою деятельность и увеличить доходы, обратившись в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Наргул является участником группы "Кызыл Арык", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Прибыль от кредита позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Nargul is 43 years old and the widowed mother of one boy.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for 12 years.  By nature, she is a woman with a very positive attitude.  She has four cows on her farm.  She and her children also grow barley on 1.4 hectares of their own land.  She also works as a cleaning lady in a school and she receives a pension for the loss of her husband.  The family's total monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for Nargul and her son to have a decent living.  For this reason, having decided to expand her activity and boost her income, Nargul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  Nargul is a member of the "Kyzyl Aryk" group which comprises another three people, so a total of four.  The earnings from her loan will help her to improve her family's well-being and to save money to build a barn for her livestok.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Sabali A Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABALI A  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SOCOURANI, commune de FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec FATOUMATA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Jormo Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man living with his wife in a rented apartment within the teshi locality . He and his friend  with same name in the group called 'Jormo' joined Hand in Hand with ID-Ghana in this year 2015, and has benefited from enterprise development training.

Stephen operates a cereals selling business. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more rice to add stock to his business. This will help him to meet his customers' demands, and hopefully earn more income to provide food and clothing for his family.

They are very happy and grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy more rice to add stock to his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more household goods and foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Hakimkhan

texts.en:
Hakimkhan is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is now settled in the Makhmudlu village, is married and has 3 children.
Hakimkhan plans to increase the stock of foodstuffs in the grocery store that he opened five years ago. He is therefore asking for a loan of US$1200. He will use part of the money also to expand the area of his store.

loans.use: Expansion of a store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario owns a car in which he uses to work as a taxi-driver. This car needs repair and some new parts. His home is in the high altitude area of Llojeta Ave, Máx. Fernández Nº 2065, in La Paz, Bolivia. He is married and has five children and owns his home. This is the first time that he seeks a loan. His job qualifies him for this loan since he has experience as a driver and it is his only source of income. The social impact of this loan will be great ,as it will allow Mario to work hard to take care of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Hernandez, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario tiene una movilidad con la cual trabaja como taxista. Dicha movilidad necesita reparación y compra de repuestos. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de alto Llojeta, Av. Máx. Fernández Nº 2065 en la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene cinco hijos y vive en domicilio propio Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer y esta es su única fuente de ingresos. El impacto social de este crédito será enorme pues permitirá a Mario continuar con su esfuerzo de mantener a su familia.

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Agila

texts.en: Agila is a 40-year old divorcee with one child. She lives with her family in Gardili village in the Salyan region. Seven years ago she started her own business and she now needs a loan of $725 to purchase pesticides for her orchard and to improve her harvest.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Tooa

texts.en: This is Tooa’s first loan, and the purpose is to assist with the family’s long-running business. Raising pigs is something Tooa’s family has done for some time now with help from family members. At this point, they need some help with the project. SPBD, as a more flexible lending institution, was the first choice given the strict controls on lending criteria by banks and financial institutions. The other reason for SPBD as a choice had to do with their community-based service and how they come to the village to offer help needed by women who want to go into business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her pig farm

loans.name: Aitoai

texts.en: Aitoai is a mother of 39 years of age. She has 2 children and her husband is unemployed. Through the years they have lived on their plantation and it was their only source of income. They plan to improve the standard of their farm. Aitoai heard of SPBD through her family relatives so she decided to join. With her loan they have managed to improve many things in her home, as well as their business. She is very thankful for such a great opportunity to improve her family's lives.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Yoyoh

texts.en: Yoyoh is 19 years old. Her husband Komar has no fixed job. She earns income to support her family needs by raising chickens. This earns $50 a month. Nayah is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more chicks. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en: Fatimum O. is 29 years old and married with three children. She is a fashion designer and has been in business since the year 2000. She needs a loan of $450 to buy sewing materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials in bulk.

loans.name: Sopois

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopois N., 27, and her husband, Daro Man, married in 2004. They have two little children; one son and one daughter. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopois is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her neighbor and started silk production in 1999. She sells her finished products in her village.

Mrs. Sopois is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving and for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to repairing her house

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is 35 years old and married, with 3 children. She sells locally produced food such as cassava, sweet potatoes and vegetables in the open market to retailers from Makeni town. She purchases the commodities from farmers in small quantities, and because transportation to collect the produce is very expensive, Kadiatu makes very little profit. She would like to expand the business by purchasing her commodities in bulk to save on transportation time and expenses.   She is requesting a loan of approximately $700 US for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy commodities in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a fishmonger and is married with five children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing and then sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase her inventory to meet the demand of her costumers.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Qarsalan

texts.en: Qarsalan B. is 65 years old. He is married and has 5 sons and 5 daughters. He is very proud to have such a large family and works very hard to cover its needs. Qarsalan earns income breeding sheep in the Internally Displaced People's Settlement of the Bilasuvar region and has more than 30 years of experience in this business.  Summer is high season for wedding parties, at which mutton is a very popular dish. Therefore, Qaralan has decided to use this favorable time to expand his business. He has therefore applied for a loan of US$1,200 which he will use to purchase twenty sheep for breeding and, afterwards, sale for profit.

loans.use: Purchase of twenty sheep

loans.name: Maqsuda

texts.ru:
Maqsuda A. lives in the town Tirsun-zoda. She is 33 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her main occupation is farming. She grows vegetables and sells them on a market. She would like to obtain a credit so she would be able to purchase qulaity seeds and fertilizers. This will give her an opportunity to collect high quality crops. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Эшбуриева Максуда жительница города Турсун-заде. Возраст 33 года . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается земледелием . Выращивает овощи и продает на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения. Это даст возможность получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Thi Thuy is 30 years old and joined TYM fund in 2005. Her family's main lines of production are agriculture and animal breeding. When she joined the fund, she borrowed money to invest in her animal breeding farm. Currently her family is raising pigs and ducks. She hopes to produce about 2 tons of pig meat yearly to market, and to have 200 ducks. After expenses, her daily income is 9.00 USD. Since joining the fund, their business has produced good results and the improvement in their income was quite evident. In 2007, her family saved up enough to buy a tractor to use on their farm, and to plow for others in the local area for a fee. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 375.00 USD to invest in their animal breeding farm. Their average monthly income is 375.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Thủy 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Gia đình chủ yếu sảm xuất nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tai gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ hàng năm bình quân gia đình chị xuất ra thị trường khoảng 2 tấn lợn thịt, số vịt đẻ gia đình chị nuôi là 200 con trung bình trừ chi phi mỗi ngày thu nhập 150.000đ. Từ khi tham gia vay vốn đầu tư dự án có hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, năm 2007 gia đình chị đã tích lũy mua được 1 chiếc máy cày phục vụ nông nghiệp và làm dich vụ cày thuê cho bà con trong địa phương. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs farming

loans.name: Mwaka's Tusisahau Kwetu Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 42 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 19 years old. She is a bucket producer. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

Mwaka is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaisha.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que son solteros e independientes.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace 4 años, negocio con el cual se siente orgullosa de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos, trabaja todo el día, y le encanta mucho su trabajo porque socializa y aprende mucho.  Sus productos de belleza los deja al crédito o al contado y los lleva a ofrecer por los distintos lugares de su zona.  Ahora quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus bebidas heladas y por ello presenta esta solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three still-single children who are now on their own. She dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products and cold beverages (beer and soda), which she has done for the past four years. She is proud of her business and of managing to help her children get ahead. She works all day, and she enjoys it a great deal because she gets to socialize with others and learn a lot. She sells her products on credit or in cash, and she takes them around the various areas of her zone to sell. She would like to order a kiosk built where she could sell her cold beverages, which is why she is soliciting a loan.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for the selling of cold beverages.

loans.name: Edosa

texts.en:
Edosa I. sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She lives in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and has five children. Her husband is a retired civil servant.

Edosa sells provisions like toothpaste, bathing soap, and detergent. She needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell. She says that God will continuously bless Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Los Montones Group

texts.en:
Martha S. has lived a very difficult life. Her whole life she has been living in extreme poverty and has not found a way to generate a steady income. She is a 55-year-old single mother of two children. She came to Esperanza International in hopes of receiving a loan so she could start her own business, and she sees this opportunity as a way to change her fortune and to give her a purpose.

She has always wanted to be able to provide a good life for her children, and be able to travel and have her own house. Martha is going to start a small business selling clothing in her area, and is so excited to get started. She is going to buy cheap clothing and fix it herself to sell. She really feels like a change is coming for her and her family, and she is ready to do whatever it takes. She is a really hardworking woman. We are all excited about her future!

Martha represents a "Bank of Hope," of which she is one of 10 members.

loans.use: Buy material to make clothing

loans.name: Aureliana

texts.es:
La señora Aureliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 500 compró aceite lubricante para auto para venderlo en su local. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que tiene una tienda de filtros para auto. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará filtros y aceite lubricante para auto. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser propietaria de un grifo y un local propio donde vender sus aceites y filtros.
texts.en:
Aureliana is a member of the 'Dante Nava' Community Bank, in the province, district and department of Puno. She is 38 years old, single and the mother of three children. With her first loan of S/. 500 she bought motor oil to sell in her shop. She has worked with the community bank for almost one year and she tells us that she has a shop selling car oil filters. With this loan of S/. 1,500 to be repaid in 4 instalments she will buy filters and motor oil. Aureliana wishes to continue working to become the proprietor of her own petrol station and shop where she can sell motor oil and filters.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase car oil filters and motor oil

loans.name: Sadia Rana Yameen Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sadia and I married to a man whose name is R. Y., a salesman by profession. He deals with wholesalers and buys different items, specifically bakery items, and sells them to different shops. He has 15 years of experience in this business. I am the mother of 2 sons who are not of school-going age. I keep myself busy preparing embroidered dresses. I take orders from my neighbors and charge them $3 per dress. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy bakery items (bread, butter) for my husband so that he will be able to sell them and earn a good income."

Sadia is the leader for another lady in her group. Khalida baji wants a loan to repair her working vehicle called “Shahzore”.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bakery items to re-sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el centro poblado Pueblo Libre, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría incompleta (segundo grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas (manzanas, uvas, plátanos, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio según la época (sandia, uvas, etc.) 
Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas, podrá adquirir mas mercadería (frutas) para su negocio según la demanda y la época, tales como: Sandía, plátanos, Papayas, uvas, etc., con las ganancias ella piensa ayudar en la educación de sus hijos; asimismo su sueño es tener su auto propio (camioneta) para llevar sus productos a otras ferias de la región.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the community bank "03 de Mayo," in the El Collao province of Puno. She is 35 years old, and lives with her four children and their father. She has achieved a second-grade level education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos (a Kiva partner) for 6 years, and she sells fruit (apples, grapes, bananas, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Soles, with which she was able to acquire merchandise for her business, depending on the season (watermelon, grapes, etc.). With this loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles, which she hopes to repay in 5 installments, she will be able to buy more merchandise (seasonal fruit) for her business such as: watermelon, bananas, papayas, grapes, etc.

With the earnings, she hopes to help with her children's education, and her dream is to have her own vehicle (a truck) to bring her products to other fairs in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise (fruit)

loans.name: Yuster

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Yuster M. from Mwanza. She is married and has three children between the ages of 15 and 24. She is also responsible for supporting two additional dependents because their parents do not take care of them.

Yuster has been running a clothes business since 2008. Her store sells kanga and vitenge, which are traditional kinds of clothing worn by Tanzanian women. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile: the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Yuster works at her business eight hours a day, six days per week, and has one shop assistant. Yuster currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to add more traditional African clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Yuster thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add more traditional African clothes.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agbalépédo, elle est divorcée de son mari et a 02 enfants, elle est très dynamique et travaille dure pour subvenir au besoin de ses enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de chaussures, de pagnes, de sacs et de mèches. Elle désire agrandir son stock avec 02 cartons de chaussures,15 paires de pagnes, 01 carton de mèches et une dizaine de sacs. C’est pour cela qu’elle demande son premier crédit à WAGES.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Agbalépédo district. She is divorced and has two children. She is very energetic and works hard to provide for her children. The work she does involves selling shoes, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bags, and hair extensions. She would like to expand her inventory with two boxes of shoes, fifteen pairs of pagnes, one box of hair extensions, and a dozen bags. This is why she's asking WAGES for her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and cloth

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo sells drinks and snacks. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa P. lives with her husband and two teenage daughters in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two daughters are both high school students. Bayarmaa has a small business selling women's fashion accessories, such as creams and hair brushes. She occupies a small space outside the local market where she started her business in 2004. Small retailers who cannot afford to rent a stall inside the market place occupy small spaces outside the market door and try to sell their products. She purchases the items she sells from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and brings them to Ovorhanghay. In the future, she would like to expand her business and be financially able to rent a stall inside the market. She requests a loan to purchase small items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Julia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Julia es artesana, realiza tejidos en palito y bordados, Julia integra una asociación llamado Basilio Auqui integrado por 18 mujeres, los trabajos que realizan son a pedido y exportan a diferentes mercados.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana.
Julia sueña con ser empresaria, ampliar sus mercados y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ollantay Village Bank. She is 50 years old and married with five children. Julia is an artisan who does knitting and embroidery. She is a member of a local association called Basilio Auqui, made up of 18 women who take orders and export their work to different markets. Julia needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy wool. She dreams of owning her own business, of exporting to more markets, and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 55 year-old married man with 2 children living in Keter Maya, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a mini market since 2000. Today Omar is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be able to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ashogbon

texts.en: S. sells sand and gravel for house building. She gets her goods from the Lagos lagoon and the sandbar beach, from a boat service at the riverside. Then she uses a tipper or truck to supply her customers. She started this business eight years ago. She is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sand. S. is 36 years old and is married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Hà Thị

texts.en:
T. Hà Thị (1824071471) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling juice and soft drinks in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. T. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Teresa Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas, un grupo grande de mujeres que se reúne cada dos semanas en la oficina de Espoir en Jipijapa, una pequeña ciudad en la costa ecuatoriana. Ella tiene 60 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos y 7 nietos. 3 de sus hijos ya son independientes, mientras uno vive todavía con ella y también le ayuda con su negocio. Su esposo es maestro de construcción. 

Teresa vende comida desde su casa, ubicada unas 4 cuadras del centro, donde ya hace 3 años tiene un pequeño restaurante de nombre “Teresita.” Vende almuerzos y meriendas, y prepara platos variados según su estado de ánimo y los ingredientes que tiene a mano. Los almuerzos generalmente consisten de una sopa y un plato fuerte, mientras las meriendas son arroz con menestras y carne asada (de pollo o res). Ella comienza a cocinar en la mañana, y ya sus clientes comienzan a llegar para almorzar a las 11am. Ella termina de vender las meriendas a las 9 o 9:30 de la noche. Cada día vende unos 20 almuerzos y 30 meriendas. Ella misma prepara la comida, pero sí cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo y una señora.

Teresa está pidiendo este préstamo para poder comprar gaseosas, ingredientes, una vajilla nueva para reemplazar la que está usando actualmente (la cual está algo dañada), y también algunos adornos para mejorar el ambiente de su local. 

Dice que tiene ilusiones grandes para el futuro, por ejemplo le gustaría mucho viajar a España para visitar a los parientes que tiene que están viviendo allá.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the United Women cooperative bank, a large group of women that meet every two weeks in the offices of ESPOIR, in Jipijapa, a small town on the Ecuadorian coast. She is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children and 7 grandchildren. 3 of her children now live on their own, while one still lives with her and helps her with her business. Her husband works in construction. Teresa sells food from her home, located 4 blocks from the center of town. For 3 years, she has had a small restaurant called “Teresita”. She sells lunch and snacks, and prepares a variety of dishes based on her customers’ likes and the ingredients she has on hand. Lunches generally consist of a soup and a main course, while afternoon snacks might be rice stews and roasted meat (chicken or beef). She starts cooking in the morning, and customers begin to arrive for lunch at 11 am. She finishes selling food at 9 or 9:30 at night. Each day, she sells 20 lunches and 30 afternoon snacks. She makes the food herself, but does have help from her son and another lady. Teresa is requesting this loan so she can buy sodas, ingredients, and ceramic ware to replace the one she is currently using (which is somewhat damaged), and also some decorations to improve the ambiance of her establishment. She tells us she has great ambitions for the future, for example, traveling to Spain to visit some of her relatives that are living there.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas, ingredients, ceramic ware, and decorations for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stationeries equipments in bulk

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie Fotu is a 66-year-old woman living in the town of Auala.  She is married and has fourteen grown children.  To make a living, Sophie owns and operates a business running a food stall.  Her main source of income from the business comes from selling beef products in the local community.  Sophie has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately $160 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sophie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Sophie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Sophie is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will also be used to buy more products to sell.  This will be her second loan from SPBD.  Sophie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Leon, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en el distrito de santiago, nuestro socio como un buen grupo de sus compañeros de dedican a la venta de libros, este socio tiene su pequeño stand y vende libros, motivo por el cual requiere el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo para mejorar su calidad de vida y abastecerse más de libros, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner is Mr. Leon and he belongs to the community bank, “Leaders of the Third Millennium.” Our partner is a native of the city of Cusco. He is 55 years old, single, and without children. He lives in the district of Santiago. This partner, along with a good group of his friends, sells books. He has a small stand where he sells books, and for this reason he needs a loan to be able to reinvest in his small business. He is grateful and values the loan which will allow him to improve his quality of like and supply more books. He is committed to completing his loan payments in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
Jhonna G., 33 years of age, has operated a junk shop for almost one year. Her weekly net income is 2,200 PHP. She plans to avail of a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of 4,000 PHP for her additional requirements, and she hopes to become productive in due time to support her family in their needs. 

She is married to Mr. Renato G., a farmer, and has been blessed with 3 children: Jonathan, 10 years old and in grade 5; followed by Renato Jr., 8 years old and in grade 3; and their youngest, John Rey, 5 years old. They are residing at baranggay San Francisco, Isabela. Their house is located near the rice farm and fish ponds. She hopes that her loan will be granted as soon as possible. She believes that "prayer changes everything; just have faith in him."

loans.use: Additional capital for her junk-shop business

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam S. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 26 years old. Merriam is single. To make a living, Merriam owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of food ingredients like sugar, oil and many others, and at the same time she is also selling electronics (like cell phones) of different networks in the local community. Merriam has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merriam is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus S. is from the village of Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Venus is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Venus makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling bananacue in the local community. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venus joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Venus is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Venus from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell. Juan, 42 years old and widowed, has seven children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en: Mrs. L., 54, is a widow with three children, and they live together in a wooden house located in the village of Banteay Meanchey, the province of Cambodia. Two of her kids are employed: her first child is a repairman in the stone crushing industry and her second child is staff for an electrical sale shop in nearby country, while the remaining one attends school. To earn a living, L. sells grocery inventory in the busy market and earns an average of $4 each day to pay for family’s daily foods. Because now L.’s school-aged child attains university and needs money to pay a school fee. L. lacks money to have paid this fee and she requests a loan of US$300.

loans.use: To pay a school fees

loans.name: Diariétou

texts.fr: Diariétou M. est une femme de 53 ans elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 9 ans et y a bénéficié de 18 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle possède d'une table au marché où elle vend des légumes et d'autre produits alimentaire tels que de l'huile de palme et des épices. Elle participe à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diariétou M. is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and has seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Petit Kandé for nine years and has already benefited from 18 loans. She has repaid all of her previous loans. She has a stall at the market where she sells vegetables and other food products like palm oil and spices. She helps pay for her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operational cash flow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Gracilyn

texts.en:
Gracilyn O., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Orlando O., a pipe fitter, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own meat and vegetable shop while supervising her computer shop.

Gracilyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 26,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. by buying raw materials for her food business and additional stocks for her store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can send their children to college and finish a course.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchasing raw materials for food business and additional stocks for her store

loans.name: Edilisa

texts.es:
Edilisa, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, con ellos, su esposo Edinson (24), quien es agricultor y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 3 años.

Desde hace un año instaló en su casa una pequeña tienda de comestibles, puesto que quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Notó que por la alejada zona donde viven no había una tienda cerca y aprovechó la buena oportunidad para empezar su negocio. Al principio con poca mercadería y después de un tiempo ha logrado abastecerla con mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad. Esta actividad es tranquila y trabaja sola, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, aunque a veces extiende el horario de atención por las constantes necesidades de sus vecinos. 
Paralelamente, ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas, pero solo en los tiempos de cosecha, ya que no le queda mucho tiempo libre con la tienda y la crianza de los niños. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio e imagen.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito  para seguir trabajando. Edilisa tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en abarrotes para abastecer su tienda, porque quiere traer productos nuevos y de mejor calidad  para ofrecer a sus habituales clientes.
texts.en:
Edilisa is 24 years old and lives in her in-laws’ home, along with her husband, Edinson (24), who is a farmer, and with her two young children, ages 4 and 3. A year ago she opened a small food store in their home because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She saw that there were no stores nearby, so she took advantage of this and opened her own store. She started with a few items and has managed to stock it with many basic needs products over time. This job is easy and she works by herself from six in the morning to six in the evening, although at times she extends her hours to meet her customer’s needs. She also helps her husband with the farm work, but only during the harvest season because she does not have much free time between running the store and raising her children. But since she is an enterprising woman, she plans to improve her store’s fixtures in order to give it a better look and be able to improve her customer service. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is grateful to all the people who make this loan possible and allow her to continue to work. Edilisa will use the money from this loan to buy groceries in bulk to stock her store. She wants to bring in new and better quality items to offer to her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: La Inmaculada (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Inmaculada esta integrado por mujeres y hombres trabajadores, emprendedores que dia a dia con su trabajo sacan adelante a sus familias, este banco se formo en la comunidad Ingapirca a 45 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, aqui podemos disfrutar de las famosas ruinas de Ingapirca, de su exhuberante vegetación y un paisaje sin igual que atrae a turistas de todas partes del país  y el mundo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, los más jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo y superación social y económica.

Ligia Roxana B. es una de las socias mas jóvenes del banco comunal, con apenas 19 años de edad vive en unión libre y ya es madre de una niña de 2 años, su pareja trabaja en el  área de la construcción con quien edificaron su casa  propia de lo que se se siente muy orgullosa.

Ligia trabaja como empleada doméstica de lunes a viernes de 7 a.m. a 5 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de pollos que los vende pelados o vivos a sus vecinas de la comunidad y tambien para el consumo en casa.

Este es su segundo crédito en la fundación Espoir, con el primer crédito inició su criadero de pollos y ahora con el dinero que reciba del prestamo solicitado va a comprar malla para hacer un cerramiento e incrementar sus aves de corral.

Tiene como meta seguir trabajando para obtener una mejor posición económica y mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia.

Al igual que Ligia,  Tania  desea superarse conjuntamente con su familia, a sus 18 años vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien procreó un niño que se encuentra de nueve meses, su esposo es estuquero realiza principalmente cielos rasos, no tiene casa propia por lo que  viven en  casa de sus suegros. Tania se dedica a cuidar niños en una guardería labor que realiza hace un año  teniendo como horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m.

Es socia del banco comunal la Inamculada gracias a su  cuñada que la invito a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres y hombres alegres y luchadores que buscan el bienestar para su familia, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, con el crédito solicitado va a comprar crías de pollos, vitaminas y alimento  para comenzar con este negocio.

Tiene como meta estudiar corte y confección para trabajar en casa y estar más tiempo con su bebé así como ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
La Inmaculada communal bank is made up of hard-working and enterprising men and women who work day after day so that their families can get ahead. This bank was set up in the community of Ingapirca, which is located 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. Their community is the location of the famous archaeological ruins of Ingapirca, and is also known for its lush vegetation and unique scenery that attracts tourists from all parts of the country and the world. The members of the community make a living through farming, though the young people have migrated to the city in search of better job opportunities and the chance to improve their economic and social situation. Ligia Roxana B. is one of the youngest members of the communal bank. She is 19 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and is the mother of a 2-year-old daughter. Her husband works in construction, and together they built their own house, which Ligia is very proud of. Ligia works as a domestic servant Mondays through Fridays from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She also makes a living raising chickens, which she sells either dressed or live to her neighbors in the community, and which she also uses for household consumption. This is Ligia’s second loan with the Espoir foundation. She used her first loan to start her chicken farm, and will use the money from the current loan to purchase fencing material, which she will use to make an enclosure and increase the number of birds on her farm. Ligia’s goal is to keep working so that she can improve her economic situation and achieve a better quality of life for her whole family. Like Ligia, Tania wants to improve her situation and help her family. She is 18 years old and is in a common-law marriage, and is raising a son who is only nine months old. Her husband works in construction applying stucco and primarily works on ceilings. She and her family do not have their own home, but instead live in the house of Tania’s in-laws. Tania makes a living looking after children in a daycare center. She has had this job for one year, and works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tania is grateful to her sister-in-law for inviting her to join La Inmaculada communal bank. The group is made up of cheerful men and women who are all fighters, and who are looking after the welfare of their families. She is now in her second loan cycle, and will use the money from this loan to purchase chickens and to purchase vitamins and feed so that she can start a chicken-raising business. Tania’s goal is to study dressmaking so that she can work in her home and spend more time with her baby, and thus help her family more.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fencing material for enclosing a farm, purchasing chickens, and purchasing vitamins and feed for raising chickens

loans.name: Saisii

texts.en:
Saisii N. is 25 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, providing dress making services to local community members.  Saisii has 3 years of experience in this business.  Saisii needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 240 talas or US $100 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Saisii joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Saisii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años, madre de 3 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 33 años, vendía comida de manera ambulante, pero en los últimos años se dedica a vender su potaje en su propio puesto de ventas, en donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes. Ella es la única que cocina, por lo que sus hijos la apoyan comprando los ingredientes en el mercado. Debido a la buena sazón y la variedad de sus paltillos, sus clientes siempre acuden a su establecimiento. Lo que más le agrada a Irma es cocinar y eso lo demuestra en el gusto de elaborar su comida, por lo que le ha dado mucha ventaja en sus ingresos. Es por eso que continuará trabajando, proponiéndose como meta, mejorar su negocio y poder atender clientes nuevos. Este es su 12vo crédito con MFP, y asegura ser responsable con sus pagos, además menciona que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles, ingredientes necesarios su elaborar su comida.
texts.en:
Irma, age 54, lives with her three children in her own house. For 33 years she has been selling food as a street vendor. But, for the past few years she has been selling her stews from her own stand, where she waits on her customers everyday. She is the only one who cooks; her children help her by purchasing the ingredients in the market. Due to the good seasoning and the variety of her dishes, her customers always come to her establishment. What Irma likes the most is cooking, and she shows this by her pleasure in making her food. This has been very advantageous for her income. That is why she will continue working. Her goal is to improve her business to be able to wait on new customers. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She guarantees that she will be responsible with her payments. She says that this help will be very useful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy non-perishable food and the ingredients she needs to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make more food

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza J., 27 years old, is a rice farmer. She has two children and her eldest child is 9 years old and studying in grade four.

Riza started her business in 2004. Until now, she has grown rice because she sees a good potential in this kind of business. She helps her husband grow the rice and labors so hard so that she will be able to provide her family with an adequate supply of food.

Riza would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou D. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Depuis le 25 février 2005 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL  et a reçu 10 fois de suite de crédit qu’elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé fidèlement. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et son crédit lui permettra d’acheter 20 moutons et de l’aliment de bétail. Elle engraisse les bêtes pendant au moins 4 mois pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité lui permet de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Seynabou D. is a 36-year old woman who is married and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NDONDOL since 25th February 2005 and has had 10 consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid on time. She has a sheep fattening activity, and her loan will allow her to buy 20 sheep and food for them. She fattens up the animals for at least four months to resell them in the weekly markets in her town. This activity allows her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her self-financing capacity and buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: La Corregidora Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama la corregidora por que así es llama la colonia donde viven las  integrantes de este grupo y como es una calle muy conocida en la cuidad de Pinotepa pues les gusto el nombre, y las integrantes son Elsa se  dedica a la  venta de antojitos, Miriam a la Zapatería, Guadalupe a la florería, Josefa  venta de abarrotes, Donalda  una zapatería, Elena tiene una farmacia, Juan  se dedica a una jardinería,  Flavio  venta de abarrotes, Agustina  a carnicería y Dalia venta de ganado.

Donalda esta casada, su esposo es campesino ellos tienen 5 hijos los cuales se llaman  Sandra de 16 años, Viridiana 15 , Jaquelin 14, Maria Isabel de 12 y Francisca de 10 años de edad. Donalda quiere poner una zapatería  para poder  ayudar a sus hijos  para que estudien, pues están cursando la Primaria y  la secundaria, su finalidad es poder cubrir los gastos de la escuela.

Con el préstamo que recibió ella surtirá en calzado para dama, caballeros y para niños, su objetivo es poder ofrecer un mejor servicio en la comunidad de Tlacamama ya que no tiene muchas competencias por que hay pocas  tiendas de calzado, ella sabe que le ira  muy bien en sus ventas su meta es poder rentar un local en donde establezca su Zapatería  y así pueda crecer mas su negocio.

Y nos comenta que se siente muy satisfecha por el préstamo por que pudo surtir su zapatería y también esta a gusto trabajando con sus compañeras ya que son trabajadoras y honestas, todas luchan  por alcanzar una meta,  mejorar su condición económica y ofrecerles un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
The group is called "la corregidora" because this is the name of the district where the members of this group live and as it is a very well known street in the city of Pinotepa they like the name. The members are Elsa who sells snacks, Miriam has a shoe shop, Guadalupe a flower shop, Josefa sells groceries, Donalda has a shoe store, Elena has a pharmacy, Juan does gardening, Flavio sells groceries, Agustina a butcher's shop and Dalia sells livestock. Donalda is married, her husband is a farm worker and they have 5 children who are called Sandra (16), Viridiana (15) , Jaquelin (14), Maria Isabel (12) and Francisca (10). Donalda wants to open a shoe shop to be able to help her children with their studies, as they are in elementary and secondary school, her aim is to be able to cover school expenses. With the loan that she received she will stock up on footwear for women, men and children. Her objective is to offer a better service in the community of Tlacamama since there is not a lot of competition because there are few shoe stores. She knows that she will do well in her sales and her goal is to be able to rent a store where she can establish her shoe shop and there she can grow her business. And she tells us that she feels very happy with the loan because she was able to stock up her shoe shop and also she likes working with her fellow members since they are hard working and honest, they are all striving to reach a goal, to improve their financial condition and offer a better future to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY WOMEN'S, MEN'S AND CHILDREN'S SHOES.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Mrs. Sa L. is a middle-aged woman who appears in the photo above. She has two children, both of whom are students and who live with her. Sa L. makes a living selling food items such as candies, cakes, snack foods, and soft drinks to children in the public local school. She buys these food items for her store from a wholesale supplier. Her husband supplements the family income by working as an electrician. He is also hired by people to cook for wedding parties and other ceremonies. Sa L. is requesting a loan to purchase an old motorcycle to meet her family's traveling needs.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorcycle

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El solicitante es casado, tiene una niña de 6 meses. Vive en la casa de sus suegros con los cuales comparte gastos de la unidad familiar. Cuenta con un terreno ubicado en comatrana. Tiene bienes de primera necesidad. El solicitante trabaja como chofer de mototaxi; su esposa vende menu en el mercado San Antonio. Solcita el credito para avanzar la construccion de su terreno.
texts.en:
The applicant is married and has a six month old daughter. He lives in his mother-and father-in law’s house. They share the family expenses. He has some land located in Comatrana. He has the basic necessities. The applicant works as a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver. His wife sells meals at the San Antonio market. He is requesting a loan to progress with the construction on his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of his house

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 23 años de edad reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento Morazán, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años, vende frutas y  refrescos.
Tiene un año de manejar el negocio, el cual esta ubicado en la casa de habitación  la ventaja es que esta un centro escolar muy cerca  y los alumnos en su mayoría compran productos a Maritza, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar: frutas, bebidas carbonatadas, boquitas, dulces. Esto dinero ayudara a tener producto nuevos para sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos.
Las aspiraciones son tener un tienda con variedad productos que ofrecer para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 23 years old and resides in Lolotiquillo, Department of Morazán. She is a single mother with two children, ages 3 and 2. Maritza sells fruits and soft drinks.
