She has managed her business for one year. It is located in her house, which has an advantageous location near a school. Most of the customers who buy her products are students. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, carbonated beverages, snacks, and candy. The money will help her have new products for her customers and improve her revenues.

Her aspirations include having a store with a variety of products to offer so that she can improve the living conditions of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, carbonated beverages, snacks, and candy

loans.name: Julias Ogola

texts.en:
Julias has operated his workshop in Naivasha town for the last ten years.  He is 33 years old, married to Jackline Agola, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to buy more lumber for making new furniture to sell.

Julias plans to move his workshop near the town center in Naivasha, where he will get a place with electricity and increase his exposure to more clients.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Tomas Dionisio

texts.es: Tomas tiene un molino ubicado en ojochal una comunidad en donde él vive. Este es su séptimo crédito con la Fundación. Para Tomas su negocio es bien importante, porque le significan los ingresos de su hogar, por eso lo cuida mucho y sus créditos que han aplicado a su actividad, logrando aumentar su capital de trabajo y gradualmente ha visto sus utilidades reflejadas en mejoras para su hogar. Por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes recurren a su local ya que ofrece un buen servicio,  pues Tomas está allí desde las 7 de la mañana y cierra su negocio a las 5 de la tarde. Este financiamiento es para la compra de bandas, repuestos eléctricos para el molino y accesorio.
texts.en:
Tomas has a mill located in Ojochal, the community where he lives. This is his seventh loan with the foundation. For Tomas his business is pretty important because it provides the income for his home. For this reason he takes good care of it and the loans that have allowed his activity. He's managed to expand his working capital and gradually he's seen the profits reflected in the improvements of his home. The majority of his customers return to his shop because he offers a good service. Tomas is there from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. This loan is for the purchase of bands and spare electrical parts and accessories for the mill.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in Kawempe neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). Margaret has a business of selling ground nuts, both squeezed and cereals. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail.    

Margret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of ground nuts. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Margaret include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline G., from the Barangay of Bitoon, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 39 years of age, married, and blessed with two children, both of whom are students. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store business and is also receiving support from her husband as a farmer. Engaged in her business for five years already, Evangeline earns approximately Php3,000.00 a month.

In 2005, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan amount of Php5,000.00 and is now requesting her seventh loan in the amount of Php10,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her store.

Evangeline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for the children’s education, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo  est un regroupement de 10 femmes  qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, sont mariées et mères de 8 enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités : vente de riz, de condiments. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Chien Kamakan de Yangasso, préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). Les femmes du groupe sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et est à son premier prêt. 
KARIYA S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter pour acheter, 900 kg de riz au marché de Bla  en vu de le revendre à la foire hebdomadaire. Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel  de 12500 FCFA qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 11.000 FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiales
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of 10 women who know one another through parental and neighborly ties.  They are, on average, 36 years old, married and the mothers of 8 children.  They run different businesses: the sale of rice, condiments.  They live in large traditional families in Chien Kamakan de Yangasso, the SAN prefecture (in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali).  The women of the group are very sought-after in their business.  With the goal of satisfying the growing needs of their customer base, the group has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program this year and are on their first loan.  

Kariya S. expects to use her first loan to buy 900 kg of rice at the Bla market, with the hope of reselling it at the weekly fair.  She hopes to makes a monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA which will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her busienss.  The other members expect to make a profit of 11,000 FCFA per month, which will allow them to repay the loan and to support their families' needs.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Sasat

texts.en:
Sasat P. lives in the city of Gyumri in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with a 27-year-old son. Sasat has a high school education.

For the past five years, Sasat has been operating a retail grocery store. She dreams of renovating her family's house. Sasat is seeking a loan to purchase inventory and to expand the range of goods in her store. With the loan proceeds, she is expecting to generate a 25% increase in her business income. She explains that her store is in a great location, which makes it an ideal candidate for expansion. Sasat is pleased with microfinance services and looks forward to the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To expand her store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela, D. 62 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive sola en su casa propia, ya que hace algunos años su esposo falleció y lo que más desea en vivir una vejez tranquila. El trabajo al que Carmela se dedica, es el cultivo D. cacao, café y coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho D. la calidad D. su cosecha. Ella venD. sus productos en la ciudad D. San Francisco, puesto que es donD. mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro D. que los químicos la enfermen. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mejores ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en insumos que le ayuden a cuidar sus plantaciones D. la plaga D. insectos.
texts.en:
Carmela, 62, is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives alone in her own house since her husband died several years ago. What she wants most is to live a tranquil life in her later years.

Carmela’s work is the cultivation of cacao, coffee, and coca. Every day, she works in her fields, as she knows that the profit she makes on her products depends on the quality of the harvest. She sells her products in the city of San Francisco, where the prices are the best. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her fields; at this time, she feels that the months of work have borne fruit. 

Carmela has done this work for 40 years and finds the most difficult part is fumigating the fields, as there is always the risk of sickness from the chemicals. For the future, she hopes to improve her harvests, to obtain more income.

This is Camela’s second loan with MFP, and she says that this support will help her very much in progressing with her work. In her communal bank, she is very loved by the other members, as she is very connected with them. The 1000 soles from this loan will be used to invest in products that will help protect the plants from insects.

loans.use: Buy insecticides for fields.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a very talented woman, operating her clothing sales business to share the financial burden with her husband. She purchases clothes from the Ichra and Shahalmi wholesale markets in Lahore and sells to her local area clients.

Shakeela lives in Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city, famous for its food and culture. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Yadgar. Life is not easy in a big city as the cost of living is getting higher and higher every day, which leads to continuous efforts to improve business conditions to meet the needs of daily life. Therefore, Shakeela has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah to improve her clothing sales business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of clothes in bulk. This will help her offer more variety to her clients and to make more sales. She is hopeful that an investment will improve her business conditions and bring good changes to her family’s financial life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Lizardo Baudillo

texts.es:
Lizardo Baudillo Q. C.  tiene 48 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Lizardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte conocer gente y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Lizardo Baudillo Q. C. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and six children in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

The members of the V.R.C Luz y Progreso [Light and Progress] are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office in the canton of Chillanes.  The group is made up of farmers and other laborers.  It has 17 members.

Lizardo is a farmer who plants corn, beans, peas, and lupini beans.  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in the market in Chillanes and in his area. 

He is asking for this loan to purchase corn, bean, peas, and lupini bean seeds.  With the support of this loan, he will be able to meet his financial needs.  He can meet challenges like plagues, sicknesses, and weather changes.  His dream is to continue working and send his children to school.

He likes to play sports, meet people, and celebrate holidays.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for his corn, bean, pea, and lupini bean crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 56-year-old farmer.  She sells animal products such as meat and milk.  Mary has been running her business for three years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances.  She hopes to completely educate her last-born child, who is still in school.   She needs a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials such as stone, concrete and blocks in order to continue to build the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S. is a 50-year-old married mother from a rural area of Kompong Cham province. She is a local farmer who plants a rice crop in order to earn a daily income. She generates, on average, $1 per day, which she uses to meet family expenses. Her husband makes a profit by driving a horse cart in and around his community. The couple is blessed with six children, two of whom are single and work in a local shop selling construction equipment.
At present, it is the time for tending to the dry-season rice field. Yun S. planted her rice crop a month ago, but it is not doing well because it needs more fertilizer. In order to deal with this situation, Yun S. has requested a loan from Kiva to buy gasoline and many sack of fertilizers to get her crop going well. With the rest of the loan, she will buy a new horse cart for her husband. The couple and their granddaughter appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer and a new horse cart

loans.name: Pan

texts.en: Pan C., 41, is married and lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for its rubber plantations. C. and her husband are farmers, earning $3.70 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $45 US on food and $20 US on other expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $1200 US to purchase cashew nuts to resell. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts to resell

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” es un grupo formado por 10 socios la mayoría de ellos viven en puente piedra un lugar al norte de Lima  que se caracteriza por su gente trabajadora y emprendedora,  el Sr. Roque es una clara muestra de ello ya que por mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de la panadería y pastelería el se dedica a preparar todo tipo de pasteles y los  reparte a sus clientes  que  ha ganado en todo este tiempo, el negocio de la panadería tiene épocas muy buenas por ejemplo en fiestas prepara  panetones y turrones lo que le deja buenas ganancias  cuando la temporada baja  se dedica  al transporte urbano ya que con sus ahorros pudo comprar una combi para hacer transporte urbano esto le permite otra entrada mas para darle lo mejor a su familia,  mas adelante quiere invertir en un negocio que aun esta en proyecto ahora  usara su préstamo para comprar insumos de panadería  como harina, azúcar y levaduras  el Sr. Roque quiere seguir avanzando y crecer en lo que a su negocio se refiere.

* El Sr.Roque es el 7mo, esta vestido con camisa a cuadros.
texts.en:
LAS EMPRENDEDORAS is a group made up of 10 members.  The majority of them live in Puente Piedra, a district to the north of Lima that is characterized by its hard-working and enterprising people.  

Senor Roque is a good example since he spends most of his time working in his bakery and pastry shop.  Here he prepares all types of pastries that he sells to the customers that he has earned over time.  The bakery has good times.   For example, for parties he prepares panetones [a type of sweet bread] and turrones [a traditional Peruvian dessert] which bring in a decent income.  During the low season he works in urban transportation because with his savings he was able to buy a combi (microbus).  This gives him access to another way to make money so that he can give his family the best.  Later he wants to invest in another business that is still in the early draft stages.  Right now he will use the loan to purchase items for his bakery such as flour, sugar and yeast.  

Señor Roque wants to continue advancing and growing his current business.  *Señor Roque is the seventh person in the picture and is wearing the plaid shirt.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen A. lives with his wife and three children in Shake village in the Sisian region. Karen keeps a cattle farm and cultivates land. Karen has some machinery that requires renovation. Karen also cuts the grass in the fields during the season and it is vital for him to have the tractor run well and be ready before that. It is all thanks to hard work and lots of effort that Karen is able to earn an income for his family and secure his children’s stable future.

Karen took the loan to repair his tractor before seasonal works start.

loans.use: to repair his tractor

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 43 years old and married, with seven children in school. For the past six years, he has been selling secondhand clothes. He previously offered dry cleaning services.

Evans is also a church pastor; hence, he has employed one person to run his business in his absence. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Evans has learned how to save his money. He has also developed a lot of business skills through business trainings offered by Faulu Kenya. Evans hopes to grow his business to another level in the future. He has requested a loan of 25,000 KES to add more clothing to his stock.

loans.use: to add more clothing to his stock.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette P. is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three small children. Bernadette works as a cultivator of her own farm. She planted different crops to sell in their market. She has been engaged in this activity for more than 10 years.

In 2009, Bernadette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid her previous loan of Php14,500. She is now requesting a new loan of Php35,000 as her fifth loan, which will be used to invest in a cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees).   

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in a cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees)

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco R. L., tiene la edad de 25 años, está casado  y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El lo que pretende con el préstamo es comprar la semilla para su siembra y luego sus insumos para su posterior asistencia. El cuenta con la experiencia en la producción de este cultivo y con el terreno apto para su explotación por lo cual es que invertirá. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia y así poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida a futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Francisco R. L. is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife and son who are his highest priorities. He intends to use this loan to buy seeds for planting and supplies that he will need later to maintain his crops. José has experience producing this type of crop and suitable land to be used for this purpose. He wants to generate income for the welfare of himself and his family so that they can have a better quality of life and a better future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. José has not had any previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and supplies for growing beans.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
DESCRIPTION	Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dinkoro, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de savons, d’arachide et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, des savons, d’arachide et des condiments.                                                                        
YAMA  compte acheter des prêts-à-porter avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group, all married, are on average 27 years old with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of N’Dinkoro, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They got to know each other through family, neighbors and friends. They retail clothing, soap, peanuts and condiments.
This is the first solidarity loan for the women of the Djiguisseme group. It will be used to purchase clothing, soap, peanuts and condiments.                                                                        
YAMA is planning on purchasing ready-to-wear clothes from resellers at the Fana market. She retails in the village, for cash or credit, to a clientele comprising men and women.
She foresees an average monthly benefit of 15,000F CFA which will be used to pay back the loan and pay her contribution to social ceremonies, with the remainder to be reinvested in her retail activity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Celia Jenny

texts.es:
Celia Jenny tiene 41 años, Es viudad vive con un hijo de 13 años que esta en el colegio viven en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Celia se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es que laproduccion aumente para tener mas ingresos y poder mantener a su hijo.

Le gusta mucho escuchar usica y salir con su hijo.
texts.en:
Celia Jenny, age 41, is a widow who lives with her 13-year-old son, who is in school.  They live in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.

The communal group "EL RECREO" is located in Ventanas Canton in the San Vicente sector of Las Lomas.  This group is involved in farm activity, raising short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, beans and soy.

Celia grows corn, rice and soy on her parents' land.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells at the fair every day, especially on Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  The loan will help her economically to cover her needs.  Her greatest challenges are the competition and weather variation.  Her dream is to increase production so she can increase income and support her son.

She enjoys listening to music and going out with her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jonathan, de 21 años reside en el caserío de Llanco. Donde es un ejemplar hijo, que lucha ante las adversidades sin miedo, ya que ayuda a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. A pesar de su corta edad, saca provecho de su fuerza y vitalidad; el cual le permite dedicarse a varias actividades. En las mañanas trabaja como peón en una fabrica de su localidad, donde pasa la mayor parte del día; ahí recibe un salario mensual muy bueno que le permite tener la seguridad económica que necesita para poder seguir con sus negocios; “el trabajo en la empresa no es estable”, afirma con nostalgia; “por ello tengo que aprovechar al máximo”. Asimismo por las tardes se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, pero la actividad que más le agrada a Jonathan es la agricultura, donde siembra arveja y papa en el terreno de sus padres, hace ya 5 años. Las ganancias obtenidas en la venta de las arverjas le permitieron abastecer su tienda con más productos, ahora está juntando capital para poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes en el pueblo de Huasahuasi. Ahora todas sus fuerzas se concentran en salir adelante y aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida le da, para poder ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de Llanco” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jonathan de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 21 years old and lives in the small village of Llanco.  He is an exemplary son who fights adversity without fear.  He helps his parents with their household expenses.  In spite of his young age, Jonathan makes the most of his strength and vitality which allows him to work in several business activities.

In the mornings, Jonathan works as a laborer in a local factory where he spends most of the day.  There he receives a very good monthly wage which provides him with the financial security he needs to continue with his own businesses.  "Working for a company is not stable" he says "for that reason, I have to make the most of life".

In the afternoons, Jonathan works in his grocery store but the business activity he most enjoys is farming.  Jonathan has been growing peas and potatoes on his parents' land for five years.  The profits he makes in selling his peas allows him to stock his grocery store with more products.  He is currently putting together some capital in order to open a grocery store in the village of Huasahuasi.  He is concentrating all his strength on getting ahead and taking advantage of all the opportunities that life provides him with so that he can help his family enjoy a better quality of life.

Jonathan is a member of the "Los Ángeles de Llanco" (The Angels of Llanco) community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can realize his goals.  For his part, Jonathan pledges to make his loan repayments on time as he has with his previous loans.

Jonathan enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Jonathan will invest the loan he has requested in buying pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over his upcoming harvest.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.en:
Mathilde is 56 years old . She is married with 4 adult children.

Mathilde has a shop that sells snacks, candies, spices, oil and canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell like snacks, biscuits, juices, milk, coffee and more.

Mathilde has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011.  In the future, Mathilde hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snacks, drinks, oil and candies to sell

loans.name: Custodio

texts.es: El señor Custodio se dedica a la producción leche, actividad que  también la realizan sus hijos y esposa. El crédito lo requiere para construir un establo para sus vacas lecheras y así resguardarlas del frío y las inclemencias del tiempo, pues viven en una zona altiplánica del departamento de La Paz. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  en el departamento de  La Paz; Custodio  es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO; el volumen de sus ingresos y el análisis de su flujo de caja le permite la posibilidad de solicitar un préstamo.
texts.en: Custodio makes a living in milk production, an activity that his wife and children also do. He is requesting the loan to build a stable for his milk cows to protect them from the cold and inclement weather, since he lives in the high plains area in the department of La Paz, Bolivia. He lives in his own home in the town of Achacachi and is married and has five children. This is the first loan he has requested from Kiva partner IMPRO. His revenue volume and an analysis of his cash flow makes him eligible for the loan.

loans.use: to build a stable for his milk cows.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From Kompong Chhang Province of Cambodia, Mrs. Eng, age 41, is an old mother of three children. Presently, she is a pig raiser and grocery seller in front of her house. She can earn average of $5 per day. Her husband is 43 years old. His occupation is a domestic farmer. Taking time for doing farming business, he works at catching fish in and around the pond and river, and is earning a profit of $3 per day. Mrs. Eng would like to requests some fund from Kiva loan in order to purchase pig feed and with the rest of the funds she will buy some mixed product (grocery).

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and buy some mix grocery products

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José su compañera de vida trabaja como domestica siendo un ingreso mas, sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda a futuro establecer un negocio. Trabaja para una empresa privada, se le ha presentando dificultades  para la construcción total por la afectación de la calle en tiempo de lluvia.  Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, arena, piedras cantera, estribu, bloques, tablón de madera para construir el muro de atrás de la propiedad. Obteniendo seguridad y protección para su familia.
texts.en: José lives with his partner who is a domestic employee and contributes to the family household.  His plans are to improve the infrastructure of his house so he can set up a business there in the future.  Currently he works for a private company.  He has been unable to finish the house because of the effects of the rainy season.  He plans to use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand, stone, supports, blocks and wood planks to build a wall behind his property.  This will give his family more security and protection.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Redimundo, an employee, and mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells breakfast meals in the morning like hotdogs and eggs with buns.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosita hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mario Ricardo

texts.es:
Mario,vive con su madre y hermanos, él es empleado trabaja como profesor del centro escolar de un lugar cercano a donde vive, esta desde hace 8 años trabajando de lunes a viernes, además administra un taller de bicicletas.
Él inicio la construcción de un cuarto hace varios meses, con la ayuda de un préstamo, actualmente recurre a esta ayuda para poder terminar la construcción, afinando detalles en la habitación, por lo que pagara más mano de obra, comprara cemento , arena y ladrillo de piso.
Su objetivo es aprovechar los préstamos, que mientras mantenga su trabajo podrá cancelar las cuotas oportunamente, con esto quiere tener una vivienda digna y cómoda para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives with his mother and siblings. He is a teacher at a school close by to where he lives. He has been working there for 8 years, Monday through Friday. He also manages a bicycle shop.

Several months ago, he began the construction of a room with the help of a loan. Actually, he is resorting to asking for help again so that he can finish the construction work, fine-tuning details in the room for which he has to pay for more labour, buying cement, sand and floor tiles.

His goal is to make use of the loans which he will repay punctually while he remains employed. With this, he wants to have a decent and comfortable home for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and floor tiles to finish the construction of a room.

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: Monsieur Birane est un jeune tailleur de 31 ans qui capitalise une expérience de 8 ans dans son activité. Il vit au Sénégal. Il a choisi cette activité dans l’objectif de pouvoir soutenir ses parents. Et la période la plus favorable à son activité reste les veilles des fêtes. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine à coudre. Ce financement  lui permettra d’accroitre ses gains financiers et d’avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en: Birane is 31 years old and lives in Senegal. He is a young man who is already capitalizing on 8 years' worth of tailoring experience. He started in this line of work in order to be able to support his parents financially. His business tends to peak during the days before festivities. He has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since 2010. He is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs so that he can buy a sewing machine. This investment will allow him to increase his profits and become financially autonomous.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children, and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a pub at the shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 7 years. 

She has requested a loan of 1,700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer and soda. Margret generates additional income through a restaurant. Her major challenges include thieves, transportation and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked pub. 

She lives in a house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita owns a retail business selling various stock such as instant noodles, sugar, soaps, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods and other kinds of basic needs. She has been running her business for six years.

According to Carmelita, the income generated from the business enables her to support her five children in covering their daily needs and household expenses. She plans to add more stock requested by the customers but she needs additional capital to do so. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and other basic needs for her store. She is hoping that she could obtain her requested loan to be able to expand the store and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and other basic needs for her store.

loans.name: Yady

texts.es: Yady realiza dos actividades, ella es comerciante de carnes frías y manicurista, la primera actividad le genera más ingresos y aunque la inició después de ser manicurista, aprovechó esta actividad para construir su hoy clientela de productos cárnicos y de mercancía variada.  Cuando Yadi empezó su idea emprendedora, lo hizo capacitándose como manicurista hace 10 años, luego ganó experiencia trabajando como empleada en un salón de belleza durante 2 años  y posteriormente se independizó, logrando utilidades que invirtió en mercancías y posteriormente incursionó en la venta de carnes frías cuando había construido un mercado propio. Yady con sus negocios apoya los gastos familiares de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de 5 a 11 años. La labor de manicurista la realiza principalmente a domicilio. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad lo que le  permite aportar a los gastos del hogar y cubrir sus gastos personales, no posee activos fijos, sus activos son todos corrientes. Su margen de rentabilidad está acorde al tipo de negocio. En la actualidad se prepara para las fiestas de fin de año y requiere comprar carnes frías que tiene encargados, así como mercancías variadas como interiores, ropa femenina e insumos para el desempeño de su actividad como manicurista. Esta es la razón por la cual requiere un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo cual invertirá en los productos ya mencionados.
texts.en:
Yady carries out two activities: she’s a cold cuts merchant and a manicurist.  The first activity generates more income and although she started it after she became a manicurist she took advantage of the opportunity to build her clientele for meat products and assorted merchandise.  When she began with her entrepreneurial idea, she took courses ten years ago to become a manicurist.  She gained experience working as an employee in a beauty salon for two years and then became independent earning profits that she invested in merchandise which led to her going into the cold cuts business once she had an established clientele of her own.

Yady covers family expenses with her businesses.  Her family consists of her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 11 years.  She provides the manicure services primarily in customers’ homes.  Her monthly sales produce a good profit margin which allows her to contribute to household expenses and convert her personal needs.  She does not own fixed assets; all of her assets are fluid.  Her profit margin is appropriate for this type of business.

She is currently getting ready for the end of year festivities and needs to buy cold cuts she has pending orders for as well as assorted merchandise like underwear, women’s wear and supplies she needs for her work as a manicurist.  This is why she needs a Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll invest in the products already mentioned above.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts she has on order as well as assorted merchandise like underwear, women's clothes and supplies.

loans.name: Alphas

texts.en:
Alphas is a 28-year-old married man. He and his wife Cemorine are blessed with four children between six and one year old. Two of the children are currently enrolled in school. Alphas has operated a boda boda (motorbike) business for the past two years. His primary customers are local residents and tourists. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transportation and his highest monthly expense is food. He rents a house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Alphas will use the KES 15,000 loan to repair his motorbike and purchase spare parts. Alphas aspires to purchase more motorbikes in the future. He joined Yehu because they offer favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 42 years old. She is married and has two children who are getting their education by attending local school. Her husband operates a grocery store through which he sells daily use items such as salt, sugar, etc. He also operates a livestock business from home & has some buffaloes whose milk he sells to his community customers.

Shameem is a housewife but in her spare time she also supports her husband in his grocery store and livestock businesses. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan in his grocery store business by purchasing daily use items such as salt, sugar, spices, etc. He is very experienced in his job and Shameem is hopeful that his businesses will grow further after investment.

Note: - The lady holding a pass book in the picture is Shameem.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, spices and other grocery store items for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, a 20-year-old married mother of two, lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, where she has been selling fish for a living for two years. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan of PHP3000 to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: C9295 Twungukevuba Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old and is single. He owns a decoration business which is open from 8am until 8pm 30 every day. He currently employs one person to help him. He is the leader of the group, which is called "C9295 Twungukevuba" in the local language. 

Patrick has two years of experience in this work. Patrick has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more material for the decoration business. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to pay his medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more material for decoration.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is single and has two children, both in school. She also takes care of her old parents. Sarah lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

Sarah has a business selling smoked fish. She has been in this business for five years. She works 6 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products retail at the market. She also generates additional income by selling roasted meat.

Sarah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of smoked fish. The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves, defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only. She wants to start going to Sese islands on Lake Victoria for fish and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of smoked fish

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado mujeres emprendedoras se encuentra en su primera secuencia, las integrantes se conocen entre ella ya que viven por la  misma zona,  la representante es la Sra. Tereza  que tiene la actividad del comercio, venta de zapatillas por mayor, el cual las reparte por el sector de una plaza muy comercial de la ciudad de La Paz no tiene niños dependientes ya que todo sus hijos son independientes,  vive en la zona gran poder, esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse, ella es muy trabajadora se levanta desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, para ir a vender sus productos, el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatillas en cantidad ya que por esta fechas tiene varios pedidos, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" is in their first  loan cycle. The members know one another since they live in the same area.

Their representative is Tereza, who is a small business owner. She sells athletic shoes at wholesale, which she distributes in a very commercial area of the city of La Paz.

She doesn't have dependent children, as all her children are on their own. She lives in the Gran Poder area. This is the only activity that allows her to support herself. She is very hard-working, and gets up at a very early hour of the morning to go sell her products. 

She will use the money from the loan to buy athletic shoes in quantity, since at this time, she has several orders.  She is thankful to the Institution for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes in quantity.

loans.name: Furaha Chanika Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his early 30s, is single. He has two children, one of whom goes to nursery school. He has been running a charcoal business for five years now. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Furaha Chanika," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Gregorio nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de señoras que se agruparon y decidieron formar el comité dentro del barrio. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo del Barrio San Gregorio,  se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
La Sra. Salvadora, presidenta del grupo, tiene 45 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy optimista. Comenta que se dedica a las ventas varias, como ser de ropas, calzados y demás artículos, cuenta que este es su principal fuente de ingresos, y que gracias a su arduo trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y ayudarlos a tener lo mínimo para una vida digna y decorosa. Ella desea seguir ayudando a los suyos por medio de su trabajo, es por ello que pide el crédito, para poder comprar prendas y calzados para vender y de esa forma seguir en su micronegocio. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por la gran oportunidad de progreso que les está dando.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio communal bank emerged with the leadership and support of a group of women who came together and decided to form a bank in the neighborhood. The bank is located in San Gregorio neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Its principal goal is the growth of each member, not only financially but also personally. 

Sra. Salvadora, president of the group, is 45 years old and is an enterprising, hardworking and very optimistic woman. She says that she is engaged in selling various items such as clothing, foodwear, etc. This is her principal source of income and, thanks to her hard work, she has been able to move her family forward and help them to have the minimum necessary for a decorous and dignified life.  She wants to continue helping her own through her work. Thus she is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothing and shoes to sell and continue with her small business. She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the great opportunity  they have given her to succeed.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing and footwear for later sale.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children, a son and a daughter. He describes himself to be God fearing and honest. 

Shaban operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. 

His business challenge is a shortage of charcoal. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. His business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal and own several similar charcoal retail stores within five years. 

Shaban's hope in the future is to buy a property to venture into a new business of providing rental housing services.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aminata Issa

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Aminata Issa.  She is married and has two children aged 18 and 15 years. In 1992, Aminata Issa established her business selling body lotion, earrings, toothpaste, polos, soap, roll-on, bed covers, and spray, etc. She began her business because she used to assist her mother after school hours to sell in the market.  After she dropped out of school and got married, her husband gave her some amount to start the business.  
 
Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Aminata Issa has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bathing soap - 15 dozen @ Le 24,000, polos - 10 dozen @ Le 113,000, bed covers - 10 dozen @ Le 198,000 and toothpaste - 22 dozen @ Le 24,000. Balance Le2,000 for labourer to lift the goods bought.

In the future, Aminata Issa plans to become an international business woman.  These loans will help her to expand her business.  Her major challenge is competition.  She is a serious and hardworking businesswoman.  She will continue to take loans at ARD until she accomplishes her future plans.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bathing soap - 15 dozen @ Le 24,000, polos - 10 dozen @ Le 113,000, bed covers - 10 dozen @ Le 198,000 and toothpaste - 22 dozen @ Le 24,000. Balance Le2,000 for labourer to lift the goods bought.

loans.name: Mahouto Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTO  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Estelle, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 24   ans est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Godens. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Estelle et son mari. Pour cette raison, Estelle vend du maïs, de l’huile végétale et du riz par la technique de distribution depuis trois ans.  Estelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Estelle sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUTO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de l’huile végétale et du riz.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is the group leader of her group in Chwele District, and she is representing 9 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of 3 children. Lilian joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 5 years.

Like many other farmers, Lilian decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Lilian's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights, as, even though Lilian decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package."

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.en:
Mawulé A. is married and the mother of four. Her husband barely grows enough to feed his family. You see, this household is confronted daily with hardship of all sorts, notably hunger and sickness. To help with household expenses, Ms. A. has started a small business selling food crops. She has now gained a great deal of experience allowing her to really grasp the inner workings of the business. Thanks to her heightened sense of management, she was been able to repay each loan that she has obtained.

Today, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $650 to augment her ability keep an inventory of goods to sell in times of shortages. The loan will serve as capital to buy, stock, and sell food crops. The success of her dreams will be very beneficial, particularly in terms of savings. She will also succeed at better providing for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Mawulé est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari pratique une agriculture de subsistance qui suffit à peine pour l’alimentation de la famille. Du coup, le ménage est confronté quotidiennement aux difficultés de tout genre notamment la faim et la maladie. Pour contribuer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille, Madame A. a entrepris le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers. Aujourd’hui, elle a acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de bien cerner les rouages de son activité. Grâce à son sens élevé de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous les crédits qu’elle a obtenus.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Mawulé sollicite un crédit de $650 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pénurie. Le crédit servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. La réalisation de ce rêve lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’épargne. Aussi, réussira t-elle à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and sell produce

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married with six children. He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. Charles keeps cows and chickens as his business. He supplies milk and eggs to retailers. He is in a plan to increase the flock of animals especially broilers. In addition to animal keeping Charles grows vegetables and fruits of which he sells in wholesale and in retail. Droppings from animals are used as manure to the farm.

He needs USD 750 to buy some insecticide for treating his farm and increase the flock of chickens. Charles has expectations that one day he will become a big supplier of farm products.

loans.use: Buy insecticide and chickens

loans.name: Eyvi Areli

texts.en:
My name is Eyvi Manznares, and I have dedicated myself to producing sweet drinks with coconut milk for the past year. My customers are good ones; I sell my product in a cafeteria inside a public school. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to raise my production, and with the earnings I'll be able to provide for my little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Eyvi M. me dedico a la venta de dulces de leche con coco, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en una cafeteria dentro de una escuela publica, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mantener a mi pequeña hija.

loans.use: Purchase coconuts, water, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Deanis Altagracia

texts.en: Deanis Altagracia G. wishes to build a full scale beauty center, featuring acrylic nail fixing capacity. Deanis has been living here 3 years with her husband and their three kids. She recently started selling clothing as well, since she needs to complement the income produced by her beauty aids services and products. She also plans to sell some of the clothing that her family in the USA sends her from time to time. "When my husband finishes the construction of the area where I plan to move the "salon" operations, I plan to be able to assist him as he has helped me. I feel very lucky and grateful for all that we have been able to undertake thus far."

loans.use: She wishes to buy  the equipment that is needed to fix the acrylic nails, and wishes to purchase the hair dryer that's  needed in the beauty parlor.

loans.name: Feraset

texts.en: Feraset H. owns and operates an automotive parts store in the town of Devechi where he was born and raised. Devechi is located just south of the larger town of Khachmaz in northeastern Azerbaijan. Feraset has been running this business for the past six years and is now looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of automotive parts

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.ru:
Mr Suleyman was born and raised in a village not from from the city of Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 21 and is single. 6 years ago he rented a small space and started up a business repairing fuel injection systems in cars. Since Suleyman's personal computer has become obsolete, he decided to purchase a newer one - Pentium 4. This is why he came to Normikro, a partner of Kiva, to borrow $600, which will allow him to do so.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Г-н Сулейман родился и живёт в деревне около г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 21, холост. 6 года назад он арендовал бокс и начал ремонтировать инжекторную систему впрыскивания топлива для автомобилей. Т.к. персональный компютер Сулеймана уже устарел, он решил приобрести более современный Пентиум 4. С этой целью он обратился с заявлением о предоставлении ему кредита под бизнес с суммой в 600 долларов в микрокредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Vaiee Tiaseuga

texts.en: Vaiee is a married mother of five and she is 43 years of age. She has struggled so hard to find a better future for her children and family. Through her loans with SPBD she has managed to improve and develop her business and improve her family's lifestyle. She is one happy mother in Alaoa Centre and she is very thankful for such a great opportunity that she is able to improve her family's lifestyle. This next loan will help her continue to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: Vaiee would like to buy supplies for her canteen business.

loans.name: Kamuli B3(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been toegether for one year. M. is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a small restaurant. With the extra business profits, M. wants to buy a piece of land and register her children for postgraduate degrees. Hadijah offers laundry services. Robinah has a video library while Julie sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their restaurant, laundry, video and charcoal businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sweets and candies for a small business

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob Djurabekovich K. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 28 years old, married and has two children. He has secondary education and is in the agriculture and animal husbandry business. He breeds cattle for resale for meat. He buys cattle on the market, feeds it for about 40-45 days and then resells for a more profitable price and has been doing this for the past five years. This business is the secondary source of income for his family. Additionally, the development of this type of business also allows to supply the markets with meat. Suhrob wants to use the loan to buy younger calves. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонов Сухроб Джурабекович проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей . Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием и животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 5 лет. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa B. is sixty-years old and a she has been a traditional for fifteen years. She is a mother of two children and she manufactures local soap, pomade and powder which provide cures for many skin diseases. Her products have been very helpful to a lot of people with skin problems, but due to financial issues, she has not been able to expand her production. With high demands, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials (perfume, Vaseline, oil etc.) to expand her production and increase her income. Adwoa belongs to a community group called Eagle Trust Group. Members  agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like perfume, Vaseline, oil etc to expand her production of specialty pomades and powders

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. sells cosmetics and fabric. She is married and has one child. Her business is growing and she needs to increase her inventory of goods for sale.

Florence is requesting additional capital to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhanh L. and her husband, Mr. Mey Meth, are subsistence farmers in Sdok Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Their plantation is facing an obstacle because they do not have a draft animal to plow their field. Therefore, Mrs. Nhanh L. has asked for a loan to buy another cow. With the two cows, she can plow her rice field.

Mrs. Nhanh L. is 28 years old and the mother of five children. Two are employed in a garment factory and the remaining three attend school.

Last year, Mrs. Nhanh L. obtained a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field. During that time, one of her children got dengue fever, so Mrs. Nhanh L. spent $175 to have her cured. Her husband appears on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally S., 35, and his wife, Sivorn Mok, 35, live in a village about 10 miles from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. Married for 16 years, they have three young children who are in school.

Phally supports his family by working as a gardener in a hotel and also farms his own land in his free time. Sivorn works in a garment factory. They are requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to dig a well and install a water pumping machine so his family can have clean drinking water. He also plans on using the water for his small farm.

loans.use: To dig a well for his family's drinking water and a small farm

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. 41 years of age has been a member since 2003. Her very first loan of 2.000.000d was invested in the business of mat weaving. The initial loan used prove to be a success and since been borrowing and obtaining more capital for the business. Her daily income is 150.000d. Presently, her children are grown, the two eldest have jobs of their own bringing in a monthly income of 3.000.000d. She is requesting a loan of 12.000.000d to buy more raw materials for mat making. Her average income is 6.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 2000 000đ về đầu tư vào dệt chiếu, nguồn vốn vay anh chị đã quay vòng thấy thuận lợi và có hiệu quả, các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều vay vốn ở mức cao và đầu tư vào dệt chiếu và cho thu nhập bình quân hàng ngày 150.000đ. Hiên tại các con chị cũng đã lớn, 2 con lớn đã đi làm và cho thu nhâp hàng tháng là 3.000.000đ. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000 đầu tư vào buôn bán chiếu. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Afiwo

texts.en: Afiwo Y. is married and has 6 children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Afiwo sells gari, oil and other food items and drinks at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina, which she has done since 1981. Her husband is a mason. Afiwo uses her income to pay for the feeding of the family and the payment of their utility bills. Afiwo will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afiwo plans to support her children's schooling, too.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Parveen Javed Bhatti's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is married to J. B. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 14 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Parveen baji's husband has a scrap business. He has been in this business for the last ten years. Parveen baji herself sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a profit. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles and waste papers) for her husband's scrap business.

Parveen baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rani baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Rozi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more scrap for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou D. est un conducteur de taxi moto depuis 3 ans. Il habite à wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Sa moto faisant objet de réparations régulières, ce qui lui fait dépenser beaucoup, Kokou souhaite par ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto pour relancer son activité. Cette occasion lui permettra faire plus d’économie pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Kokou D. has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He lives in Wome, a village situated about 80 miles from Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. Due to the fact that his motorbike undergoes constant repairs, which have cost him a lot of money, Kokou wishes to buy a new motorbike using this loan so he can relaunch his business. This opportunity will allow him to make more money so he will be in a better position to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es:
Carmelina forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Señor D. Cautivo II” D. distrito y provincia D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Carmelina tiene 37 años D. edad y 3 hijos junto a su conviviente. Afirma que se encuentra bien, que a pesar D. haber venido desD. L. ciudad D. Lima, ha salido adelante. Comenta que empezó gracias al apoyo D. su cuñado quien le hizo un traspaso D. sus productos, también menciona que ha crecido regularmente porque ahora venD. ropa, lentes, discos, relojes, los cuales trae desD. L. ciudad D. Lima. VenD. D. manera ambulatoria en L. esquina D. L. Av. Luzuriaga y el Jr. José D. L. Mar en L. ciudad D. Huaraz. Por ahora todo se encuentra bien y tranquilo.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en L. compra D. casacas D. cuero y pantalones.
 
A Carmelina le gustaría recibir talleres D. capacitación, principalmente para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmelina is a member of the communal bank called “Señor D. Cautivo II” from the district and province of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. Carmelina is 37 years old and she has 3 children with her living partner. She tells us that she is doing very well, even though she has arrived from the city of Lima, she has been able to move ahead. She tells us that she started her own business, thanks to her brother-in-law, who help help her a little with the selling of products. She also tells us that her business has grown a little bit more since now she also sells clothes, sunglasses, cd's, watches which she brings from the city of Lima. She sells from door to door in the avenues between Luziaga and Jr. Jose D. L. Mar in the city of Huaraz. For now, everything is good and calm. With this loan, which she will repay in 8 months, she will purchase leather coats and pants. Carmelina would like to receive training courses as to how to better her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather coats and pants

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores a los que apoya económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró ropa y artículos de segundo uso para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que con el capital obtenido y con los préstamos ha ganado lo suficiente para comprarse un auto y una motocicleta.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para venderla en su puesto.
Francisca desea continuar trabajando para comprarse otro auto.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Community Bank “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” (Women of the Lake Village II) of the district, province and department of Puno. She is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and 3 small dependent children. With her first loan of $100 she purchased clothes and second hand items to sell at her shop. She has been working with the community bank for 2 years and she tells us that with the money obtained and the loans she received the got enough money to purchase a car and a motorbike. With this $1,000 loan, that will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase more products to sell at her shop. Eusebia would like to keep working to be able to purchase a second car.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Eya A. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle tient depuis 2 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale dans un quartier de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afin d’accroître la capacité de son commerce, elle souhaite avec ce crédit, alimenter sa boutique pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande de la clientèle sans cesse croissante. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eya A., 51, is married and the mother of four children. For two years, she has been tending a little general store in a neighborhood of Lomé, the Togolese capital. So as to increase the capacity of her business, she would like to use this loan to expand the inventory of her shop so as to satisfy the demand of her ever-growing clientele. This will allow her to increase her income and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Cristo Viene 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Groups 1 and 2 from the Cristo Viene (Christ is Coming) Bank of Hope are receiving their fourth loan from Esperanza International. This group has shown good discipline in repayments and their businesses have improved since their first loan.

Altagracia F. is Coordinator for Group 2. She is married and has 3 children, ages 14, 6 and 2. She sells both new and used clothes, mostly around her neighborhood. She will use her loan money to purchase new clothing items to be able to provide variety and meet her customers' demands.

Altagracia has some technical education, but she dreams of seeing her children go to college and become successful professionals. She is very concerned about making her business do well in order to support her children's present and future education. She also dreams of her business growing to become a clothing store in her own locality.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchasing clothes for sales business.

loans.name: Sialofi

texts.en:
Sialofi M., 25, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the food, clothing, and crafts business. She sells to the village people and the general public five days per week. Her weekly net cash flow is 350 Tala (about $145).

This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Sialofi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy painting materials and carving tools for her handicrafts.

loans.use: To purchase painting materials and carving tools for handicrafts.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou F. âgée de  39 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 7 ans. Son activité est  la vente de pain, savon et huile. Elle veut renforcer son capital pour avoir plus de revenusLe prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou F. is 39 years old, married and has seven dependent children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for seven years. She makes her living selling bread, soap and oil. She wants to bolster her working capital in order to have higher revenues. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in one instalment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell bread, soap and oil

loans.name: Uwa

texts.en: Uwa is a widow. She is 46 years old with 6 children. She sells planks. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for resale

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy P., twenty-one, and his wife, Mrs. Sreythy Sorn, twenty-three, live along National Road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2008 and have one young daughter. Vuthy also has his parents and one brother living with him. His parents are very old.

Vuthy has been a construction worker in his village for two years; it’s a skill he learned from his brother. His wife stays at home to take care of their daughter and his parents. Vuthy doesn’t have his own motorcycle to drive to work so he is applying for his first loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio Mairena es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica a su negocio de de abarrotería ofreciendo los diferentes productos como lo son granos básicos tales como arroz, azúcar y frijoles.

El señor Mairena ha dado parte de su vida a este trabajo y está muy consciente en que su negocio hoy más que nunca necesita desarrollarse para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia. Es por esto que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos y así continuar mejorando en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Julio Mairena is a determined man who works in a grocery selling a variety of staples such as rice, sugar, and beans. He has dedicated part of his life to this work. He is very aware that today more than ever his business needs to expand so that he can improve his and his family’s lives.
