He went to Kiva partner, Ceprodel, to obtain a loan with which to buy more staples and in this way continue improving his business which needs so much support.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic food staples

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia A. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to buy sewing machines. Nadia is 39 years old and is married to a business man. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a tailoring company.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Mabongisi Ya Nkolo Plus Group

texts.fr: Elise M. est une femme très courageuse qui a passé une bonne partie de sa vie à revendre de la braise depuis 1985. Son activité est très exigeante. Elle doit aller deux ou trois fois par semaine en brousse acheter la marchandise et revenir la revendre en ville. Son activité devient de plus en plus difficile pendant la saison pluvieuse à cause de mauvais état des routes surtout en brousse. En janvier 2008, Elise décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC en vue d’avoir un soutient financier permanent qui va lui permettre de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a reçu plusieurs fois les prêts de Hope qu’elle a remboursés totalement et à temps. Le dernier crédit qu’elle obtenu ce mois de juin lui a permis de diversifier son affaire en achetant des sacs de haricots, d’oignons, de l’huile végétale et des poissons salés à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Elise dispose d’un capital propre de $130 et son activité lui procure un bénéfice de $40 par semaine qui l’aide à supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle vend dans une zone montagneuse située au sud-ouest de Kinshasa. Elise a 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 13 à 19 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Elise M. is a very courageous woman who has spent most of her life, since 1985, selling charcoal. Her business is very demanding. She has to go two or three times a week to the country to buy her merchandise and bring it back for resale to the city. Her business becomes more and more difficult during the rainy season because of the bad condition of the roads, especially in the backwoods.

In January 2008, Elise decided to join one of the groups of Hope RDC in view of finding permanent financial support which will allow her to realize her dream of one day opening a general store. She is a faithful client who has received several loans from Hope, which she has reimbursed completely and on time.

The most recent loan which she has received this month of June permitted her to diversify her business by buying sacks of dried beans, onions, vegetable oil, and salted fish to re-sell in order to increase her profit. She has a working capital of US$ 130 and her business brings in a profit of US$ 40 per week which helps her pay the school fees for her children. She sells her wares in a mountainous zone in the south-west of Kinshasa. Elise is 45, married, and the mother of 4 children, aged between 13 and 19. All are enrolled in school.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sacks of dried beans, onions, vegetable oil, and salted fish for resale

loans.name: Rosalia Rosita

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 07 hijos y no tiene estudios.  Vive en el Jr. Tarapacá s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de ovinos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pan, gaseosas y golosinas.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando. A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank which is in the Paucarcolla district of San Roman Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, married and has 7 children. She has not gone to school. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 6 years and her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to buy sheep. At the present time, she requires a loan of 200 new soles to buy bread, soft drinks and snacks. Her goal is to continue working. She enjoys her savings and the training seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María D. V. tiene 59 años es una madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo por lo que tiene 2 responsabilidades actuar como Padre y Madre a la misma vez. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de nacatamales. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando ella inicio esta actividad fue por medio de su Mama ya que apreciaba la necesidad que Rosa pasaba con sus hijos, el mayor desafío que enfrento fue aprender a proporcionarle el toque de sabor, pero con el tiempo se fue perfeccionando. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de masa, maíz, algunos utensilios de cocina y condimentos para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. En un futuro a Rosa le gustaría proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa María D. V., 59, is a single mother. She has three dependent children. She has two responsibilities, to act as both mother and father at the same time. She makes and sells “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to tamale). She has been doing this for over 30 years. Her mother got her started in this activity because she saw the needs that Rosa’s children had. The biggest difficulty she faced was leaning to master the seasoning. But, in time, she perfected her seasoning. The loan is for working capital to buy dough, corn, and some cooking utensils and condiments for making her nacatamales. In the future, Rosa would like to make some improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita V. sells soft drinks and also operates a fast food joint at Akotobinsin near Elmina. Zita has received senior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman.

Zita has been selling soft drinks and operating a fast food joint since 2005. She is responsible for the upkeep of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to sell in larger quantities at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete her building.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell at the market

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La señora Ruth Marín, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción - Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 56 años, 05 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un puesto bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Ruth, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse día a día a lo que la vida se le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth Marín is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Acción – Picota” (Women in Action – Picota), which is located in the District of Picota, Picota Province, Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, widowed, and has 5 children of whom 1 is still dependent. Her strength and desire for her children to succeed are what motivated her to start her own grocery store. She manages her business out of her home, which is well equipped for attending to her customers. The revenues generated from her business have enabled her to support her family. She has been gaining customers since she started her business and now she has a regular clientele who come to her store to shop because it has all the products a housewife would need. Ruth personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality.

With her loan of 1000 soles she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packaged noodles, milk, various brands of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products. This will help her continue providing good service to her customers.

Ruth has the strength to continue working and she prepares herself every day for what life presents. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more groceries

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega, el joven José P. es muy emprendedor puesto que estableció su propio negocio de barbería donde atiende a sus clientes a diario brindando un buen servicio y con muy buenas condiciones.

El crédito que solicitó es para inversión en la compra de materiales de trabajo como peines, gelatinas y tijeras y tambie´n para la compra de pintura para darle color a las paredes y también para reparar las sillas. Es por esta razón que el joven P. espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, José P. is a very enterprising young man, given that he established his own barber shop where he attends to his clients daily, providing a good service in very good conditions. The credit that he has requested is for investment in work materials, such as combs, gel, and scissors, and also for the purchase of paint to give color to the walls, and to repair his chairs. It is for this reason that the young P. hopes Ceprodel will provide him with the credit to continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paint for the walls and upholstery for the chairs in his barber shop.

loans.name: Kul

texts.en: Kul E. is 58 years old and resides with her husband in Takeo Province. She sells mosquito nets, pillows, mattresses, and mats, and typically makes US $33 in revenue each day. Her husband makes and sells hammocks at the local market. On average, he makes US $2 each day. Kul E. needs a loan of US $1000 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is a 60-year-old mother of four who runs a salon in Machokos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years and previously sold clothes. She also earns extra income through some small-scale farming.

She is requesting a loan of  Kes. 30,000 to buy cosmetics for her shop. She describes herself as confident and determined and hopes to expand her business and eventually become a wholesale outlet.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora EDELMIRA S. A., tiene 51 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO S.. Presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada y tiene 6 hijos  de los cuales solo 1 depende económicamente de ella.
La socia se dedica a la preparación de menú (comida), ella lleva sus productos a repartir a sus comensales que trabajan en las fábricas cercanas. Con su primer crédito compró arroz, papas, fideos, atún, menestras, aceite,  pollo, carne de res,  etc. para preparar sus menús.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará también productos alimenticios como: arroz, papas, azúcar, fideos, menestras, atún, aceite, etc., también comprará tapers  para a servir los menús. Edelmira sueña con tener un restaurante para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edelmira S. A. is 51 years old and lives in the Las Delicias district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Community Bank “Luis Alberto S.”. She has a high school education, is married and has six children, of whom only one is economically dependent on her. Her business is food preparation, and she sells her products to nearby factory workers. With her first loan, she purchased rice, potatoes, noodles, tuna, soup, oil, chicken, beef, etc with which to prepare her dishes. With this new loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will purchase more food products such as rice, potatoes, sugar, noodles, soup, tuna, and oil, as well as containers in which to serve the food. Edelmira dreams of having her own restaurant and earning more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase food ingredients and containers

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Felina is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Felina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Felina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 41 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 15 and 19 years. None of her children go to school because she couldn’t raise school fees. She owns a four-room house, where she is staying with six people. Rehema takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, gets three meals a day, but do not have piped water. 

Rehema has a stall selling fresh foods in Nakulabye. She incurs transport costs to and from buying her fresh food, such as sacks of bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, onions and tomatoes. She works seven days a week in a semi urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on the retail and wholesale markets. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding her family, school fees for her children and monthly market dues. Her major business challenge is the rainy season which hinders her from reaching her customers. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for five years. Rehema is servicing her tenth loan and working with the same groupmates. Rehema joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of banana, sacks of cassava, boxes of tomatoes and onions. She would like to see her business grower bigger and to be able to sell only on the wholesale market.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio M. is from the village of Sumalag, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. He is 54 years old. Claudio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Claudio owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products like alacarte (grilled meat) such as chicken feet, chicken intestines, chicken wings and others in the local community. Claudio has been engaged in his business for more than seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Claudio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudio is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claudio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nnenna

texts.en:
Nnenna is a hair stylist. She sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Nnenna needs a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

Nnenna lives in Benin City. She is 27 years old and single without children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Nnenna hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Bienestar En Dios 7 Group

texts.en:
Angelita is the coordinator of her group, Bienestar en Dios (Wellbeing with God), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo, where the economy is dominated by agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her family.

Angelita is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited for the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business (selling clothing and perfume) by purchasing the large assorted packs of clothing that often come from American Salvation Army stores and perfumes that she will sell in her community. She will use the profits to invest in constructing her own home as well as paying tuition at the local university where she is taking classes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 21-year-old single woman living with her family. After getting her technical certificate, she started working as a beautician and a hairdresser from her home in 2007. During those years, she has been able to accumulate a good number of clients and earn a good income. Today, because there are always new items and ideas in this market, Abir is asking to borrow $800 to purchase new and improved tools to increase her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: purchase new and improved tools

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a vegetable seller who has been running her business in the market for years. She then hurries to deliver her items by trailer-motorcycle to the market where she retails them. She is married, with four school-aged kids, while her husband is a family contributor who works in construction. Mrs. S. is seeking assistance in order to improve her vegetable trade by buying greater quantities of vegetables to sell. (Mrs. S. was not available for a picture, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy greater quantities of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara A. se dedica a laborar arduamente para alcanzar su meta de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado dañada y hoy en día tiene el compromiso de brindarle un techo digno a su familia y por ello ha tomado la decisión de mejorar dicha vivienda y está disupesta a iniciar la obra de reconstrucción a lo inmediato.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como cemento, bloque, hierro y arena y una vez que los tenga, llevar a cabo la obra constructora en su vivienda para beneficio propio y de la familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara A. works arduously to reach her goal of improving the condition of her house. It has been damaged for a long time. She has now made the commitment to give her family decent living quarters. Therefore, she has made the decision to improve her house. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying construction materials like cement, blocks, iron, and sand. Once she has them, she will carry through with the construction work for her own benefit and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a wife of M. J. and they both live in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. They have a three-roomed house in which they have been living for the past 25 years. Khursheed's husband operates a blanket-selling business. He purchases his blankets in two cities (Lahore and Faisalabad) because of the cheap prices and great quality. He sells the blankets to different shops and markets and earns a good profit. His profit allows him to pay for utilities and meet his family's financial expenses. His earnings are the only source of family income.
Khursheed is requesting a loan to buy blankets in bulk to expand her husband’s business so that he is able to earn a good profit and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy blankets in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: George

texts.en: George M., 26 years old, is never tired of tilling his farm. He has two children. He said that his purpose and desire is to help his family have an adequate supply of food everyday. He will continue to do his best to sustain his livelihood so that he could still support his children, even though they are already married.  He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay S., 57, is widowed and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She is a waitress at a food shop and raises pigs at home for an income of about $3 per day. Her daughter is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosario P. se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 3 ciclos, vive en el sector El Cruce que es perteneciente a la Parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte, la parroquia Chiquintad, al este y al sur, la ciudad de Cuenca, y al oeste, la parroquia Sayausí. Dentro de Sinincay, sus artesanos se especializan en la producción marmolera, la fabricación de tejas, 
ladrillos, y algunas mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. La iglesia parroquial es tradicional por su belleza arquitectónica, la imagen de la virgen de la Visitación que reposa en ella, es el atractivo más importante que ofrece la parroquia, muy visitado por los turistas.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, sus cuatro primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, y sus cuatro hijos menores estudian en el colegio y escuela respectivamente, también nos comenta que se encuentra a cargo de sus tres sobrinos ya que su hermana ha viajado al extranjero para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, con el esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Rosario se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, y también a la cría de animales como son vacas, borregos, cuyes lo que en su mayor parte es para su consumo y en sus necesidades los vende, nuestra socia va a invertir el crédito en la comprar de una maquina para soldar ya que su hijo la necesita para el taller de latonería que es dueño, su sueño es tener salud y así apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo que este a su alcance.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario P. has been with the community bank for three loan cycles. She lives in the El Cruce area of the Sinincay parish located north-east of the canton of Cuenca. The parish of Chiguintad lies to the north, to the east and south is the city of Cuenca, and to the west is the parish of Sayausí. The artisans of Sinincay specialize in the production of marble and the manufacture of tiles and bricks. Some of the women make hats from toquilla fiber. The parish church is renowned for its architectural beauty and its picture of the Visitation of the Virgin. The church is the parish’s most important attraction and is frequently visited by tourists. Bank member Rosario is 53 years old, married, and has eight children. The four oldest have jobs and help their mother financially; the four youngest attend high school or primary school. Rosario tells us that she is also responsible for her three nephews and nieces as her sister has gone overseas to bring them a better standard of living. With her and her husband’s hard work, they managed to build their own home. As well as all her household chores, Sra. Rosario raises animals such as cows, sheep, and guinea pigs mostly for her family’s consumption but sometimes she sells them out of necessity. She is going to use the loan to buy a soldering machine as her son needs one for the body shop that he owns. Her greatest wish is to remain healthy so she can help her children achieve whatever is within their reach.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a soldering machine

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (shown in the picture), age 39 and her husband, Mr. Heang Uk, age 36, have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is in school; another one stays at home, and her son is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap has been selling soup in Phnom Penh for over a year. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for five years. Her son who is a garment factory worker does not have transportation; it’s difficult for him because he often spends a lot of money for traveling costs. So, Sopheap is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Mrs. Then T. (pictured above) was married in 1998 and she has two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. In the past, she used to be a garment factory worker. Now she is a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. 

She asked for a Kiva loan once already. And now she is asking for her second loan of 800USD to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to purchase a horse and horse-cart for her brother to launch a horse-cart driving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Bautista M. tiene 53 años D. edad, es separada, tiene 3 hijos , una hija D. 33 años que vive con la misma , otra D. 30 años que vive en España donD. ya formo su familia y un varón D. 30 años que vive con también con la solicitante.
La misma se dedica a la compra  y venta D. chatarras, hierros, cobre y bronce D. talleres, desarmaderos y D. particulares en distintas ciudades del interior del país  para la venta a las empresas recicladoras.
Para ello cuenta con un Camión Mitsubishi Canter  Año 1990 que es manejado por su hijo menor.
El crédito fue destinado a la compra en cantidades grandes  D. chatarras, hierros, cobre y bronce D. talleres, desarmaderos y D. personas particulares para volver a venderlo a las recicladoras y a fabricas D. acumuladores.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Bautista M. is 53 years old. She is separated and has 3 children. One daughter, who is 33 years old, lives with Sra. Juana. Another, who is 30 years old, lives in Spain, where she has her own family. And her son, who is also 30 years old, lives with her as well. Sra. Juana makes her living buying scrap metal, iron, copper and bronze from workshops, chop shops and individuals in different cities of the interior of the country. She then sells them to recycling companies. To accomplish this work, she has a 1990 Mitsubishi Canter, which her younger son drives. The loan was used to purchase large quantities of scrap iron, iron, copper and bronze from workshops, chop shops and individuals to then sell to recycling and storage facilities.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase scrap metal, iron, copper and bronze.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia vive en  casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el Alto, zona Senkata. Ella trabaja como costurera y  es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella no tiene hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de 2 maquinas de costura el cual le permitirá crear su propio taller de costura.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Zonia lives with her parents and their home is located in the city of El Alto, in the Senkata district. She works as a seamstress and this is her primary source of income. She does not have any children. This loan will be used to purchase 2 sewing machines and this will permit her to set up her own tailoring shop. This is her first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchse two sewing machines to set up a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Deyby C. C. tiene 54 años(la señora que viste pantalon rojo y chompa guinda)ejerce el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía “Siempre Adelante” una mujer emprendedora madre D. 2 hijos por los cuales lucha día a día por salir a delante y darles una mejor calidad  D. vida  y una educación basada  en principios y valores La alcancía  esta formada por 9 entusiastas y comprometidas socias y un socio ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD hace 18 meses, 
En la actualidad Deyby  tiene dos negocios un locutorio el cual lleva el nombre D.  “Divino  Niño Jesús” que lleva un año trabajando en este negocio y también se dedica a la venta D. comida en la casa D. sus  padres donD. vive y desD. ahí  distribuye   almuerzos a clientes fijos  que tiene en fabricas y las personas que quieran degustar su  exquisita sazón en la casa donD. las prepara.
    Deyby sueña con tener su casa propia  y ve  con mucho optimismo ya que dentro D. muy corto tiempo comprara un terreno gracias a los ahorros  y ganancias que a obtenido D. estos dos negocios porque quiere tener sus dos negocios dentro D. su propia casa.
     El préstamo actual lo usará para capital D. trabajo, por la gran demanda que tiene  negocio D. llamadas comprando 3 nuevas  cabinas D. locutorio
texts.en:
Deyby C. C. is 54 years old (wearing red pants and a cherry colored sweater in the photograph) is the president of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Ahead) communal bank. She is a very entrepreneurial mother of two children. She struggles daily to move them ahead, give them a better quality of life, and proviD. them with a basic education in values and principles. The communal bank is maD. up of nine enthusiastic and committed women and one gentleman. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for the past 18 months. Deyby currently has two businesses, one is a call center called “Divino Niño Jesús,” which she has had for one year; she also sells prepared food out of her parent’s home (where she lives). From there she distributes lunches to her steady customers in factories and to people who want to experience the flavor in the home where she prepares them. Deyby dreams of having her own home and is very optimistic that she will be able to buy a piece of land soon, thanks to her savings and the income that she has gotten from her two businesses. She wants to run both businesses out of her own home. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy three more call booths, because of high customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Call booths

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Grace. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are between the ages of five and ten years old. He was only able to attend school through eleventh grade, due to financial constraints.
 
For seven years, he has been selling copy books on Pipeline Road Market in Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 27,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more dozens of copy books. He describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more dozens of copy books.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Teresa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of thread and cloth

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for her family.  A 26-year-old mother of two, Mariane and Raymart, she lives in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. Medina’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family. She was encouraged to join ASHI, a first KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. 

Medina needs working capital to help boost her business to earn increased profits. She is requesting her new loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her variety store, to be used to pay for groceries for her enterprise. 

Medina is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her family and being able to bring them to into a decent way of life. Her long term-goal is for her 2 children to finish studies until completing college.  She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will
give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

loans.use: will use as additional working capital for her variety store and to be used to pay for groceries for her store.

loans.name: Olga Elisa

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Luz Andina” ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla, provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 02 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación superior completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años,  nos cuenta que su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes, papa y combustibles.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería de su tienda, papa y combustible.

Su sueño es tener una librería o ferretería en la plaza.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la colaboración que ve en el grupo.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the community bank "Luz Andina" (Light of the Andes), which is located in the Cabanilla district in the province of Lampa and the department of Puno. She is 29 years old, is married, has two children, and has completed higher studies.

She began to work with Movimiento Manuela Ramos three years ago. She tells us that her first loan was for 500 PEN, and the money allowed her to increase the working capital for her business, which is selling groceries, potatoes, and fuel.

Now she is applying for a new loan of 500 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her store, potatoes, and fuel. 

Her dream is to have a bookstore or hardware store on the plaza.

What she likes most about her community bank are the punctuality and collaboration that she sees in the group.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business, a grocery store

loans.name: Pedro Walter

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Mano de León, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, este distrito es netamente agrícola y se encuentra situado a mas de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. Actualmente cuenta con terreno de cultivo de 1.5 hectáreas en el cual siembra maíz, en esta ocasión el cultivo ya ha sido instalado y el se encuentra cuidándolo para garantizarse una buena cosecha.

Pedro desea adquirir fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo.

Pedro es una persona entregada a su familia y que se vale de sus conocimientos en agricultura, fruto de todos los años que lleva trabajando,  para garantizarles el sustento que necesitan.
texts.en:
Pedro is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the village of  Mano de León, a rural area in the Olmos district, located in the province of Lambayeque.  This district is agricultural and is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Pedro has worked in agriculture since he was young.  He now has 1.5 hectares of arable land where he grows corn.  The crop has been planted and he is caring for it to guarantee a good harvest.

Pedro would like to buy fertilizer to maintain his crop, so he has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.  

Pedro is devoted to his family, and he uses his agricultural knowledge gained from all of the years he worked to guarantee them the support they need.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for a corn crop

loans.name: Gregorio  De Jesus

texts.es: Gregorio P., de 38 años es un buen hombre que vive, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 15 años en el Municipio de Soledad, a 10 minutos de Barranquilla; allí tiene su tienda llamada “El Niño Rey”,  la cual inició en el año 2005 y   gradualmente con su trabajo ha ido creciendo; él primero adquirió un punto frio  y   casi tres años después, con sus esfuerzos de ahorros la convirtió en tienda  y la  compró  porque  se encontraba en condiciones de arrendatario. Gregorio  es un hombre satisfecho por su trabajo en la tienda, porque hoy a consecuencia  de sus grandes sacrificios,  ha logrado  sostenerla  muy prospera. Su promedio de ventas está entre  $600.000 y $700.000 diarios, maneja un buen volumen de inventarios y su margen de contribución aproximado es de 15%, él planea integrar a su negocio un punto de ventas de bebidas frías, para comprarlas al por mayor y venderle a clientes potenciales, como pequeñas tiendas, estaderos,  establecimientos  y vendedores de refrescos,  que no tienen capacidad de comprar en grandes cantidades a la misma empresa y por consiguiente cuando se les termina su provisión,  deben esperar para hacer un pedido  y pierden clientela,  porque se demora la respuesta de sus distribuidores; con este proyecto Gregorio espera que puedan comprarle  en su tienda Niño Rey y responderle mas oportunamente a sus clientes y el resultado será que  Gregorio se gane el dinero por la intermediación y la oportunidad.   Con su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento  comprará arroz, aceite, granos,  refrescos  y bebidas en mayor volumen, antes de que aumenten sus precios al final del año y de esta manera también ganará un poco más y  ahorrará.
texts.en:
Gregorio P. is 38 years old and is a good-hearted man. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 15, in the town of  Soledad, 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. There he runs a store called “El Niño Rey” [The Child King], which he started in 2005 and has expanded through hard work. He started with a vacant property and in three years, using his own work and savings, he made it into a store. He started out renting the property but eventually bought it.

Gregorio finds his work very satisfying, because after making sacrifices to start his store he has managed to keep it very prosperous. His daily sales come to between $600 and $700. He can put about 15% of that amount towards offsetting his fixed costs, and he keeps a good level of inventory. He would like to expand his business to include the sale of cold drinks, buying them wholesale and then selling them to potential clients such as small stores, restaurant owners, and soft drink stands. These clients typically cannot buy in large quantities and so when they run out of provisions they have to wait to put in an order, and the delays in distribution cause them to lose business. Gregorio hopes to be able to sell drinks to these clients directly from his store, thus providing them with faster service. This will be another opportunity for him to increase his earnings.

With this loan, which is his first through Kiva, he will buy rice, cooking oil, and grains, as well as soft drinks and other drinks in larger quantities. He wants to make this purchase before prices go up at the end of the year. He hopes this will allow him to earn a little more and put it into savings.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, cooking oil, and grains, as well as soft drinks and other drinks in large quantities.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia y se dedica a la venta y reparación de bicicletas además atiende un negocio de helados, el taller tiene 20 años de existir por lo mismo José tiene ya experiencia en el manejo de  este negocio.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar nuevos estilos de bicicletas así como repuestos para estas, lo que pretende es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes estilos nuevos y repuestos para las bicicletas.
Su objetivo es sostenerse en el mercado, poder establecer un taller competitivo que le genere ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
José, 36, lives in El Transito department of San Miguel.  He lives with his family and sells and repairs bicycles.  He also has an ice cream business.  He has had the shop for 20 years and so José has a lot of experience handling the business.
He is requesting a loan to buy new styles of bicycles and parts for them.  What he would like is to enhance his business and offer his customers new models and parts for the bicycles.

His goal is to remain solid in the market, and establish a competive shop that will generate income for the support of his family.

loans.use: To buy bicycles and parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Armando Ruben

texts.es:
El señor  Armando A. L. , se encuentra casado tiene 3 hijos, y contoda su familia vive por la zona de Aeropuerto de Cochabamba, se dedica a la costura de forros para armar colchones, ellos costuran todolo que sea con tela y los rellenos con resorte lo realizan en una empresa particular, pero el Sr Armando y su familia en su casa solo hacen las uniones el, relleno con esponja, esta actividad es muy trabajosa pues el manipuleo porque las piezas son muy grandes, y ocupan mucho espacio en su casa.

Pero les es rentable este trabajo por esta razon se dedican con mucho en entusiasmo a la confeccion, pero para ser mas eficientes en su trabajo necesitan comprar una maquina de costura mas, pues solo cuentan con una que hace costuras rectas y otra que hace los bordes.

El Sr. Armando se apersono a solictar un credito que lo usara para invertir en una maquina de costura la que les sera de mucha ayuda para mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Armando A. L. is married and has three children.  He and his family live in the Cochabamba Airport zone.  [Armando] makes mattress covers that are stuffed to make full mattresses.  He does all of the sewing and the springs and stuffing is installed in a private factory, but he and his family make the foam stuffing in their home.  This is hard work, the pieces are large, and take up a lot of room in his home.

But it is profitable, so they dedicate themselves to this with great enthusiasm.  They need to buy another sewing machine in order to be more efficient because at the moment they have one that does the straight stitching and another that does the embroidery.

Armando has seen fit to request a loan so that he can invest in the sewing machine, which will help them improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 28-year-old hardworking man who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.

He has run a retail shop for one year, which has enabled him to have a minimum standard of living.

His hardship is seasonal price fluctuations and his vision is to become a wholesale trader.

Julius needs the loan to purchase sugar, rice and salt to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and salt for resale

loans.name: Mourn

texts.en:
Mourn S., 45, is married and resides with his three children in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. produces wooden furniture, earning an income of approximately $6 per day. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of about $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $90 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a machine to improve his current business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a machine to improve the business

loans.name: Ivogne Mónica

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ivogne, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 18 años de edad  la misma que este año espera ingresar a la universidad. El marido se dedica al comercio.

Se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta de mariscos, ellos muy de mañana se desplazan todos los días hasta las playas en Manta para comprar el mejor pescado y camarón para luego llevarlos al mercado de Rocafuerte para venderlos al por mayor a otros comerciantes y también o para vender al menudeo a los clientes que dia a dia asisten a este lugar para abastecerse para su alimentación diaria. Nos cuenta que llevan en esta actividad cerca a de 13 años y que les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y camarón, para surtir a sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y por la ayuda que reciben  a través de estos créditos. Sus sueños son tener un carro para realizar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the members of the Mujeres Organizadas [Organized Women] community bank meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals and are famous throughout the country.  

Here we find Ivogne. She is 46 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has an 18 year old daughter, who is waiting to go to college. Her husband is a merchant.   

She and her husband sell seafood. Every morning they go to the beaches of Manta to buy the best fish and shrimp to then take them to the Rocafuerte market to sell them wholesale to other merchants and also to sell them retail to the customers who go their to get their daily food. She tells us that they have been doing this activity for close to 13 years and it has gone very well for her.

This loan is to buy fish and shrimp to supply her customers. She has been in the community bank for 4 years and she likes it because the loans are quick and because of the help they receive through these loans. Her dreams are to have a car and do her job better.

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Vallecito que se ubica a 12 km del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. ganado ovino y aves D. corral, ella cría sus animales en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y también en el mercado local en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y es D. mucha ayuda para solventar junto a su esposo los gastos familiares.

Mariana desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado y sus aves con la finalidad D. que obtengan buen peso y D. esta manera venderlos a un mejor precio incrementando sus ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 600 nuevos soles.

Mariana es una madre bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 50 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the hamlet of Vallecito located 12 km from the TambogranD. agricultural district in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works raising and selling sheep and poultry. She raises her animals in the area behind her house and when they have reached a good size and weight she sells them to the businessmen who often visit the area and also in the market near where she lives. She has done this for 5 years and is of great help to her husband in paying the household expenses.

Mariana wants to get commercial feed for her sheep and poultry with the aim of fattening them up so she can sell them for a better price and improve her earnings. For this reason she thought it best to request a loan of 600 soles ($225) from Edpyme Alternativa.

Mariana is a devoted mother to her family who always watches out for their well-being and development. People who know her respect her and are very fond of her.

loans.use: to purchase commercial animal feed

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la ciudad de Combapata de la provincia de Canchis departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde hay hermosos paisajes, donde hay sitios históricas y  donde hay centros arqueológicos de los antiguos pobladores del imperio Inca. 

Martha es una persona trabajadora que tiene su tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende sus productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros alimentos de primera necesidad. Martha en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo leche, atún, gaseosa, cerveza y otras cosa que faltan en el negocio. 

Martha es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del  Cusco se encuentra la ciudadela de los Incas de Machupicchu (Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Martha was born in the city of Combapata, in the province of Canchis, department of Cusco. She is 38 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, where there are beautiful landscapes, historic sites and archaeological centers of the ancient inhabitants of the Inca empire. 

Martha is a hard-working person who has a grocery store in her home. She sells products such as rice, sugar, noodles and other basic foods. At this time, Martha needs a loan to buy merchandise such as milk, tuna, soft drinks, beer, and other items which are lacking in her store.

Martha is a responsible person who belongs to the “Puntualito” ["On-Time"] communal bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, the settlement of the Incas of Machu Picchu is found (Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as milk, tuna, soft drinks, beer and other items that are lacking in her store

loans.name: Letecia's Group

texts.en:
Letecia J. lives in the village of Balasdiot, Baliangao and leads a two-person loan group that is affiliated with PMPC. Each member gets an individual loan, but is responsible for paying back the other person's loan if that person is delinquent or defaults.  

Letecia is 56 years old, married, blessed with three school-aged children and has for the last six years made a living by selling "tuba," a local wine, to people in her community. She earns a monthly net income of PHP 2,500 and joined PMPC in 2003 to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans of PHP 5,000 and is applying for her sixth to repair her house. 
 
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a house

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís es un cliente de 47 años de edad y es soltero. Luis tiene dos hijos menores de edad pero no viven con el. Luis vive en Chacupe bajo, donde lamentablemente no cuentan con los servicios básicos (energía eléctrica, ni agua)  y esta ubicado en el distrito de La Victoria  en la provincia de Chiclayo, al norte del Perú.

Luis se dedica a trabajar como peón en la agricultura y también  realiza  sombríos de tubérculos y verduras. El  tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia en este oficio, pues desde muy joven se dedicó a esta labor y ahora, solventa sus gastos diarios con el fruto de esta actividad.

Luis esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de S/. 3000 para que el pueda comprar 01 una moto bomba (especie de maquinaria que realiza riegos de agua en grandes cantidades) para regar sus cultivos y de esta manera el pueda cumplir con mayor eficiencia sus metas de producción. Luís podrá producir en grandes cantidades y abastecer a un mercado mas grande.

Luis es una persona constante que quiere progresar y tener una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que el necesita esta herramienta de trabajo para facilitar su actividad. Luis es una persona entusiasta que espera cumplir sus metas con responsabilidad y trabajo.
texts.en:
Luís is a 47 year old client and he is single. He has two minor children but they don't live with him. Luis lives in Chacupe Bajo, where unfortunately they don't have basic services (electricity or water). It is located in the district of La Victoria in the province of Chiclayo, in northern Peru.

Luis works as a farm laborer and he also grows tubers and vegetables. He has more than 10 years experience in this trade, since since he was very young he has done this work and now he pays his daily expenses with the what he makes from this work.   

Luis is asking  Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of  S/. 3000 so that he can buy one mechanical pump (a type of machinery that irrigates water in large quantities) in order to irrigate his crops and in this way achieve his production goals more efficiently. Luís will be able to produce large quantities and supply a larger market.  

Luis is a reliable person who wants to progress and have a better quality of life. That is why h he needs this work tool to facilitate his activity. Luis is an enthusiastic person who hopes to meet his goals of responsibility and work.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical pump (a tool that will serve to extract water to irrigate his crops)

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame cooks and sells rice and tomato sauce at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a prison officer. Maame has been selling cooked rice for 8 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy rice, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, oil and other ingredients. She hopes to grow her business further and so plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy rice, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, oil and other ingredients to cook food to sell.

loans.name: Zabayo Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Kiroha est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Zabayo », âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants parmi les quels 3 ont leurs propres foyers et d’autres étudient. Son mari est un enseignant. La cliente est vendeuse d'haricots dans le marché sectoriel de Majengo. Il ya plus de 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 4 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec 20$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  1 sac d’haricots à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne  scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Zabayo» est majoritairement féminin. La photo fut prise sous le soleil de plomb. Sur ce, certaines femmes sont sous leur para soleil et d’autres restent invisibles. En outre, une maman est venue avec son  enfant (fillette), positionnée sur la deuxième ligne.
texts.en:
The client Kiroha is an entrepreneur, the leader of the business group Zabayo. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. Three of them have their own homes, and the others are in school. Her husband is a teacher. Kiroha sells beans at the Majengo sector market. She has been in this business for more than fifteen years.

She has just finished four loan cycles with Hekima. She started her business with $20 from her husband. This new loan should serve to buy her one bag of beans to sell. Her ambitions are to educate her children and to build a house. She thanks Hekima for its actions supporting the poor, excluded from traditional banking.

It should be mentioned that the business group Zabayo is primarily composed of women. The photo was taken in very bright sunlight. In it, certain women are under their parasols and others are invisible. Also, one mother came with her little girl, shown in the second row.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando vive en el departamento de Cochabamba en la provincia de Cercado, el lleva ya tres años separado de su esposa, tuvieron problemas y se separaron y al separarse el decidio dejarle todo a su esposa y no pedirle nada porque ella se quedo con uno de sus hijos , el regreso a vivir con su mamá que tiene 89 años, ahora el quiere empezar de nuevo.
El solicita un crédito para poder comprar computadoras y asi activar un negocio nuevo con la cual pueda mantener a su mamá y demostrar que puede volver a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rolando lives in the department of Cochabamba in Cercado province.  He has been separated from his wife for 3 years.  They had problems and so separated.  Upon their separation he decided to leave everything to his wife and not ask for anything for himself because she was left with one of their children.  He went back to live with his mother, who is 89 years old, and now he is starting all over again.

He requests a loan so that he can buy computers and in this way start up a new business.  With this business he will be able to support his mother and show that he can once again move forward with his life.

loans.use: to buy computers to start up a business

loans.name: Ramuka Group

texts.fr:
Frédérique est une commerçante âgée de 44ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba dans la Province de Gitega du centre du pays. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (tomates, poireaux) depuis 5ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle est mariée à Timothée, un commerçant de planches. Ils ont ensemble  7 enfants  qui étudient et dont 4 a l’école secondaire. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
Son crédit de 320,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats de tomates et poireaux pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« RAMUKA».
texts.en:
Fréderique is a 44-year old vendor living in the village of Kibimba, in the Province of Gitega, in the centre of the country. She has been selling foodstuffs (tomatoes, leeks) for five years. She is also a farmer. She is married to Thimothée, a wood vendor. They have seven children, all of whom study, and four of whom are in secondary school. She herself has finished six years of elementary school.

Her loan of 320,000 Burundi francs will  bolster her capital and expand   her stock of tomatoes and leeks, heping her to increase her income.

She is a member of the “Ramuka” solidarity group.

loans.use: bolster her capital and  expand her stock of tomatoes and leeks, heping her to increase her income.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 35 años de edad y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Filomena vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Filomena tiene varias actividades como por ejemplo ganadería, agricultura y a la venta de leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ganado como por ejemplo crías de toros.

Filomena es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
A native of Tambo Real (a community located in the Anta province, Cusco department), Filomena is 35 years old, she is married and has three children. Filomena currently lives in the same community where she was born, and here she engages in her economy activities. Filomena engages in different economic activities, such as livestock farming, agriculture and milk sale. She has been engaging in these activities for various years now, and things are going very well thanks to the determination she works with. The loan she is requesting in this occasion will be used to buy livestock such as calves.
Filomena is a responsible and hardworking woman, and thanks to these qualities she has been invited to join “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” (Tambo Real Solidarity), a communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, by its fellow members.

loans.use: To buy livestock such as calves.

loans.name: Sukun

texts.en:
Sukun, 41 years old, is working in garment factory. Her income is $3 per day. She is a single mother with six children. Two are studying and the other four are working in the factory with $3 per day for each. 

Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $30 on rent and $30 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $550 for medical treatment for her old mother. 

In the future, she wants to buy grocery goods to sell at home instead of working in the factory so that she can take care her mother and her children also.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her old mother.

loans.name: Akouvi Ayodélé

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme  âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur avec 01 enfant en charge. 
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 2007. Elle vend à tous clients au marché de N’KAFU. Elle achète les produits à COTONOU. 
Akouvi a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux.
texts.en: Akouvi is a 25 year old woman and mother of one child who lives in Togo with her husband, a welder. She has been selling jewelry since 2007, mostly selling at the N'Kafu market. She purchases the jewelry in Cotonou. She is asking for a second loan from WAGES in order to purchase greater quantities of jewelry for her business.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a resident and farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 7 years producing and selling maize, beans, and other cereals in the local market. She is married with two children aged 6 and 2.

Florence has requested for a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will enable her to expand her farming business and venture into dairy farming with the additional income generated. She also sells second-hand clothes in the local market which provides income for her family expenses.

Florence reiterates that price fluctuation for farm produce remains a major challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wiiliam Leonardo

texts.es:
William de 29 años, tiene 3 hijos (estudiantes de la escuela fiscal) junto a su esposa Edilma que es comerciante de productos de belleza, él como padre de familia trabaja muy duro para que no les falte nada, su localidad es en una zona periurbana del Suburbio de Guayaquil-Ecuador.

El se dedica a la elaboración de lociones y perfumes; pero para  la elaboracion de los productos, necesita materia prima motivo por el cual desea un préstamo que le va servir para la producción de los mismo, otra parte del prestamo la desea invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda y hacer un dormitorio para cada uno de sus hijos, y estén cómodos. Por lo que requiere comprar con el prestamo productos quimicos, cemento, bloques. 

Su sueño es agrandar el local y tener  sucursales.
texts.en:
William, 29 years old, has 3 children (public school students) with his wife Edilma who is a beauty product retailer. As the man of the house, he works very hard so that his family want for nothing. His town is in a peri-urban zone in the Guayaquil Suburb in Ecuador.

He makes lotions and perfumes for a living but he needs raw materials for the manufacture of these products, which is why he would like a loan that will help him to produce them. He wants to invest another part of the loan in improving his home and in building a bedroom for each of his children so that they will be comfortable. Therefore, he needs to buy chemical products, cement and cinder blocks with the loan.

It is his dream to extend his premises and open more branches.

loans.use: To buy chemical products, cement and cinder blocks

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 44 years old and  a single mother of three children between the ages of 19 and 24. She lives in her own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. She has been in the restaurant business for 13 years. In her business, she faces the challenges of price fluctuations and poor preservation methods. Her dream is to start offering outside catering services and to set up another restaurant. Constance intends to use the loan to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a street food business, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to own a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and tomatoes and establish a place to sell her products. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and tomatoes and establish a place to sell her products.

loans.name: Avdoldo

texts.en: Avdoldo is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt. They live in Hovd province of Mongolia. Avdoldo operates a business selling clothes. His wife helps with the business, and his two children are in kindergarden. He started his business in 2010. He buys garments from China and sells them. His business is going so well, but he needs some help to increase his inventory. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I am surprised by the progress of my business, and I want to broaden my range of products." He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeni; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas entre otros productos, por medio de este negocio al socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos  como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yeni, 22, is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She is single and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with a grocery store.  She sells staples like rice, sugar, milk and cookies, among other products.  Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the grocery selling business and is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale to stock the grocery store.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sop Amy Diouf Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe qui porte le nom Sope Amy a été crée depuis l ouverture du Banc Villageois et il est composé de 10 membres habitant le même village.

Madame Sagar est la présidente du groupe elle est mariée et agée de 34 ans mère de 10 enfants. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite de la photo (elle  a la main levée)
 
Elle pratique le commerce avec la vente de produits divers. Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité qu elle pratique depuis longtemps.  

Grace a ses bénéfices Sagar va acheter des denrées alimentaire pour ses enfants. Elle va aussi soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
This group is called Sop Amy and was formed after the opening of the village bank.  It has ten members who live in the same village.

Sagar is the group's president.  She is 34 years old, married, and has ten children.  She is standing on the far right of the photo and has her hand raised.

Sagar sells a range of products.  She has good experience in her business which she has been working in for a long time.

With her profits, Sagar will buy food for her children.  She will also support her husband in covering their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah previously obtained a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, which she used to buy a gearbox for the car she uses for her taxi business. Patriciah has been able to open a grocery business in addition to her taxi business and her retail shop. She now wants to stock fruits and vegetables in her grocery. Therefore, she has requested 78,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bananas, oranges, cabbages, and kale.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, cabbages and kale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth owns a business buying and selling bananas.  It has been in operation for two years. She is a business woman in Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is at the age of 28 years old, married to Angelito and they have 3 angels as their children.  She gets her source of living from her business of buying and selling.

She was able to maintain her business through her efforts, even in hard times, and this time she is earning an average net income of not less than 10,000 PHP a month, which she said is so helpful for herself and for her family.

She joined Paglaum MPC in the year 2011 because she is very much interested in our products and services as one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, having been awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

For her first loan cycle she was given the privilege to avail herself of the amount of 50,000 PHP to add to her capital for her existing business of buying and selling bananas. The future income from this business will be used for her daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall and also see her business progress.

loans.use: to add additional capital to her business

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Esperanza Esther

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 7 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Esperanza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao hace 1 año y además tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para ampliar más la tienda, comprar abonos agrícolas para que este regio el cacao.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema El sueño  es seguir sembrando.
En los tiempos libres le gusta atender en la tienda.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 32, in a common-law marriage, and has one 7-year-old child. They live together in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.
She is a member of the San Juan communal bank, located in San Francisco, belonging to the San Juan parish. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture.
Esperanza has worked in agriculture, sowing cocoa, for one year. She also has a grocery store. She makes her purchases and sales in San Juan. She is requesting this loan so that she can expand her store more; she will buy manure to improve her cocoa.
This loan will be very helpful for her so that she can buy these tools without financial difficulty.
She has not had any challenges thus far. Her dream is to continue sowing.
In her free time she enjoys tending to her store.

loans.use: to expand her store more, and to buy manure to improve her cocoa.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
