Rose is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a café, frequented by her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major business challenge of high transportation costs. Rose dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Claudia Yanneth

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es una cliente que viene a la institución gracias a que su esposo el sr. Carlos  ya trabajo en nuestra institución hace dos años en el grupo solidario "wara". La pareja de esposos se dedica a la elaboración de pan y empanadas que lo comercializan por la zona de san pedro, su  domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de tembladerani La Sra. Claudia junto a su esposo trabaja 6 días a la semana en la elaboración de panes como ser sarnitas, marraquetas con manteca y empanadas de queso, su producto lo distribuye en la movilidad que es propiedad de su esposo y además cuenta con un ambiente en donde también vende su producto al por menor, podemos observar que son personas muy trabajadoras con el deseo de superación ya que tienen como proyecto abrir un negocio diferente. La señora Claudia solicita el crédito que esta destinado para la compra de insumos y materiales  para la elaboración de panetones y quiere aprovechar en renovar las latas que utiliza para el horneado de los panes.
texts.en: Ms. Claudia is a client who came to Emprender thanks to her husband, Carlos, who has already worked with the institution for two years as part of the "Wara" solidarity group. This couple works making bread and empanadas [turnovers], which they sell in the San Pedro zone. Their home is located in the Tembladerani zone. Together with her husband, Claudia works six days a week making breads like sarnitas, buttered rolls, and cheese empanadas. They distribute their products in the vehicle her husband owns and also have a space where they sell their product in small quantities. We can see that they are very very hard-working people with a desire to improve. They have a project in mind to open another business. Claudia is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients and materials for making Christmas breads. She would also like to take advantage of the loan to repair some of the baking tins she uses for making breads.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking Christmas breads and to repair baking tins

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pequeña venta desde hace 4 años y vende nacatamales (comida típica a base de cerdo, la cual en esta época es muy común su comercio en mayores cantidades).  Ella tuvo 23 hijos de los cuales 15 están vivos y ya todos son mayores de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en productos granos básicos, maíz, cerdo, leña…etc.
texts.en: Gloria is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had a small business for the last four years selling nacatamales (typical fast food based on pork which during this season sells in larger amounts).  She has 23 children and 15 of them are adults and still living.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains, corn, pork, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, corn, pork, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Genesis 4, 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group "Genesis 4, 5, 6 & 7". Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seybo, an agricultural area. Before Esperanza went to her community, she was thinking about how to start a business, but she didn't have money for it. Some neighbors invited her to join a group, and now 20 members are having loans and doing business like selling shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and many other small businesses.

Isabel plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing gum, lollipops, snacks (chips), and others. She has had her business for almost two years, starting after the first loan she received from Esperanza. She is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She will save her profits to reinvest in her business. 

She makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children and to give them all they need; they are attending school. In the meantime, she enjoys singing and dancing. She is Haitian and she immigrated to Dominican Republic for a better future.

loans.use: to buy gum, lollipops, snacks (chips), and others.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina sells books and stationery in Elmina, Ghana. Ernestina has received schooling through to secondary school level.  She is married and has five children. Her husband also sells books alongside her. Ernestina has been selling books for several years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband with their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of books to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her book trade and to meet rising customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of books to sell in the market.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr: Akuwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Agée de 37ans, Akuwa vend des bijoux et des pagnes pour gagner son revenu quotidien. Pour s’approvisionner, Akuwa se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Akuwa demande ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de bijoux et des pièces de pagnes en vue de mieux revendre puis se faire une marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à supporter les charges quotidiennes de la famille et de bien prendre soin de leurs enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 09 pièces de pagnes et 15 unités de bijoux.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.en:
During the last five years, Apolonio has dedicated hismelf to the sale of groceries, in order to support his family's education. He is married is has tree sons. His wife is his right-handed man in the store; she helps him with administration duties. It has not been easy to maintain this business during so much time, but because the family works very hard, Apolonio managed to expand his grocery business. Ultimately, Apolonio and his family had difficult times and were presented with unexpected expenses, which impeded the supply for his business. This is why he is asking for a loan of $925 for the purchase of merchandise (groceries).

Apolonio is a hard working and responsible man, who knows that his family depends on this business and needs your help in order to support them and get through this crisis. He has confidence that his business will enable him to push ahead because he works very hard. You can contribute to improving the lives of his family members, they do not need much, and sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace quince años, el señor Apolonio se dedica a las ventas de abarrotes, esto lo hizo para poder darle sustento y educación a su familia, él es casado y tiene tres hijos. Su esposa es su brazo derecho en su negocio, ella le ayuda en atender y administrar el abarrote. No ha sido fácil mantenerse en el negocio durante tanto tiempo, pero con la unión de la familia y un trabajo arduo, Apolonio lo ha logrado y ha visto crecer su abarrote. Últimamente Apolonio y su familia pasan por momentos difíciles y se le han presentado gastos imprevistos, esto le impidió surtir su negocio, por lo que solicita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares para la compra de mercancía.

Apolonio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, sabe que de este negocio depende su familia y necesita de tu ayuda para poder sostenerlo y salir de esta crisis, él confía en que su negocio podrá salir adelante porque esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing perishable goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cosmetics

loans.name: Lurdes Eduardo

texts.pt:
Lurdes Eduardo M. is single and does not have any children. She lives in the Marracuene district in Guavea, Maputo Province. She purchases clothing items in South Africa and sells them in Maputo. She delivers the clothing to a group of regular clients and collects payment at the end of each month. She entered the program in February 2006 with an initial loan for 6,000MT. She is on her second loan cycle asking for the same amount which she will use to grow her business. Her business has been growing steadily. In addition to selling clothing she is also now selling products for men.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Lurdes Eduardo M. é solteira e não tem filhos. Vive em Guava, distrito de Marracuene na Província de Maputo.Compra roupas na Àfrica do Sul e vende em Maputo, fazendo entregas a clientes fixos e faz a cobrança do dinheiro no final do mês.Entrou no Programa em Fevereiro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo de empréstimo e vai tomar o mesmo valor o qual pretende aplicar no negócio com vista a reforçar o mesmo.o Negócio verificou ligeiro crescimento, uma vez que para além de roupa que vendia anteriormente vende também fatos para homens, os quais faz entregas para trabalhadores em algumas empresas e recolhe os valores no final do mês.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is 47 years old and is married with one child. The S. family lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Eldar has had his orchard business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy another plot of land so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy land to expand  his orchard.

loans.name: Gbemisola

texts.en: Gbemisola A. is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children. She hails from Ibgolerin, in Lagos State, Nigera. Gbemisola sells foods in her local market to support her family, and has been doing so since 1992. Gbemisola would like a loan of $400 to purchase a wider variety of foods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Sieni Lialiai

texts.en: Sieni is a married mother of 26 years of age. She has two children, aged 2 and 18 months. Sieni and her family had lived on a plantation all their lives, but unfortunately when the taro plight destroyed all the plantations on the island, her husband had no other choice but to look for a job in town. Sieni had always believed that the plantation earned more money than what her husband does. She tried so hard to go back to the plantation and when she heard of SPBD she decided to join so she could get a loan to assist with developing their plantation again. Sieni is very confident that through her first loan she will make a change in the plantation and it will enable her to bring her husband back to work on the plantation.

loans.use: Sieni would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Pathani's Group

texts.en: I am Pathani M.. I have five children, two of whom are married. I am a textile designer, and I create embroidered clothes. I started this business three years ago. My profit ratio is high; for every ten dresses that I create, I earn $150. There are four other members in my loan group: Rubina B. will invest the loan in her clothing business. Mussarat B. needs this loan for the family's electrical appliances shop. Sughran B. and Susi K. require these loans for their embroidery businesses.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a woman that has always promoted family unity and is very aware of this fact. She and her husband started selling wood about six years ago; they buy tree trunks in large quantities and turn them into cut pieces of wood and firewood that they sell. In about 3 hours, Elizabeth and her husband, Clemente, work with an ax and electric chainsaw to cut the wood. Everyday requires much effort as this type of work is very tiring. Their desire to contribute to the academic and professional education of their children aged ten and twelve is their main motivation. For this reason they wish to increase their invested capital in order to buy more wood to convert into firewood for their business. Let us help them with their request so this happy family can continue living a harmonious and tranquil economic life in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una mujer que promueve siempre la unión familiar y está muy pendiente de este hecho. Ella y su esposo instalaron hace unos seis años el negocio de venta de madera, compran troncos en cantidad para luego convertirlos en puntales y leña que ofertan por cantidad, en un tiempo aproximado de 3 horas Elizabeth y su esposo, Clemente, elaboran con su hacha y la ayuda de una sierra eléctrica elaboran trozos de madera, cada día requiere de mucho esfuerzo debido a que esta rutina de trabajo diaria es muy agotadora.Los deseos de contribuir con la formación académica y profesional de sus queridos hijos de 10 y doce años de edad son el mejor motivo de aliento. Por esa razón desean incrementar su capital de inversión a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de madera para convertirlos en leña para su posterior oferta.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta feliz familia siga manteniendo la armonía y tranquilidad económica dentro de su hogar.

loans.use: Influx of capital to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is an energetic 32-year-old mother of a 9-year-old son. Her day is segmented into 3 different selling arrangements. In the morning, she sells cooked plain rice. In the afternoon, she sells oranges. Finally, her long days end, when she sells ice water in the evening.

Faustina wants to use this loan to expand the number of products she can sell. She dreams of having her own shop one day. Now she sells the products by "hawking" them (walking around with the product on her head and selling to passersby).

Faustina's son wants to be a doctor someday, and she is hoping this loan helps her save to fund his education.

Faustina is a member of the trust group Nyame Ho Wo (God Is There). The trust group works on the principle of peer pressure, where each member of the group encourages other members to repay their share of the group loan.

Faustina is pictured shaving the peel off some of her oranges. To her left is Dorothy, her loan officer at Sinapi Aba Trust.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and expand the number of products she can sell

loans.name: Juana Aracelly

texts.es:
Food sales is a very popular business in the Somotillo neighborhood due to the fact that there are a lot of food vendors where the customers can choose according to their taste. For Mrs. Juana A., this is not a problem because she is known as an excellent cook who prepares foods for all preferences, for her customers’ maximum enjoyment.

Despite this situation, Juanita runs into the problem of insufficient funds to purchase the raw materials to make her dishes. For this reason she is requesting Ceprodel’s help to take out a loan which would give her the opportunity to purchase food. In this way, she can continue to sell her dishes, as she is always looking for a way to keep her loyal neighborhood customers satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy popular en el municipio de Somotillo por el hecho de que existen muchas ventas de alimentos en la que el cliente puede escoger según sea su gusto. Para la señora Juana A. este no es una problemática debido a que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera que prepara los alimentos con todo el gusto para que sus clientes los disfruten al máximo.

A pesar de esta situación, Juanita atraviesa la problemática de la insuficiencia económica para adquirir su materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Es por este motivo que ella busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le den la oportunidad de adquirir los alimentos y de esta manera continuar con la comercialización de ellos buscando la manera de mantener siempre satisfecha a su fiel clientela en su municipio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Mata

texts.fr:
Mata K., 42, is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. She has been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank in Vélingara for five years. She would like to purchase peanuts to turn into peanut butter and then sell. Mata has always kept her commitments to her group. Her income allows her to improve her family’s standard of living. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mata K., 42 ans, mariée, 06 enfants en charge dont 04 élèves est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides, les transformer en pâte et vendre. Mata a toujours respecté ses engagements au niveau de son groupe .Ses revenus lui permettent de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Latifgou

texts.fr:
Latifgou M., 39, is married and the father of four children, all of whom are attending school. For 5 years he has been a butcher in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Latifgou hopes to expand his business by purchasing cows, sheep, goats, and pigs, partly to create a herd and partly for slaughter. By doing this, Latifgou will earn more and be better able to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Latifgou M. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Il est un boucher depuis plus de 5 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, Latifgou souhaite accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant des bœufs, des moutons, des chèvres et des porcs pour créer un troupeau et une partie pour l’abattage. Ce faisant, Latifgou gagnera plus et subviendra mieux aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchasing cows, sheep, goats, and pigs

Acheter des bœufs, des moutons, des chèvres et des porcs

loans.name: Benkadi 2 (L’Entente Est Une Bonne Chose Group

texts.fr:
The majority of the women in the Benkadi 2 group are married and, on average, are 22 years old and have two children. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, their husbands’ other wives, and their children in the subprefecture of Konobougou (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). Their business generally consists of selling all types of cloth (especially “Wax” cloth, which is highly sought after, particularly by women in Mali and in West Africa in general), children’s clothing, linens, etc. They were brought together by professional ties. Trusting one another, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are receiving their first group loan. They buy their products in the regional capital, Ségou, and sometimes in Bamako, and then sell them at the market in Konobougou on tables in warehouses to a primarily female clientele. “Wax” cloth is generally bought at 4,000 CFA francs per unit and then sold at 6,000 CFA francs, for a profit of 2,000 CFA francs. Their supplies are renewed monthly or as needed.

Translatde from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Benkadi 2 sont à majorité des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 22 ans et 2 enfants qui vivent dans des familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs époux, coépouses et enfants dans la sous préfecture de Konobougou (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). Elles font généralement le commerce de pagne de toutes sortes (surtout les pagnes Wax qui sont très prisés par les femmes du Mali en particulier et de l’Afrique de l’ouest en générale), de l’habillement pour enfants, de parures, etc. Elles se sont connues par des relations essentiellement professionnelles. Se faisant mutuellement confiance, les membres du groupe décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Elles vont s’approvisionner dans la capitale régionale, Ségou et quelquefois à Bamako pour venir vendre au marché de Konobougou sous des hangars avec des tables, à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. Les pagnes Wax sont achetés en général à 4.000 FCFA l’unité et revendu à 6.000 FCFA, soit une marge bénéficiaire de 2.000 FCFA. Le stock est renouvelé mensuellement ou au besoin.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, linens and various items

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Alima K. is married and has three children in her care. She would like a loan that will enable her to bolster her small business selling diverse food items at the market. This work will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and to provide for their needs. She is going repay the loan all at once at then end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Alima K., est mariée et avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite un prêt qui lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce de denrées alimentaires diverses au marché. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de subvenir à leurs besoins. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in diverse food items for retail sale

loans.name: Mohamed Zakharia's Kwitange Group

texts.en:
Mohamed Z., age 31, is married with 3 children (ages 9, 7, and 4). He has a shop for telephones. He started this business 2 years ago. He works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $270.

Mohamed has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business. He hopes for a new business to increase his stock. Mohamed will share this loan with his subgroup (Kwitange) members, who sell food, fruits, and vegetables and have shops.

In the picture, Mohamed is second from the right in a brown t-shirt.

loans.use: To buy more phones for sale

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Mrs. Nga M., 42, is a farmer and also helps with her husband's business. They have four children, three of whom are in school, while one is married and has moved away from home. Nga is married to Mr. Saroeun Soy, 42, who is a fisherman. Saroeun always goes fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. Recently, Nga has been wanting to expand her business but has lacked the capital to do it. Nga decided to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250) to purchase fishing equipment and more seeds for her rice crop. The loan will increase their income and help keep their family fed. They live in Compongko Commune, Kompong Tom Province.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment and rice seeds

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience E. is 53 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, She makes her living selling beef at Ekiuwa market.  She purchases the beef from the local abattoir.

She is requesting a loan of 52,000, US$450, to purchase more beef to sell. She is indeed very grateful to all kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Hugo Dionisio

texts.en: Hugo is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. He is 66 years old and is married with five children. Hugo sells many different varieties of beer wholesale from his house in the Enace housing complex. He is planning to expand his store to add games.  Hugo is requesting a loan to buy beer and expand his store. He dreams of improving his store and of building a large, full-service restaurant on a plot of land in Canaan.

loans.use: To buy beer for his beer store

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa inició el negocio  por el deseo de trabajar  y salir adelante, de ser una persona independiente con deseos de superación y así poder obtener su propio ingreso para poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Comenzó el negocio en  junio de 2008. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de joyería pero una vecina la  invitó a trabajar con ella en la venta de comida y ahí se dio cuenta de que era buena ganancia por lo que decidió independizarse con ayuda de su mamá.
Poco a poco se han ido incrementando sus ventas entre sus vecinos y conocidos y personas que también van por recomendación a comprar comida a su casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas  para comprar mercancía y algunos activos principalmente utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta como ollas, sartenes, cucharas, platos, etc. y también compra de materia prima como aceite, verduras, fríjol, arroz, etc. para poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because of her desire to work and get ahead. She wanted to be an independent person with a desire to achieve and in that way have her own income to offer a better future for her children. She started the business in June 2008. Beforehand, she used to sell jewelry but a neighbor invited her to work with her selling food and realized there were good earnings in it. She became independent with her mother's help. Slowly, sales have incremented among her neighbors and people that come to buy food at her home by recommendation.

She needs a $225 loan ($3000 MXN) to buy merchandise and some cooking utensils that she needs like: pots, pans, spoons, plates, etc. Also, raw materials like: oil, produce, beans, rice, etc. in order to provide a better service for her customers.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio tiene 47 años de edad, viene conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 12 años, con la que tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en el colegio de su pueblo, viven en su casa propia. Desde muy niño se dedica a las labores agrícolas, asimismo siempre ha criado muchos animales como vacas y toros para el arado de sus tierras y de ese modo sembrar en grandes cantidades. En esta oportunidad ha sembrado 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja, Eusebio prefiere sembrar de la semilla llamada “súper mejorada” que es más resistente a comparación de las otras semillas, y en tiempo de cosecha bota por cada tallo de 4 a 5 vainitas lo que es muy favorable, claro, previo abonado que todo cultivo requiere. Asimismo ha sembrado 60 sacos de semilla de papa, pero esta papa no es para consumo, más bien, es destinada para ser la semilla, para Eusebio es más rentable que vender papa para consumo. También comenta que es muy rentable invertir en la compra de animales grandes, con su primer préstamo de MFP compró una vaca y que ahora ya tiene su cría. Eusebio viene recibiendo un préstamo con MFP por la cuarta vez, y todo este tiempo ha no ha tenido dificultad de pagar en las fechas señaladas, y en este nuevo préstamo se compromete a seguir pagando de forma puntual. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja, cada bolsa cuesta la suma de 600 soles, y el resto del dinero en insecticidas para el fumigado correspondiente.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 47 years old, and has lived with his partner for nearly 12 years with whom he has two children that are studying at the local school. He owns his own home. Since he was a child, he has dedicated himself to farming. In addition, he has always raised livestock such as cows and bulls to help him plow his fields so he can plant in large quantities. Currently, he has planted three sacks of pea seeds. Eusebio prefers to plant a seed called “Super-Improved” which is more resistant than other varieties of seed. During planting season he yields 4 or 5 stalks per hill which is very favorable, having fertilized well first, of course. Likewise, he has planted 60 sacks of potato seed. These potatoes are not for consumption, and are instead destined to become seed which is more profitable for Eusebio. He also tells us that it is profitable to invest in the purchase of large livestock. With his first loan from MFP, he bought a cow and he now has its offspring. Eusebio has received a loan with MFP four times, and the entire time he has not had a problem paying his installments on the designated date. He promises to continue paying this loan on time as well. The funds he requests are for the purchase of three bags of pea seeds, each bag costing 600.00 Peruvian soles. The remainder of the funds will be invested into insecticides to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent A. is 34 years old. She is married with one child. Millicent is into the sale of phone items like phone cards and credits cards. Millicent loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains daily source of livelihood. In Ghana we have communication networks like MTN, Tigo, Kasapa, Zain and Vodafone which was formally Ghana Telecom. She has been selling these cards for years to support her family. Mobile phone cards are purchase by many people due to the number of people who now have access to phones. She has attracted a lot of customers due to the friendly relations she keeps with them. She takes delivery of stock from wholesalers who provide her with a direct supply and retails these products to her customers. This enables her to avoid middlemen, who buy from the wholesalers and retail to her at higher prices. She belongs to a village bank called Yayra. She hopes to receive GH¢800 to make her business grow by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy phone items like phone cards and credits cards

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeun Y. lives in Leap village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She now wants to start a business breeding pigs to earn more income to support her family. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy five piglets and pig food for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sean Pech, is a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Savoeun Y. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El Cliente es propietario de una despensa – carniceria, ademas se dedica a la elaboracion de ladrillos. Esta casado con la Sra. Virginia Baez, tienen 3 hijos menores. Reside en la compañía Santa Rita de San Ignacio.  Destinó el Préstamo para comprar mercaderías despensa, para aprovechar  el incremento  demanda de esta época ya que se esta cosechando arroz y algodón que se cultiva en su zona y hay mayor circulante.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo T. owns a general store/butcher shop and also makes bricks. He is married to Mrs. Virginia Baez, and they have three young children. He lives in the Santa Rita neighborhood of San Ignacio. Currently, the flow of people coming through his area has increased due to the rice and cotton harvesting season, and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity by buying more merchandise to sell in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock general store

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy I. sells bags of Gari and also measures them in smaller quantities for sale to those who can not afford to buy the Gari in sacks. Gari is a grain-like food which is made using cassava. The pills of the cassava are removed and then the cassava is milled and the starch is extracted from the cassava. The cassava dough is then fried into the Gari which is ready for consumption. It is popularly eaten across the country.

Elmina is where her business is located. Dorothy has received primary education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a poultry farmer. Dorothy has been selling bags of Gari since 1999. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of Gari for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a building.

loans.use: To buy bags of Gari for resale.

loans.name: Sodiqdjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Содикджон житель города Куляб. Живет в одном из кишлаков города. Работает на  одном из рынков города. Выпекает лепешки.Пекарня собственная. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить муку , которая даст возможность безперебойно работать. Содикджон женат и имеет троих детей. Возраст 38 лет. Занимается выпечкой лепешек уже 10  лет. Его продукция очень качественная , поэтому у него очень много клиентов, которых он не всегда может обеспечить своей продукцией.
texts.en:
Sodiqdjon M. lives in the town of Kulob in one of the kishlaks (villages) of the town. He works in one of the markets and makes flat breads in his own bakery. He is asking for a loan to buy flour which will allow him to work without interruptions. Sodiqdjon is married and has three children. He is 38 years old. He has been baking breads for ten years now. His product is of very good quality and this is why he has many customers whom he can always supply with his product.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: Inés tiene 33 años, vive con su pequeño hijo y su esposo en casa de su madre. Su deseo de emprender un negocio independiente, y de ayudar en la economía de su hogar la motivó a invertir sus ahorros en la compra de balones de gas, lo cuales vende en la tienda de abarrotes de su madre todos los días, incluyendo los fines de semana. Ya son 3 meses desde que empezó su negocio y ha empezado a ver resultados muy positivos, debido a que sus vecinos siempre le hacen pedidos de balones de gas, ya que es el combustible para sus cocinas y la preparación diaria de los alimentos. Para más adelante, Inés está viendo la posibilidad de abrir un local exclusivo de venta de balones de gas. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, el banco comunal que integra también es nuevo, y ella fue una de las que impulsó su formación con grandes expectativas de crecimiento. El dinero que solicita será para comprar mayor cantidad de balones de gas.
texts.en:
Inés, 33, lives with her small son and her husband in her mother’s house. Her desire to undertake an independent business and to help with the family expenses motivated her to invest her savings in the purchase of gas tanks. She sells the gas tanks everyday, including week ends, in her mother’s grocery store. It has now been three months since she started her business, and she has started to see very positive results. This is due to the fact that her neighbors always order tanks of gas from her because that is what they use in their kitchens and in their daily food preparation. In the future, Inés is looking at the possibility of opening a stand that sells gas tanks exclusively. This is her first loan with MFP. Her community bank is also new, and she was one of the members that started the group with great expectations of growth. The loan is to buy a larger quantity of gas tanks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1044061333) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a general store where she sells both food & daily use products to the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND. These funds will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by H. from TYM Fund. She plans to improve and expand her business with the additional revenue.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Rosa es viuda, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, leña, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.  
Los sueños de Rosa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Banco Comunal Luz Divina. Rosa is a widow. She is 50 years old and has three children. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells groceries, produce, meat, and firewood every day. Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy firewood. Rosa's dreams are to see her children find good jobs, and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: El señor Julián O. M., tiene la edad de 48 años, habita en el barrio San José Los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , todos adolescentes , los cuales estudian y trabajan con el en sus tiempos libres , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 20 años , don  Julián se dedica a la agricultura,  el inicio esta actividad  con ayuda de la reforma agraria , los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder tener una buena producción para vender a buen precio al M.. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras a sus cultivo lo que lograra buenos beneficios.
texts.en:
Julián O. M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife, who works and helps him cover household expenses, in the San José Los Rios neighbourhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. They have three adolescent children who attend school and work in their free time. He plans to improve his family’s living conditions.
Julián has worked in agriculture for 20 years. He started out with the help of agrarian reform. He plans to diversify his crops.
With this loan, he will purchase fertilsers and supplies to produce a good yield to sell at a good price in the market. He thanks AFODENIC for making these beneficial improvements on his farm possible.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and fertiliser

loans.name: Martha Del Pilar

texts.es:
Casada de 37años de edad, madre de tres niños ama de casa, una esposa abnegada comparte el trabajo con su esposo.
Ella y su esposo  dedican su tiempo desde muy temprano a las 3:00 am  ya están de pie en su panificadora situada en el centro de la ciudad de Jipijapa localizada en la provincia de Manabí.

Todos los días ellos desde su casa emprenden la tarea de hornear 400 panes entre sal y dulce, una vez que están saliditos del horno el esposo empieza su recorrido a las 5:00 am   entregando de casa en casa los pedidos de sus clientes, sin duda es una tarea que  requiere de mucha dedicación puesto que la meta de ellos es vender todos los panes que ese día han salido del horno, de lo contrario lo que quede sin vender lo comparten con la familia porque una de las reglas de estos panificadores es que al día siguiente que vuelve la jornada trabajo, la masa(harina) sea fresca ellos nunca han vendido panes del día anterior consideran que eso sería dañar su negocio, perderían clientela.

Martha considera que en estos cuatro años que tienen en el negocio han obtenido grandes satisfacciones dentro del hogar, ya que así han podido estar unidos en familia, también nos comentó que con su trabajo  han podido brindar el estudio a sus hijos, por ello lo que desea ahora es seguir implementando su panificadora e invertir el dinero del préstamo en materia prima como: manteca, harina, azúcar, entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Martha is married and is 37 years old. She is the mother of three children, is a housewife, and is a selfless wife, who works with her husband. She and her husband have a bakery located in the center of the city of Jipijapa in the province of Manabí, and they start working very early in the morning, at 3:00 am. Everyday, they start baking 400 loaves of salty and sweet bread. Once the bread is out of the oven at 5:00 am, her husband begins delivering bread to the houses of their clients to fill their orders. Without a doubt, this is work that requires a lot of dedication because their goal is to sell all of the bread that is produced that day. What is not sold during the day is shared with their family because one of the rules for these bakeries is that the next day, the flour must the fresh. They have never sold day-old bread, since doing this would harm their business. Martha thinks that in the four years that they have had this business, their family has gotten many benefits, because they have been able to work together as a family. She also said that with their work, they have been able to offer an education to their children. Now, she wants to continue implementing her bakery and invest the money from the loan on raw materials, such as butter, flour, and sugar, among other necessary products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy butter, flour and sugar to make bread

loans.name: Las Cariñosa Group

texts.es: El grupo “las Cariñosas” esta representado por la señora Petrona y conformado por 16 socias las cuales van cursando ya su segundo ciclo demostrando honestidad, responsabilidad y  sobre todo ganas de salir adelante; la mayoría de sus miembros se dedican a la venta de comida, pan, dulces en porterías de colegios, leche y a actividades como la confección de prendas de vestir, carpintería, transporte de pasajeros y a la música. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo mercaderías, insumos y materiales para seguir generando mejores ingresos que cada día se traducen en mejores oportunidades para sus familias, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas con la institución.
texts.en:
The group “Las Cariñosas” (The Affectionate Women) are represented by Mrs. Petrona and include 16 members who are beginning their second cycle of loans with honesty, responsibility and over all, the desire to progress. The majority of the members sell food, bread, sweets in stalls near the high school, or milk or they do activities such as sewing clothing, carpentry, driving passengers or playing music. They have a high level of business skills and the members have a lot of business experience. They know how to grow their businesses by offering a variety of products that are of good quality. The loans that they have obtained will be used to increase their working capital so that they can buy merchandise, supplies and materials that with continue to generate more income so that each day they can provide better opportunities for their families. For this they are very grateful for the confidence they have gained by continuing to work with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mrs. Chantrea Khorn Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who all live in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Chantrea K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, who will all use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chantrea K. is 35 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows vegetables.

Mrs. Chantrea K.’s husband, Mr. Chim Phal, is a fisherman. Now he needs a machine to connect to his boat for fishing. Thus, Mrs. Chantrea K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Four members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a machine to connect to her husband's boat for fishing

loans.name: Monica Catalina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza, está formado por un grupo de socias muy unidas, dispuestas a salir adelante ante todas las adversidades de la vida, solidarias entre las compañeras y siempre con una mentalidad positiva irradian alegría en las reuniones quincenales  donde comparten sus vivencias del día a día, viven en  diferentes localidades  de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora Mónica M. vive en el sector Carmen de Sinincay ubicado a unos 45 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, procreó dos hijos: de 5 años y una bebe de 1 mes de nacida, su hijo  estudia en la escuela Francisco Dávila pasó al segundo año de educación básica, su esposo trabaja como taxista en una cooperativa de la localidad; aún no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada de un familiar.
 
Mónica trabaja en su gabinete de belleza desde hace siete años, el local donde atiende es arrendado, nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero hay que  saber agradecer a Dios por todo lo que nos brinda; tiene varios  años de experiencia lo que le ha permitido  llegar a tener su clientela fija.

También nos comenta que gracias a  su trabajo obtiene dinero  a diario para ayudarse con los gastos de su  hogar y  pagar el arriendo del local,  su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a  8 p.m. de lunes a sábados todo el día. 

Este es  su sexto ciclo junto al banco comunal, se siente muy agradecida con la fundación porque le ha permitido  mejorar su negocio, asociarse con otras mujeres  para generar sus propios ingresos y lo más importante cultivar una buena relación de amistad con todas las socias de su banco.

 Con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de productos como: líquidos permanentes, tintes, esmaltes, tratamientos, etc. para mejorar su negocio y brindar un servicio de calidad

El  mayor sueño  de Mónica es  llegar a tener su casa propia y ahí montar su gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) includes a group of members who are very united, willing to continue moving ahead despite the adversities of life. They are partners in solidarity who always have a positive attitude; they radiate happiness in the bi-monthly meetings where they share their everyday experiences. They live in different areas in the City of Cuenca. Señora Mónica M. lives in the Carmen sector of Sinincay, located 45 minutes outside the outskirts of the City of Cuenca. She is 32 years old, married, mother of two children: one who is 5 years old and the other a 1-month old baby. Her older son is studying in the Francisco Dávila school where he has completed his second year of basic education. Her husband works as a taxi driver in a local cooperative. They do not yet have a house of their own; they live in a rented house owned by a relative. Monica has worked in her beauty parlor for 7 years. The premises are leased. She tells us that there are good days and bad days, but one must give thanks to God for everything He provides to us. Her many years of experience have enabled her to develop her clientele. She also told us that thanks to her work she is able to obtain money on a daily basis to help with the household expenses and pay the rent on her parlor. She works from 8am to 8pm from Monday to Saturday each week. This is her sixth cycle with the communal bank. She is very grateful to the foundation because it has allowed her to improve her business, to associate with other women to help generate their incomes, and, most importantly, to cultivate good friendships with all of the members of her bank. With this loan that the ESPOIR foundation is giving her, she is going to purchase products such as: permanent solution, hair dyes, nail enamel, beauty treatments, etc., in order to improve her business and provide quality service. Monica's biggest dream is to have her own house, where she could put up her own beauty parlor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as permanent solution, hair dyes, nail enamels, etc.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is 50 years old and he is married to Myrna M., and they have six children. Marcos is still sending some of his children to school. As a head of the family, Marcos is taking the responsibility to work to be able to provide the needs of his family. He hopes to improve their ways of living through the business he has. Marcos and his family lives in the mountainous village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. 

	Marcos is engaged in hog raising business for many years. He knows that he will not have daily income from raising hogs alone that’s why whenever he has time to does fishing he goes to the river to catch some fish to sell in their village. Aside from this, he is also indulged in producing charcoals which he sells in their village. The income he generates from the businesses that he is currently engaged with is being used to provide his family’s daily needs.

	Marcos hopes to further expand his businesses that's why he would like to obtain a loan of PHP4,000. It will give him a big benefit to improve his business and he hopes someday to engage in a more profitable business.

loans.use: additional capital to expand his hog raising business

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, olluco, habas, y hortalizas como zanahoria, cebolla y arveja. Su esposa es su principal apoyo cuando realiza las diversas tareas del campo, también cría ganado vacuno en un pequeño establo que él mismo implementó en su casa. Por otro lado, los productos que cosecha los vende en el mercado de la ciudad aledaña, de esta manera puede ver los frutos de su esfuerzo, los cuales durante estos años ha consolidado la economía de su hogar y esa es la razón por la que desea intensificar sus cultivos y la adquisición de más animales.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contento de formar parte de su banco comunal, donde se lleva muy bien con todos sus compañeros y compañeras. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y alquiler de un tractor para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 36 years old, lives with his wife and two children in his own home. For 12 years he has worked in agriculture growing potatoes, olluco (an Andean root vegetable), beans and vegetables such as carrots, onions and peas. His wife is his main support when he completes his diverse tasks in the field. He also raises cattle in a small cattle shed that he built next to his house. In addition, he sells the products that he harvests in a market in the city of Aledaña; in this way he is able to see the fruits of his labor. Over the years he has strengthened the economic situation of his household, and this is the reason why he wishes to increase his crops and acquire more animals. This is the second opportunity that he has had to get a loan from MFP, and he is very happy to be a part of his communal bank, where he gets along very well with all of his colleagues. The money that he is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of bags of fertilizer and to rent a tractor for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent a tractor

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai S., 26, is married with two children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, her husband is involved in a business of repairing electronic equipment such as stereos, televisions, and radios. He earns an income of US $6 per day and is the primary source of income for the family to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. S. is a housewife who stays at home, looking after the two young children and the household chores. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more electronic spare parts to expand her husbands business.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline I. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is single. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a service-based transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motor cab services to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide transportation services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation services

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mr. Sony N., 46, and his wife Mrs. Yeang Mok, 42, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1991 and have three children, all of whom are in school.

Sony is a mason in his village and a nearby province. His wife has been a tailor since 1990. He is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase additional clothes and finished silk fabrics for his wife to continue expanding her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes and finished silk fabrics for his wife's business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en: Presentacion V. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, is married, and has nine school-aged children. Presentacion owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Presentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 37 years old. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. She works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Hannah sells groceries by the roadside in her community. She buys her goods in Accra and nearby towns. Hannah has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of dental instruments and products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices. She is 46 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Her eldest child is 20 years old. Her children attend school and during the holidays and weekends, they assist her with sales. 

She has been in this business for 11 years. She hopes to expand her business and attract more customers. She is requesting a loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mi

texts.en:
Mr. Mi T., age 64 year-old and his wife, Mrs. Eun I (pictured together), age 58 year-old, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1974 and have three children: two daughters married and live in separated home and son has full-time employment.  

Mi is a farmer, he grows corn and banana. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.  

Mi is requesting a loan of $400 to pay school fee for his son-in-law who is learning electronic skill.

loans.use: To pay school fee for his son-in-law who is learning electronic skill.

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carla del Socorro M. tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el Mercado Santa Ana en el sector comida, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su financiamiento lo solicito para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles por quintales y un bidón de aceite,  esto lo hizo para no estar comprando poquito por poquito estos productos, anteriormente doña Carla M. solo le ayudaba a su mamá en el negocio pero luego decidio poner su propio negocio ya que tiene que mantener a su hija. La señora M. es madre soltera de una niña en edad escolar por la cual ella se esfuerza para sacarla adelante  abre su negocio  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde su niña cuando sale del colegio le ayuda a entregar las comidas que tiene de pedido.
La señora  Carla M. tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel la cual ahora tiene mas inventario, mejor acondicionado su negocio para sus clientes y a mejorado su casa comprando lo esencial para el hogar
texts.en:
Carla sells food in the Santa Ana market and has been doing this for 20 years. She requested this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, beans, and cooking oil. She does not want to have to buy these items in small amounts. She used to help her mother with a similar business, but later decided to start her own, as she must support her daughter. She is a single mother with a school-aged daughter whom she works to get ahead. She opens her business at 7:00 am and works until 4:00 pm, when her daughter gets out of school. [Her daughter] helps her to deliver the food that the customers have ordered. Carla has been working with CEPRODEL for five years. Now she has a larger inventory and her business is better known. She has also been able to buy necessities for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su conyuge y sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Chepén, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, el inició su negocio alquilando vehículos y luego pudo comprar su propia unidad, actualmente se vale de ella para brindar su servicio en la ciudad de Chepén. Adicionalmente se vale de esta unidad para comercializar forraje todas las mañanas en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad. Estos ingresos son los unicos con los que cuenta para sostener a su familia, por ello trata de dar lo mejor de si para poder mantener estos negocios.

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Carlos es un padre bastante responsable y entregado a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 28 year old husband and father who lives with his spouse and three children. He lives in the city of Chepén, capital of the province of the same name, part of the La Libertad region, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. From the time he was very young, he has offered a passenger and cargo transport service in a motorcycle taxi. He began his business by renting vehicles and later was able to buy his own unit. Presently, he uses it to offer his service in the city of Chepén. In addition, he uses the unit to sell forrage every morning on one of the main avenues of the city. These sources of income are the only support his family has. Because of this, he tries to do his best to maintain these businesses. The continuous use of his mobile unit to offer the service has caused it to undergo some mechanical failures which require urgent repair so it will work properly. This is why, for the first time, it has become necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles that he plans on investing in the repair and maintanence of his vehicle. Carlos is a father who is very responsible and dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to keep growing his business to be able to offer hs family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenence expenses for a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
La socia Balvina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19, 15 años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio ella junto a su pareja, se dedican a la producción y venta de pan,  y al engorde de ganados, La socia compra en la feria la tablada ganados cada cierto tiempo y los cría y engorda después según el tamaño de los mismos los vende o los hace aparear para incrementar sus ganados; La socia solicita el préstamo como parte de capital para comprar un ganadito.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Balvina is a member of the "Las Amistosas" (Friendly Women) village bank. She is from the Urcos District in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco, an hour away from the city of Cusco. Balvina is forty-eight-years-old, and has a common law husband and three children, twenty-one, nineteen, and fifteen-years-old. She alternates her home and business duties. She and her husband earn their living making and selling bread, as well as raising cattle. She periodically buys cattle at the fair, raises them, and fattens them up according to their size. Then she either sells them or breeds them to increase their numbers. Balvina is requesting a loan to use as partial capital to buy a young cow. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to pay it back on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is seeking a loan as partial capital to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Maria Charito's Group

texts.en:
Maria Charito A. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Maria Charito is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maria Charito is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Charito owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maria Charito has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Charito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Charito repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Maria Charito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maria Charito from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk S. and her husband appear in the photo above. This couple earns a living as local cultivators in the village. They live with two single children, while another three are now married and live separately. This rainfall, which is the season for farming a rice crop, Uk S. is lacking some materials for her farming business. Thus, she requests a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for cultivating.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for cultivating.

loans.name: Melania's Group

texts.en:
Melania D. is from the village of Calatunan. She is 52 years old. Melania is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Melania is married. To make a living, Melania owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melania has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Melania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melania has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Melania is requesting a new loan of 43,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Melania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora J. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector in rice production. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling of her own harvested rice. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Nora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living situation of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane L. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of different kinds of vegetables in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Nelly  Lucia

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 52 años de edad reside en el Municipio de San Jorge, departamento de San Miguel, es madre solteras, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 25, 16 y 14, ella tiene una venta de bebidas refrescantes.
El emprendió el negocio por iniciativa propia, tiene experiencia de 10 años en el negocio  y actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de productos para elaborar comida, el compraría pollo, vegetales, especies, arroz, aceite que son necesario, esto contribuirá para generar ingresos, cubrir gastos y necesidades  básicas del familia.
Las aspiraciones de continuar con el negocio, generar ingresos que le permitan apoyar a los tres hijos para estudiar y sacar una carrera universitaria y generarles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly, 52, lives in San Jorge, San Miguel department. She’s a single mother of three children who are 25, 16 and 14 years of age. She sells refreshing beverages. She started her business by her own initiative and has 10 years experience. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients she needs to prepare her meals. She would buy chicken, vegetables, spices, rice and cooking oil which are necessary. This will help to generate income, cover costs and basic family needs. Her goals are to continue with the business, to generate income which will allow her to cover her children’s educational expenses in pursuit of a university education and provide improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, vegetables, spices, rice, cooking oil.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa B. is a married woman who lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, charcoal sales and banana sales. Her husband Romeo, age 59, works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 20 to 35 years old. 

Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 which she intends to use to purchase more bananas so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her granddaughter and to sustain her family's daily needs. Elisa B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join their team.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Pauline Achieng

texts.en:
Pauline is a 29 year old lady married to Paul jura, who sells spare parts of motor vehicles in Kisumu. He supports the family by paying the rent and school fees, and purchasing food. They have two children aged six years and four years. Pauline runs E.C.D. Nursery school in Kisumu. She has been in this business for two years and receives an income of Kshs. 9,000 per month.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend, who is also client of KADET. She is applying for her first loan of Kshs.10,000 with KADET to buy desks and cement for the floor of the school. She plans to use business profit to pay back the loan, and also to grow the business.

Pauline plans to have a stable school for all levels of education that will enable financial sustainability.

loans.use: To buy desks and cement for the floor

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda M. is from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Yolanda is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Yolanda plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Yolanda sells her harvested products using a jeepney. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nosir

texts.en:
