Nosir H., 27, is married and has two children. He lives in Shahristan and works in the agricultural industry. Five years ago he decided to cultivate the land he owned. He did so to generate more income so he could support his family. Nosir grows wheat, corn, and vegetables, which he carefully tends so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy seed and fertilizer that will enable him to improve his production yield. Nosir enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans so he can improve his farm and become a better farmer. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Tajikistan has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Today Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and manufacturing, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have the opportunity to develop viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jescar

texts.en:
Jessica has operated a vegetable stall selling Sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and fruits for over eight years. She sells her wares to her neighbors and local restaurant operators. Jessica's primary challenge is high transport costs. She hopes to open a retail shop and a grocery in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits as well as construction materials for the expansion of her vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable repayments rates and good loan products.      

Jessica and her husband have one child who is still young for school. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and transport costs.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits as well as construction materials for the expansion of her vegetable stall

loans.name: Yutachi Group

texts.es:
El grupo "YUTACHI",se ubica en el poblado de S. Jamiltepec Oaxaca, Mexico,. El nombre de este grupo esta enlengua mixteca, que significa "El arroyo(rio) de los abuelos,yuta es igual a rio y chi quiere decir abuelo, decidieron ponerle este nombre a su grupo ya que el lugar llanado yutachi que es el pozo de agua; se encuentra cerca del  punto de reunion del grupo, y tambien en honor a sus ancestros.Son 11 personas las que integran al grupo, junto con su representante que sellama, Anastacia N. M..
En esta ocacion hablaremos de la señora Esther Leonor Baños J. , ella integra este grupo, tiene 46 años cumplidos, es casada y su esposo se llama Lorenzo de 50 de edad, quien se dedica al oficio de la talabarteria y el campo, actualmente llevan 22 años de casados procrearon  a 4 hijos, dentro de los cuales tres estan con vida y uno ya fallecio de nombre Josefina(+)quien era la tercera hija de esta familia, y murio por complicaciones de salud y atencion medica especializada,producto de la pobreza y desigualdad de la sociedad, actualmente existen Alejandro de 21 años, Felipe de 19 y Joel de 11 años de edad y que cursa la educacion secundaria. Doña Esther curso solamente la educacion primaria.
Esther utilizo el prestamo que le otorgaron para la adquisicion de material que utiliza para la elaboracion de sus bordados artesanales que son bolsas de mano, carteras,blusas,servilletas y manteles que los elabora utilizando un numero de puntadas diferentes como son, el punto de cruz,trenza margarita, pata de gallo, rococo, estrella,de cadena y el la complicada tecnica del deshilado en punto de cruz y el bordado de blusas con piedras de chaquiras. Entre la gran lista de materiales utilizados para este hermoso trabajo destacan los siguientes; tela lino panama,manta, tergal,manta hilada a mano,hiulos varios como es el hilo de algodon, estambre para bordado, hilo iris vela y de algodon el colores distintos, descocedor, piedras de chaquiras, aros para boradar y agujas en distintos tamaños. Ella inicio desde hace mas de cuatro años debido a la necesidad propia de superacion economica.
Su mas grande sueño de esther es integrar un gran numero de personas que vivan en condiciones extremas de pobreza, para enseñarles todo lo que ella sabe si distincion alguna de sexo ni credo, esto on el fin de promopver el autoempleo para las mas bulnerables que son las mujeres y la clase indigena, otra de sus metas es que otras personas conoscan sus artesanias, promoverlas  e impulsaralas para tener mas ingresos economicos y desta manera hacer crecer su proyecto, asi como el apoyo para la educacion de sus hijos.
Esther actualmente se ha dedicado de pllenop a la capacitacion de mas personas para el tarbajo por medio de una dependencia social llamada ICAPET asi como el programa gubernamental poara los indigenas llamada CDI,esto es muestra de que a pesar de la gran desigualdad social todavia existen personas que sueñan, que estan haciendo algo y que su gran compromiso es el amor hacia los demas.
Ella nos dice habla con estas apalbras," le agradesco afundacion realidad por confiar en los pobres, por ayudar aliberarnos de esas cadenas que nos atan llamada pobreza, y por confiar en un sector abandonado y que nadien nos voltea a ver, gracias por todo y DIOS les bendiga siempre.
las que integran el grupo son las siguientes personas y sus actividades:
SALUSTIA T. M.-   TIENDA DE ABARROTES
VICTORINA G. M.-     VENTA DE ROPA
GAUDENCIA M. H.- COCINA ECONOMICA
JOVITA N. P.-        VENTA DE QUESOS
DIVINA ALBINA M. S.-ELABORACION DE PAN
ADELA M. R.-            VENTA DE PRFUMES 
ROSALIA V. M.-       ELABORACION DE PAN
ANASTACIA N. M.-   TIENDA DE ABARROTES
ESTHER LEONOR B. J.-   ELABORACION DE ARTESANIAS
YURELI A. M.-            VENTA DE PAN
MARIA ELENA G. M.-    VENTA DE ROPA
texts.en:
The “YUTACHI” group is located in S. Jamiltepec Oaxaca, Mexico.  The group's name is in the Mixtecan language and means “The stream (river) of the grandparents”.  'YUTA' means 'stream (river)' and 'CHI' means 'grandparent'.  They decided to give the group this name since the town of Yutachi is near the group's meeting point, and also to honor of their ancestors.  There are 11 people in the group, together with their representative who is called Anastacia N. M..

On this occasion we will talk about Mrs Esther Leonor Baños J. who is a member of this group.  She is 46 years old and married.  Her husband is called Lorenzo and he is 50 years old.  He works as a belt maker and as an agricultural worker.  They have been married for 22 years and have had 4 children.  Three of their children are still alive.  Josefina(+), who was their third child, died from health complications and lack of specialized medical care.  This was a result of the poverty and inequality of society.  Their remaining children are Alejandro, 21; Felipe, 19 and Joel who is 11 and is pursuing his secondary education.  Esther only studied at elementary level.

Esther used the loan which they were awarded to acquire material to use for making her hand-made embroideries.  She makes handbags, wallets, blouses, napkins and tablecloths using a number of different stitches such as cross-stitch, 'trenza margarita', 'pato de gallo', rococo, star, chain, the complicated technique of openwork in cross stitch and the embroidery of blouses with seedglass beads.  Among the long list of materials which she uses for this beautiful work are the following: Panama linen, cotton skirting, tergal (a synthetic fibre containing polyester),  hand-spun cotton, different threads such as cotton thread, worsted for embroideries and 'iris vela' thread, all in different colors, stitch unpickers, seedglass beads, embroidery hoops and different sized needles.  She started her business more than four years ago owing to her own need for financial improvement.

Esther's biggest dream is to gather together a large number of people who live in conditions of extreme poverty, to teach them everything that she knows without distinction of sex or creed.  She would like to promote self employment for the most vulnerable who are women and indigenous people.  Another of her goals is for other people to find out about her crafts and promote them so that she can make more profits and, in this way, help her project grow as well as provide support for her children's education.

Esther is currently working hard on training more people to work through a social office called ICAPET as well as the governmental program for indigenous people called CDI.  This shows that despite the great inequality of society, there are still people who dream, who are doing something and that their great commitment is their love towards other people.

She tells us to speak with these words, “I am grateful to Fundación Realidad for trusting in the poor, for helping to free us from these chains which bind us called poverty and for believing in an abandoned sector of society who nobody turns to see.  Thank you for everything and God bless you forever”.

The following is a list of the members of this group and their business activities:

Salustia T. M. – Grocery store
Victorina G. M. – Clothes sales
Gaudencia M. H. – Affordable meals
Jovita N. P. – Cheese sales
Divina Albina M. S. – Bread making
Adela M. R. – Perfume sales
Rosalia V. M. – Bread making
Anastacia N. M. – Grocery store
Esther Leonor Baños  J. – Making handicrafts
Yureli A. M. – Bread sales
Maria Elena G. M. – Clothes sales

loans.use: To buy materials for making handicrafts such as; Panama linen, cotton skirting, tergal, seralon thread, cotton, seedglass beads, skein of Vela thread, silk thread, unpickers, embroidery hoops and fasteners

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas C. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old and is married. Sabas owns & operates an agricultural  business, planting and harvesting Jackfruit for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Sabas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his eighth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Renan Alonso

texts.es:
Renan de 40 años,  es taxista informal. Vive con su esposa y dos hijo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Por la falta de oportunidades compro un carro para convertirlo en taxi informal y poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 4 años. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am recorriendo las calles de todo Guayaquil y cobrando por viaje desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 10.00. Unos de los inconvenientes es trabajar en las noches debido al índice muy elevado de la delincuencia. 

Para seguir trabajando en su carro él quiere comprar unos repuesto para su carro. En el futuro quiere comprar otro taxi para tener más ingresos y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Renan is 40 years old and works as a gypsy cab driver.  He lives with his wife and two children, ages 2 and 4,  in an urban area called Guasmo, which is mostly inhabited by merchants.  

For a lack of opportunities, he bought a car to convert into a gypsy cab and support his wife and two children.  He currently works until 7:00am, driving through all of the streets of Guayaquil.  He charges between $1 and $10 per trip.  One of the inconvenient things about working at night is the high level of crime.

With this loan, he would like to purchase parts for his car.  In the future he would like to buy another taxi to earn more income and give his children a better life.

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a groundnuts sales business for the past three years, selling in a shop and from door to door to her neighbours and school age children.  Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to establish a food stall in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan she wants to purchase two sacks of ground nuts for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Angel Leocadio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Angel Leocadio; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros y también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el socio atiende el negocio de venta de repuestos carros desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the village bank "Los Andenes", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Angel Leocadio is 55 years old and married with two children.  He alternates his daily activities between his business selling replacement car parts and raising guinea pigs.  He works at the car parts business from 9am until 6pm.  He wants to improve his business and is asking for a loan to buy car parts. 

He is very happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy car repair parts

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor Z. and his wife live in Kahovka, in the Kherson region. Their children are grown and live separately. Igor runs a small mobile business selling construction and remodeling supplies in several marketplaces in neighboring small towns. He has been working in this niche of trade for 15 years. Currently, he has 87,000 Grivnas in working capital.

Igor is focused and determined. His experience working in the construction and remodeling spheres helps him to be very organized and efficient in his business. Igor is hoping to see the number of construction sites in the Ukraine increase, which would subsequently stimulate development of his venture. He is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase additional construction supplies for retail sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction supplies

loans.name: Basran's Group

texts.en:
Basran is very supportive in nature. She always ready to help her family in their time of need. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her son’s shoe-selling business. Her son’s shop is located in the market where he sells ladies' and children's shoes to his customers. With the loan, he will buy shoes of different varieties and will display them at his shop. He has 10 years of experience in his business and Basran is hopeful that a loan investment will bring more profits to him. 

Basran herself is a seamstress and sews clothes for her community clients. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. She also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. 

Her husband’s name is A. A. and he is also involved in shoe sales. Basran has given birth to four sons and two daughters. Three of her sons operate a shoe sales business while the others are getting their education. Shoe sales has become their family business since most of the members of her family are involved in the same profession. 

Basran is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She comes from Arifwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its dairy industry. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Basran.

loans.use: To buy shoes for shoe-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase items for her husband's general store

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Harriet has a business selling motor vehicle spare parts, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Harriet hopes to be self-reliant and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua G. is divorced. She cooks "banku" (made from corn) at Abura near Watreso in Cape Coast. Ekua wants to add the cooking of other foods to the "banku" she is preparing and so is asking for a loan to buy foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, etc. to cook to sell. She would like to open a big restaurant some day so she will save her new profit towards that goal.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, etc. to cook to sell.

loans.name: Rina Lequipe Euladia

texts.es:
La señora Rina Lequipe Audalia Viuda D. R. tiene 58 años D. edad y vive en una casa D. su propiedad vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio luis espinal D. esta ciudad D. Tarija. Rina es madre  D. 5 hijos, por circunstancias D. la vida se quedo sola por el fallecimiento D. su esposo pero como su esposo trabajaba en una empresa le dejo una renta que ahora ella  cobra cada mes. Ahora todos sus hijos son mayores D. edad e independientes. Rina se dedica desD. hace 1 año a vender en una tienda D. barrio en la cual venD. abarrotes,  Rina quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante , pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprarse mercaderia para su tienda, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra D. mas mercaderia que es muy nesesario para realizar su actividad para D. ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Rina  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones D. vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones D. su casa donD. vive.
texts.en:
Rina Lequipe Audalia D. R. is 58 years old and a widow.  She lives in her own home which is located in Luis Espinal neighborhood, in the city of Tarija.  She has 5 children.  Rina was left on her own when her husband died but, as he worked for a company, she was left an income which she collects every month.  All of Rina's children are now grown up and live independently.

For one year, Rina has been selling groceries from her neighborhood store.  She would like to make better profits in order to get ahead in life.  Rina tells us that she would like to buy merchandise for her store.  She already has experience in this field and the loan will be used to buy merchandise that she really needs in order to carry out her work and increase her income.

Rina says that she would like to improve her living conditions.  For this reason, she tells us that the next loan she requests will be used to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to have operating capital for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel V. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old Maribel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. V. has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, V. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase products for her General store. This will be the 1st loan taken out by V. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store such as shampoo

loans.name: Yanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Yanna H. (pictured above) is 39. She is hired by her villagers to put together fabric swatches for clothing manufacturers. Her husband, Mr. Ruos Reang, is 41. He is a tuk-tuk driver. Unhappily, his tuk-tuk broke down and did not work well, so he decided to sell it. He hopes to apply for a loan--to use with the money from selling his old tuk-tuk--in order to purchase a new one. That’s why Yanna is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to help with her husband's purchase. 

The couple has been married since 1995. They have three children--two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk-tuk for her husband

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Restaurateur depuis 10ans Kodjo tient son café dans un secteur de la capitale, jeune père de famille de 27 ans il sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner sur place   en nourriture de base. Il aime son métier et voudrait l’élargir plus tard.
texts.en: A restaurant-owner for ten years, Kodjo runs his café in an area of the capital. At 27 years old, he is a young father. He is requesting this first loan to locally procure basic food supplies. He loves his work and would later like to expand.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Karina Melisa

texts.es:
Karina es madre de familia  de 20 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y esposo en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope a unos 45 minutos de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona con actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Karina  se dedica hace 2 años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos, patos y gallos), tiene su corral en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales,  una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más animales y alimentos balanceados para sus aves de corral, al tenerlas bien alimentadas puede ofertarlas a un mejor precio a sus clientes, lo que le permitiría tener más efectivo para poder pagar el crédito y darles una mejor calidad a su familia.  Karina es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del distrito donde vive y que el sueño que se ha trazado es el poderle dar una profesión a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Karina es madre de familia  de 20 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y esposo en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope a unos 45 minutos de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona con actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Karina  se dedica hace 2 años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos, patos y gallos), tiene su corral en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales,  una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más animales y alimentos balanceados para sus aves de corral, al tenerlas bien alimentadas puede ofertarlas a un mejor precio a sus clientes, lo que le permitiría tener más efectivo para poder pagar el crédito y darles una mejor calidad a su familia.  Karina es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del distrito donde vive y que el sueño que se ha trazado es el poderle dar una profesión a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.

loans.use: Compra de más aves de corral y su respectivo alimento

loans.name: Filchester

texts.en:
Filchester is a-26 year-old farmer in Mocag Baggao, Cagayan, where he has lived for two years. He is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy rice and corn varieties. Every harvest, Filchester is able to generate the average net income of PHP50,000 in corn. This income is used to expand his farm land area. 

He is married and soon will have his first child. He is so excited and hoping for a healthy baby. Filchester says he will work harder for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn varieties to plant.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. Keo has been selling a variety of types of fish at the market for years. She normally earns an income of $3 per day. She is married and has five children. Two of her children are employed and share their salary. Besides this, Keo and her husband plant rice crops according to the seasons, the rainy season and the dry season. Currently, their fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. For this reason, Keo has requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment. She will use the remainder of the loan funds to plant a rice crop.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment and to plant a rice crop.

loans.name: Romel

texts.es: El señor Romel trabaja como  chofer de minibús de transporte de pasajeros en el sindicato San Cristóbal de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor, pues así mantendrá en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Vino Tino en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito anterior  que obtuvo también a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Romel works in the city of La Paz’s San Cristobal Transportation Syndicate as a minibus driver transporting passengers.  He needs the loan to buy a motor to keep his vehicle in good working order.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Vino Tinto zone.  He’s married and has a son.  He is very satisfied with the previous loan that he also got through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his minibus.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom is the big head of a family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For improving his financial status, he works driving a motorbike in this province everyday. He can earn about $3 per day to give to his wife. His wife isn't lazy, she works raising animals like ducks, chickens and pigs. They have birthed five kids; a big family, very happy. To assist their efforts, Mr. Prom wishes to borrow some funds to sponsor his family, about $1,000, in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene la edad 24 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo . Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de almacigo para su plantación de café. Ella cuenta con un terreno para sembrarlo de café y pretende invertir en mano de obra e insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener un buen resultado. Ella quiere implantar un cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  familiar  y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She intends to use this loan to buy supplies to make a seedbed for her coffee plantation. Rosibel has a plot of land for growing coffee and plans to invest in labor and supplies, such as compost and fungicides, so that she can obtain good results. She wants to have a coffee farm that has good output so that she can sell a quality product. Rosibel wants to generate more revenue so that she can provide for the welfare of her family and grow her coffee venture.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Rosibel has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing coffee and to pay for labor.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jeseck

texts.en:
Jeseck is 42 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has been in the business for six years and he has managed to employ two people.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could access financial resources easily.  He used his previous loan to boost his business.  He has also become more financially literate because he has been trained in financial management.

Jeseck hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 43 years old and is married. She has three children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband have run a general store at their horse for five years. They sell milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery. Hanh intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell in her store such as eggs, sugar, and personal sanitary items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic products and foods such as eggs, sugar, and sanitary items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
Jilani is a married man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past eight years, he has operated a shoe designing business,  selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing materials in his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a machine for shoe designing. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for shoe designing.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 25 years old, is working in a cigarette company earning $7 per day. His wife has a pretty salon (a beauty shop) at home and earns $6 per day. The couple does not yet have any children. Every month, Vanna has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, and $49 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for transporting cigarettes to sell. The rest of the money, he will spend to extend his wife’s shop. In the future, he wants to extend his wife's shop so that she can provide more services to her customers and earn a better income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Antonio Edalberto

texts.es:
Antonio Edalberto tiene 48 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive  con la esposa y con los tres hijos de veinte, catorce y dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos.Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá  comprar semilas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y podrá sembrar maíz, arroz y cosechar para tener utilidades.
El sueño es poderse comprar un carro.En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol y salir con la familia a pasear.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Antonio Edalberto, 48, is married and has three children.  He lives with his wife and three children who are 20, 14 and 2 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Nueva Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Guamayacu belonging to Echeandía Canton.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

He used the previous loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to keep his crops in good condition.

Relations in his family have improved because now he’s able to contribute a bit more toward family wellbeing.  At work he’s doing much better because production has increased and income has risen quite a bit because he earns more income when he sells his products.  
Support from the previous loan has helped him improve himself and he didn’t have any problem making his installment payments as established by the communal bank.

This new loan will be of much help because he’ll be able to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer and manure and will be able to plant corn and rice and to harvest to earn profits.

His dream is to be able to buy a car.  During his free time he likes playing soccer and going out on family excursions.  He is very grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children.

Since 2000, Mohamad has been an owner of a food market that sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to paint his market’s walls and to add more foodstuffs. He wants to earn more profit in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint his market’s walls and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jiael

texts.en:
This is Jiael, 26, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jumar, 34, a timekeeper. She is also the mother of one child who is now in grade IV. While attending to her husband and child, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband pay for the family's daily expenses. 

Jiael is a bayong maker. Bayong is a native bag in the Philippines made of rubberized plastic and hand woven. Jiael makes different sized bags depending on the request of clients in the market and malls. She also creates different designs such as square, triangle, and oblong. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more raw materials. With the Christmas season fast approaching, her numerous customers will place many orders for bayong to be used as fruit trays and vanity kits. 
  
Jiael hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that will provide for the needs of her family. She dreams that she can continue making bayong and attending to her family needs at the same time. She hopes that her family will remain simple and happy. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to have time in reading Bible verses and understand the sacrifices of our Christ Jesus. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Vickie

texts.en: Vickie is married with no children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Vickie is a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional feed for the pigs. Vickie has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9, 3 y 7 meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura para el ciclo corto y comprar insumos agrícolas. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar semillas. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. 

El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 31 years old, in a common-law marriage, and lives with his wife and three children (ages 9, 3, and 7 months) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Juan Manuel is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Juan Manuel is a farmer who has been growing corn for five years. He buys and sells in Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be invested in short-cycle farming, so he plans to buy agricultural supplies. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to buy seeds. At the moment, he is not encountering any problems. His dream is to have his own land.

In his free time, Juan Manuel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 22 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is  single and has a 1-year-old child.

For the past  four years, Victoria has been selling slippers in the local market. She makes a lot of money during the dry season,  especially during holidays. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers cartoon(Lady Slippers )  for her business. She plans to build a house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers  for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Gloria es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy  fáciles para conseguir. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad que estudian en  escuela y colegio. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, en la cual vende desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en Montecristi y Manta aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Lleva en su tienda ya por 5 años y le va bien ya que dia a dia trata de mejorarla.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, which is known for the diversity of its typical products such as the well-known Panama straw hat, the communal bank "Mi Banquito" meets every two weeks.

Mrs. Gloria is a founding member of the group which she likes because the loans are easy to obtain.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 14 and 7 who are in school.  Her husband is an artisan who works with ivory palm.

She has a store set up in her home where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents and even Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and some times even later.  She buys her products in Montecristi and Manta although most of the products are delivered.  She has been in business for five years and it going well since she tries to improve it everyday.

The loan she has requested will be used to restock the store.  She plans to buy basic goods, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

Her goal is to continue her business and keep expanding the store.

loans.use: To buy basic goods, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio con la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos hace 10 años poco fue aumentando su negocio e invirtiendo en otros productos como cuajadas, queso, crema, leche agria y fritanga. Ella invertirá el crédito en frijoles, maíz, leña, aceite, plátano…etc. Con el propósito de salir adelante y mejorar cada día màs.
texts.en: Yadira is a hardworking, enterprising woman who started selling tortillas and cooked beans ten years ago.  Gradually her business grew and she invested in other products like cuajadas [Nicaraguan white cheese], cheese, cream, sour milk and fried fast food.  She will use her loan to buy beans, corn, firewood, oil, bananas, etc. aiming at getting ahead and improving more each day.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, firewood, oil, bananas, etc.

loans.name: G.s.  Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Unidas está conformado por 2 emprendedoras  que viene trabajando con Fundación león 2000 desde hace tiempo, son excelente clientes en el cual han demostrado ser una personas responsable y con deseos de superación, ellos mismos se motivan y se apoyan entre ellos para salir adelante, ya que ambos tiene sueños de ver su negocio bien surtidos de productos. Maura Estela es una miembro de este grupo solidario en el cual su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a una pulpería, actualmente está solicitando  financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, jabón, aceite, pasta de dietes, desodorante, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" is comprised of two entrepreurs who have been working with Fundación León 2000 for some time.  They are excellent clients and have proven themselves to be responsible and determined to get ahead.  They motivate and support each other in their efforts and both want to see their businesses well stocked with a variety of products.

Maura Estela is one of the members and she has a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soap, oil, toothpaste, deodorant and other items.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soap, oil, toothpaste, deodorant and other items.

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec FANTA la personne au milieu sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Anachlet

texts.en:
Anachlet is 38 years, Baker and motorcycle transporter at Kilifi Kenya. He is a father of five who has been in this businesses for the last three years doing well.

This is his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his businesses, he will use the money to purchase wheat flour, sugar,yeast and cooking fat in his bakery and the anticipated profit to expand his bakery business. He hopes to own a large bakery in future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar,yeast and cooking fat
